Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, gorgeous macaroons and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Gillyh13
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend Hotel du Cadran highly enough. I travelled with my husband for a long weekend and we wanted something a bit better than a budget hotel but not to spend crazy amounts. I knew to expect high prices and small rooms so was delighted to find Cadran was not overpriced and that the Superior Room that we booked was a good size. We were fortunate to have a view of the Eiffel tower from our room and found lots of lovely restaurants and foodie heaven on Rue Cler, the bakery on the corner of Rue Champs de Mars has the best Pain au Raisin imaginable All of the staff we met were cheerful and friendly and on the second day when we returned to the hotel mid afternoon to find it was being cleaned we were treated to drinks and macaroons whilst we waited. All in all the hotel was a fantastic base in Paris, close enough to all the sights but not too busy or noisy. We will definitely return to Paris and the Hotel du Cadran

Reviews.Title: “Short visit”
Reviews.Author: PJFo72
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at du Cadran with my family, 3 girls and us parents. We had the Junior suite located at the ground flor, not too much space but enough for our family. This hotel has a great location, close to everything, 10 min walk to the Eiffel tower. Quiet quarters, we slept well even thou we had our room next to the street. Lovely shops and bakerys just next to the hotel. I will rekomend this place to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: marcy n
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. A short walk to the Eiffel Tower and rue Cler. Lots of nice restaurants in the area. Clean hotel. Breakfast was included and very good. We stayed in the junior suite for a family of 5. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Updated rue Cler Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmynatt
Reviews.Content: If you just MUST stay near the rue Cler like all the other Americans then this is a good choice. Everything is updated and modern. The attached Macaroon/chocolate store is very upscale with prices to match. Our rate included breakfast so it made our night's stay the exact same price as staying across the street at the Hotel du Champ de Mar. So we cancelled there and stayed here instead. The rooms are typically tiny and modernly furnished. I wonder why no reviews ever mentioned the window in the bathroom that looks out into the bedroom? It's a big window with frosted glass on the lower half. The bathroom door slides closed and doesn't latch or fit snugly like a typical door. So if you're worried about any sounds emanating from the bathroom - this may not be the hotel for you. Over all I liked it. The breakfast room downstairs was really hot and stuffy and rather chaotic. There are 2 machines that supply hot water/coffee/hot choc/ etc and attempting to figure them out can be rather complicated. I'd rather not have to waste my vacation time attempting to figure out how to use the machines. The front desk workers were extremely nice and always smiling. This is a good choice for your hotel if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back”
Reviews.Author: BARTWEIN
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned fom a 2 night 3 day trip to paris where we stayed at the Hotel DuCadran Tour Eiffel. Whenever we will return to Paris we definitely will consider staying at the hotel again. The room was immaculate, the location was superb - we walked to the Eiffel Tower in about 15 minutes, the breakfast was fine (croissants were heaven) and the people at the desk were more than excellent. We have nothing but high positive feelings for the entire stay there. If you want to stay in that part of Paris and it is quite lovely there, we recommend this hotel completely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but late check in”
Reviews.Author: Sugiato
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to shops, restaurants, metro and short walk from eiffel tower. This is a boutique hotel style with modern interior design, room & bathroom is small as per Paris standard but clean and modern. There are many restaurants and bakery in the area so it is easy to find food that suits your budget, and dont have to pay for the overpriced breakfast at the hotel. The downside of this hotel is the late check in time at 2pm, so if you are coming into Paris in the morning, you cannot get your room until exactly 2pm! Also the free wi-fi sounds good but there are no wi-fi coverage at some floor, the signal is very weak if not detected at all.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommended - Warm comfort, Great location”
Reviews.Author: beagle16
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Cadran is a fine hotel with many favorable aspects. The location is excellent. It is a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower and in the Rue Cler neighborhood. It is close to the Quai Branly Museum and the Trocadero. There are excellent local markets and wonderful streets for walking surrounded by restaurants, shopping and a nice local atmosphere. It is close to three Paris metros - L'Ecole Militaire, La Tour Mauborg and La Motte Picquet - that makes transportation within Paris quite easy. The hotel itself has a warm comfort about it and the staff has always been friendly and helpful. Connected to the hotel is a chocolatier shop which adds to the charm of the environment. Hotel du Cadran has free internet and the rooms are clean with good lighting both natural (nice windows overlooking the local streets) and modern in-room lighting. Some (not all) rooms have nice deep bathtubs for evening soaks after a long day of walking and sightseeing. The breakfasts are in the underground basement in a nice atmosphere and self-serve food - boiled eggs, cereals, meats, breads. Make certain to negotiate to have the breakfast included with the room or the added expense is not worth the cost since there are many eating opportunities down the block. I have stayed at the Hotel du Cadran for many years and it is a very enjoyable and reasonable hotel. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem - Oh Oui !”
Reviews.Author: rosieenglish
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little boutique hotel, hidden away near Rue Cler, amongst the fromageries, florists and cafes. Its nice to be a little off the beaten track away from the touristy stuff. The Eiffel tower is less than a 10 min walk and can be seen from some of the rooms. we stayed four nights in a twin room. The room was clean and fresh, tastefully furnished, the beds were comfortable. Towels and toiletries were generous, nice bathroom with drench type shower head.great TV and free wifi. Staff always polite and helpful. Quaint little breakfast room which offered a continental type of breakfast. also lift to all floors. Good value for money - I honestly cant find any faults with this lovely little hotel. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel offering good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Honeycomb81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel cadran for four nights and found it very comfortable. It was small, like most Paris hotels, but had everything we needed. It was located slightly away from most of the key attractions in Paris but with the metro, that wasn't a huge problem. The neighbourhood it was located in felt very cosy and had several supermarkets, restaurants and bakeries nearby. The bakery called Ronde des Pains near the hotel was perfect for breakfast if you did not really want to go for the fare in the hotel. The apple pie there was the best we had in Paris! The restaurants around the hotel were always full when we looked but we have never tried any of them. The staff were nice and helpful. We also liked that it was extremely modern and clean. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome dÃ©cor & design, even better location!”
Reviews.Author: Ashraf I
Reviews.Content: Had a 2-night (weekend) stay at the Hotel du Cadran in late-Feb 2012. I can't praise the hotel enough. Granted, the rooms are not the biggest you will come across they are in no way, shape or form uncomfortable. However, what it lacks in room size (debatable), it more than makes up in service, modernity, dÃ©cor, cleanliness and, most importantly, location. As countless other reviewers have said - you're a stones throw away from the Eiffel Tower and a second throw away from Champ-Ã‰lysÃ©es. And a huge mention has to go out to the staff throughout the hotel, who all were nothing but polite & incredible helpful. The breakfast, which was included in our package so I'm not sure of cost, was a buffet style continental selection which was also great.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to spend 6 great nights in Paris in mid Febuary 2012 and choose this hotel. We got a great price and a great location. Especially when you open your bedroom curtains and u look over to the Effiel Tower. The room is not the largest but you should expect that in Paris. The bathroom was very nice and more roomier than you would think. Nice shower with two shower heads. Never ran out of hot water either. Check in was quick and easy. We were actually early but our room was ready so got checking in right away. Metro is less than a five minute walk from the hotel. It is surrounded by cafes, wine shops, bakeries and cheese shops. All the things you need in Paris. Next time we are in Paris we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean with a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: A great little modern hotel, in quiet spot near Invalides and Champ de Mars (The Eiffel Tower). The staff were friendly and had great English. The room was a little small and has no tea prep, but hey this is Paris... so don't let that put you off. There is a small chocolate bar on the ground floor, with fantastic macaroons.... not cheap but go on - treat yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Faamb121
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2011 for two nights when we visited Paris for the weekend. The location is perfect as it is a short walk from the Eiffel tower and the Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es is also within walking distance. Another plus point was that there were cafes and patisseries around the hotel - perfect for breakfast. The room and bathroom were clean, although quite small. The staff were friendly and cheerful. Would definately recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KittyC93
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Du Cadran for 2 nights in Jan. The staff were friendly and helpful, despite our poor French and the hotel itself was really nice. Modern, quite small but they had definitely made the most of the space available. Rooms were nicely done, comfy bed and strong shower. It was a pretty compact room but for 2 nights with one medium bag it was no problem for us. Very close to Eiffel Tower and metro station plus some cafes / bakeries and restaurants just outside. Good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best three days of my life....”
Reviews.Author: Richey01
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Cadran played its part in providing me with a wonderful three day stay in Paris. Rooms beautiful and clean, staff attentive and kind, and the location of the establishment is spot on. Both my best friend and I loved it. Loads of cafes and restaurants, with the best ones being 'Cafe Constant' and 'Fontaine du Mars' within 10 minutes walk of the Cadran. I will certainly return......

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spot, great staff”
Reviews.Author: auralay99
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a weekend in Paris at the Hotel Du Cadran. It was a very modern new hotel & very clean with lovely little touches. The staff were lovely and gave us maps and tips for exploring the area, there was no problems storing bags as we arrived early and in the evening they directed us to a lovely little local restaurant called Leo le Lion just around the corner from the hotel. The meal was fabulous and very authentic. There is a lovely boulangarie across from the hotel and a supermarket across the road. The hotel is ideal for anyone wanting to pottering around Paris, close to the Eiffel Tower and a metro station. It was about a 20min metro ride from Gare du Nord. The rooms were quiet, a little small but that didn't bother us. I would recommend this hotel again, really lovely for the price and a great little spot.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal area for us”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBella2701
Reviews.Content: We can only reiterate what other travellers have reported. Excellent location, lovely refurbished clean, small bedrooms. The reception staff were friendly and helpful without exception and would happily answer our queries and point us in the right direction. We were both celebrating our Birthdays - my 50th - and the Reception lady who checked us in very kindly arranged a bottle of Champagne and a box of macarons to be put in our room whilst we dined out. Most thoughtful and thoroughly enjoyed. There are numerous T/A highly rated restaurants in this area and after looking at some of their menus on their websites and in the windows we chose La Florimonde, two visits to Le Bosquet and Restaurant Marriette for our Birthday. If your rate includes breakfast then this is excellent value as you can help yourself in the atmospheric basement breakfast room which has all you need to start the day with an unlimited supply of coffee, hot chocolate etc. The Rue Cler is wonderful to walk up and down - even in the drizzle - and it is lovely to have all the outlets you need on one street. It must be great to live there and have all this on your doorstep. The Ecole Militaire station is very close by with good access to all tourist spots. We will definitely choose this area again for a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: gg-kfirina
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here in August 2011, returned again due to the good price-quality ratio (got a deal on their internet website that also included breakfast). The staff are very very friendly. The rooms are nice, modern and cleaned very well every day. The television has quite some channels in English, which can be rare in France. The breakfast was served in the breakfast room in the basement which was very nice. Breakfast includes warm drinks, juices/milk, croissant/danish/pain au chocolate/bread, jams, cold meats/cheese, fruit salad, yoghurt, boiled eggs. Its all fresh and restocked throughout the morning. The location of the hotel is one of the biggest plus-points! The surrounding neighourhood is very nice, safe. Less than 5 minutes walk from the Ecole Militaire metro stop, multiple supermarkets in the area, baker, shops, and a number of nice looking restaurants. Also a nice walk to the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, all you need”
Reviews.Author: TaiTai5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during July. Great little hotel. Wonderful location. Lots and lots of Cafes and Restaurants right at your door, as well as convenience shops, grocers and laundry. Also amazing chocolate shops. The rooms are small (this is Paris), but are well laid out and contain all you need. We had two connecting rooms and there was enough space for a family of two adults and two messy children with far too much luggage. Easy stroll to Eiffel tower which we did every day and metro. Staff were very helpful. Location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Tartantiger10
Reviews.Content: An absolutely wonderful stay, we spent New Years Eve 2011 and 5 fantastic nights here at the start of 2012 and found it easy to find, comfortable and the service was very friendly. The rooms are clean and warm even in the heart of winter and the little desks are a huge help for organising your time in Paris. Try the chocolates downstairs too, forget new years diets they're delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location and well-priced - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Cadran for 6 nights in May 2011. As other reviewers have noted, the location is excellent -- close to the Metro and the lovely rue Cler. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms -- yes, they're small (which I think is not unusual for Paris) but are clean and equipped with everything you would want. Their breakfast is pretty basic -- we went there some days but would more often go to one of the places on rue Cler and people-watch on the patio while we ate. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful All Around”
Reviews.Author: Julie B
Reviews.Content: We took the trip of my life in Sept. going to Paris for 7 nights. After much research and reading reviews on TripAdvisor, we chosen the Hotel du Cadran. What a wonderful find! The hotel staff is friendly and so helpful. Their English was perfect and they assisted us with both a dinner reservation and with contacting the shuttle service for our pickup to the airport. The room was spotless and very modern. It was small, but we made the most of our space and we knew that from the other reviews. You just have to accept that when staying in Paris. The bathroom would be my only small critique - the shower is very small and has no shelf or anyplace to put soap. I would advise taking bottled soap so you can place it on the shower floor. The hotel offers free computer use just off the lobby - which was a blessing to email everyone that we were here! Note: the keyboard in Europe is not the same as the US - it was a challenge to type! The location was PERFECT! Only about 7-8 minutes from the Eiffel Tower. Rue Cler was wonderful to shop and eat on. We loved it so much. The price was really amazing as well for the area and for the quality of the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, modern...just dont bring a lot of luggage!”
Reviews.Author: Camnicsydney
Reviews.Content: After much research I made a reservation at this hotel based on previous TA reviews and photos. My husband and I found the hotel to overall be fine however exceptionally tight when trying to fit in 2 standard size suitcases. The location of the hotel was quite good....a few minutes walk to the metro, a mini mart across the road, a gorgeous cheese shop steps away and what appeared to be a new bakery also steps away. Surrounding the hotel were also a lot of restaurants that were continuously packed each of our 3 nts. Our main gripe about this hotel was the hot water. After walking the streets of Paris for most of the day all I wanted was to come back and take a really hot shower.....and each night from 9pm there was only lukewarm water....aaaghhh! So frustrating...to make matters worse the shower head would not stay up and I had to wedge it on a really odd angle just to take a shower. We found the room to be pretty quiet and the staff to be friendly (be wary of the old guy on at night .... he wont want to find you some wine glasses or a small bread knife for your cheese!). There are many, many hotels in Paris....take your time and research where you want to be! My last parting tip....check out the restaurant Chez Toinette (rue Germain Pilon) in the Pigalle district for an amazing French cuisine experience. The owners are wonderful and two years on the service and food is still impeccible!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel AMAZING location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: JoeandMargaret
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel last June after researching here on TA and were VERY satisfied with our choice. The room we had was very small, but just fine for our 5 day visit. The staff were very helpful and spoke English. The hotel is clean and safe and you cannot find a better location or value in all of Paris! Our only complaints (typically American, I must add) were the size of the bathroom and the ice machine is tiny as well. This time we'll stick to wine! :) Steps to a grocery store with a full liquor department, 20 paces to a decent restaurant and a block from a coin laundry. Beautiful and modern, we highly recommend this hotel. We have booked it for 11 nights in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Aaron H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Du Cadran for three nights from 20th December and had an amazing few days in Paris. The hotel was one of the best things about our trip; it had extremely clean, well sized rooms which were well equipped with good controllable lighting throughout the room and bathroom; Modern bathroom amenities and a good range of shampoo, shower gel & body lotion which was re-stocked every day. The staff were faultless, 24hour reception provided us with any information we needed and were always at hand. They were extremely friendly and welcoming which is exactly what you need! They all spoke great English too which was a good help! They gave us advise on where to go shopping, eating and various other things whilst we were there! Breakfast was substantial, varied and all great quality. It had croissants, pain au chocolat and various other danish pastries plus bread with hams, cheeses and many tasty cereals which was great! I cannot fault this hotel for what it is, it's well priced with a prime location in Paris (Eiffel Tower is just around the corner!) and there is access to the Metro/RER just around the corner (Ecole Millitaire). The two small faults or improvements I'd like to see, is tea/coffee's in the room and I also think it would be complete with a nice bar downstairs to get a well priced beer or a cocktail. The lovely chocolate bar downstairs has all sorts of hand made chocolates, macarons and hot drinks but it's not quite a bar! In general, if your looking for a lovely cosy, clean and well located hotel in Paris; don't hesitate to book Hotel Du Cadran. I can guarantee you will not regret booking it! Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, tight space”
Reviews.Author: HungryHoneymooners
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to live out of your suitcase. Great central location. Very helpful, English-speaking staff. If you're not going to spend much time in your room, this is a great place for a really good price. We bought the cheapest room available, so some of the more pricey rooms may be different. Tiny closet, no dresser or table. Bed only. Need room key to turn on lights. Fair amount of noise in the street throughout the evening. Yummy breakfast (complimentary) in basement. All in all, we were satisfied, but would have needed much more space if we were staying longer than 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MissHo
Reviews.Content: A while ago I visited France and spent 4 days in Paris, each day in a different hotel (I don't have much luggage and I just enjoy getting to know different neighborhoods). Hotel du Cadran is by far the best hotel I've stayed at in Paris. First the location is perfect. It is just a stone's throw from Rue Cler where the local people come shopping for grocery in this open-air market. Of course we as tourists have no need to buy pork and fish, but there are plenty of street food like chocolate, pastries, fruit and if you feel like taking a break from restaurants, how about taking out some gourmet cooked food like butter-baked escargots or ox-tail terrine, a bottle of wine and just stretch in your hotel room? On Rue Cler you can buy all these and more. It is super convenient. On top of being close to Rue Cler, it is just a 5-minute walk from the metro station so getting back to the hotel late at night is not a problem. The hotel room is kinda small but this is normal for any hotel in the centre of the city. It looks like the hotel has been newly renovated so the place is clean and the design is modern and cheerful. Although the hotel has free wi-fi, there are computers behind the lobby for guests to use. Thoughtful touches like this are definitely appreicated. I paid 142 euro for a single room. The location is perfect and the hotel is comfortable, I really can't find any bones to pick. It is a 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lovesherholidays_9
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at the Hotel Du Cadran for a long weekend break. The best thing about it is its location - short stroll to the Eiffel Tower and the Ecole Militaire metro station. You can walk to the musee d'orsay in around 25 minutes. As others have said, there are plenty of bars and restaurants very close by so you don't need to go far in the evening. Our room was small, but ok for 3 nights. It was very warm so we kept the window open which was fine until around 6am when all the deliveries started happening. Breakfast was sufficient. The staff were helpful. Our room was very clean, as was the rest of the hotel. We would go back to this hotel if we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Bienvenue a Paris”
Reviews.Author: IngridaMargareta
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel du Cadran after a long flight from Sydney. As we wheeled our bags along the cobbled streets and found where this gorgeous boutique hotel is situated, we were so happy with our choice. The staff at reception were very welcoming and helpful. Our room, although small, was very comfortable and plenty of room for our bags and us. We were here to see Paris. The room was modern and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was very small but all the amenities met our expectations. Our room was quiet as we could hear no noise from the streets below. Each morning we were treated to a wonderful breakfast which was served in an area in the lower floor of the hotel. All the staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is located in the middle of a number of restaurants, charcuteries, boulangeries etc. After a big day touring Paris and its environs, the choice was yours for dinner,a baguette and fromage or a tasty meal at one of the restaurants. The hotel is close to the Eiffel Tower and the Hotel des Invalides. We walked everywhere and you can never get lost when you are staying near the Eiffel Tower as you can see it from anywhere in Paris. It's your personal GPS. When we stay in Paris again we would choose this hotel. We actually prefer to stay in this type of boutique hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Neat and nifty, modern and well located”
Reviews.Author: Irelandlife
Reviews.Content: Myself and a girlfriend treated ourselves to a weekend in Paris. This hotel was perfect for our purpose. It was in easy walking distance of all the shops (main target of our visit!), and with the Eiffel tower just down the road, we had a great signpost to spot the location of our hotel from afar. Its also < 10 minutes walk from Invalide. Rooms were small (aren't all in this price range in Paris?), but clean, very well designed and had everything you could need. My friend wanted coffee making facilities in the room, but if this is the only shortcoming, it can't be bad. And we did have a great choice of excellent cafes and bars directly across the road, so no shortage. We went to an adjacent cafe for breakfast each mroning as thought the â‚¬20 a head a bit steep as we weren't up for big indulging in big breakfasts. The staff in that cafe directly across the road were so helpful puring over maps with us to recomend good places to see. The decor of the rooms is chic and modern. Staff helpful and friendly. Good location. And while there were lots of cafes and restaurants in the street where we were, it is not noisy at night, and actually has a suburban charm - eating dinner in a nearby restaurant the first night all customers appeared french - made it all the more charming.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt ask for better location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Cork_IrelandSharonD
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is situated within easy walking distance of Eiffel Tower. We stayed as a couple for 3 nights. The rooms are small and it was for my 40th birthday, my husband had asked for a nice room and we were given a standard room, no effort to offer an upgrade, etc. That was a little disappointing as most hotels would make the effort. But that said, the rooms are immaculate and the bathroom the same. Room was a little too warm at night. A/C may have been turned off as we couldn't switch it on. Season is usually June to Sept so this may have been the reason. The location is the winner here with lovely restaurants locally if you are too tired to venture too far after walking the entire day (which you will do in Paris). Staff for the most part very helpful and there was no trouble arranging at short notice our transport to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “perfect !”
Reviews.Author: JFishe
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect location - Rue Cler has the best little cafes :) Front desk staff was very very helpful, room was clean, comfortable, modern and a good size for two. The bath is an average size with above average amenities. Would love to stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Marcelo72
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been refurbished so the rooms are nice, clean, and modern. The rooms are small but this common in Paris.The staff is very helpful. The location is very good. It is near Tour Eiffel, Les Invalides, and Ecole Militaire. There are several shops, restaurants and cafes nearby. The subway station is about one block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Jarhead-1017
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at du Cadran. People have commented on how small the rooms are, but I am 6'7" tall and didn't have a problem. We chose this hotel for its location, we walked everywhere. We did take a bus from the train station to a stop that was somewhat near the hotel when arriving from London. We got lost, but oh well we were on vacation, no big deal. We had two rooms, one for my wife and I, and one for our teenage daughters. Rooms were well appointed, clean, and comfortable. We never ate breakfast at the hotel but from what I could tell it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean, strategic hotel, with nice neighbourhood with Eiffel Tower within walking distance...”
Reviews.Author: marcel82
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, and I must say the hotel is a perfect accomodation! Near the Ecole Militaire metro, great restaurants nearby, many bakeries, and u have carrefour...walking distance to Eiffel tower as well... The reception people are really warm and helpful...and i can't help to notice one of them (the brown hair woman) is very cute, pretty and nice as well! And no worries, they speak fluent English!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mimimoura
Reviews.Content: This was the most expensive hotel on my trip to Europe. Hotel.com CAD$161.38 but I wanted to be close to the Eiffel Tower. I couldn't have asked for a better location. It was easy to locate from the metro exit. I picked this hotel because of the reviews on TripAdvisor. This hotel was very modern. I loved how the lights on the room floors were motion activated. The room was super clean. I loved how large the bathroom was. The shower was large and easy to use. I especially liked the different lighting moods you can choose from. I was able to see a bit of the Eiffel tower from the window, which was great. The bed was super comfortable. I didn't get a chance to try the macarons on the first floor. However, I do recommend that you check out the Chinese restaurant at the near the hotel. They have awesome take out/take away and for a reasonable price. There is also a VELO bike rental just outside the hotel which is not expensive to rent. Its a great way to move around Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: KevsevUk
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the proximity to local cafes and shops. There are a few cafes just around the corner, one minute's walk away, a supermarket across the road and delicatessens and food shops also a minute away. We found food a little on the expensive side when eating out, but that was mostly due to the exchange rate. Buy your water for the day from the supermarket across the road for 70 cents instead of 3 Euros for half the amount around the attractions. We loved the fact that we could walk to the Eiffel Tower at night when it was lit up. The hotel is spotlessley clean and the bed one of the most comfortable I have slept on away from home. The air conditioning worked very well during the hot week we were there and the modern bathroom was fine. My problem with all hotel bathrooms is that the mirror is over the washbasin and too far away for putting on make up if you are short-sighted! The hairdryer is the best I've used in any hotel. There is a tiny wardrobe with room for around 5 or 6 items of clothing and a couple of shelves but not really room to unpack, so be prepared to keep your clothes in your suitcase. I was expecting this, so was not too bothered by it. The hotel has cctv cameras in the corridors and lighting which comes on when you step out of your room. The lift broke down while we were there, and we were worried it would be an issue, as we were on the 5th floor, but the engineer was called out and it was sorted out very quickly, which was quite impressive. It was useful to be able to use the internet while we were there. Breakfast consists of cold ham, cheese, yoghurt, fruit juice, pain au chocolat and pain aux raisins and bread, with jams. The bread was my only problem, as it fell short of the soft and crispy french bread I was used to having in France, but we found that everywhere we went. Front desk staff were very friendly and spoke quite good English. One tip: the eggs next to the egg boiler are not cooked! One visitor cracked a raw egg onto his plate, as he thought they were hard boiled! Also, if you go to Versailles, go at the weekend when the fountains are working. Only one works during the week.

Reviews.Title: “great first impression of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ems1112
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Paris I was flying blind when choosing a hotel prior to joining a tour group. The location was perfect, the staff was incredibly accommodating, and I was just steps away from great shops and cafes. Yes, the rooms are on the small side, but I was expecting that, and they were very modern and efficient. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely oasis in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Travelchild094
Reviews.Content: What a good find this was on Trip Advisor. In the heart of the residential Left Bank. Out of the door to cafes, restaurants, local shops and the local people going about their daily business. Close by to a Metro station and within walking distance of so many sites. The hotel was clean, beautifully appointed and bang on for all you need for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Super Clean Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: caligurl2atl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on the reviews and was not dissapointed the least bit. This hotel is very well maintained, very clean, and has a very contemporary feel to it. I was warned the rooms in Paris were small and this is true. However, it wasn't so small I couldn't move around. I was only here for a day so it didn't bother me much. The staff spoke English and were very friendly. As a woman, I appreciated the plug in like smell the room had :-) It took about 10 minutes to walk to the Eifel Tower. I would stay here again in heartbeat the next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Efficient”
Reviews.Author: NTXTravel
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. First of all, it is very close to Rue Cler, which I thought was quite charming. There was an antiques market on Rue Cler on Saturday--not sure if that is the normal Saturday but it was fun. Lots of cafes in the area. Very easy walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and the Trocadero; we also walked as far as Notre Dame (twice!) as well as The Louvre, Orsay and Orangerie, Cluny Museum and lots of other places in between. The rooms were not large but efficiently laid out--after the first impression of "small", it really wasn't hard to get around in the room--there was adequate closet and bathroom space, plenty of hot water, electrical plugs and TV. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The petite dejeuner was great. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Hollowegg
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for 5 nights this September. The hotel is located in a great area only a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower and steps from Rue Cler. The area is very residential and allows you to immerse yourself in the neighborhood, I like to watch the little kids come and go to school each day. The hotel was very charming and VERY clean, the rooms are small by American standards but plenty of room for 2 people. I spent a lot of time doing research on hotels before our trip and this hotel was exactly as advertised. When I get back to Paris I will be sure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Report of theft from room during our stay”
Reviews.Author: rhonda r
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our room and the postion of the hotel however be very vigilant with your valuables as we had a substantial amount of money taken from our luggage during the course of our stay. Whilst quite sympathetic the management dismissed our claims of theft inferring that we had misplaced the money ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Frank L
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Paris, and this hotel did not disappoint. In fact we are very happy with the choice and the experience there. The staffs were friendly and fluent in English, they also helped us and let us practice our broken French with them. The hotel was situated at a great area, very close to the metro, a market across the pedestrian street plus a few more in the area, a very lively neighborhood with food and pastry shops. The most important of all, central to all tourist attractions. Fiancee and I stayed here for 5 days Aug of 2011, from the check-in process to the end, it was just superb. We had a corner room that was not only clean but also larger than expected . The bathroom shower has a half-door on the tub, which was a bit weird at first, but easily getting used to, after all, we don't require anything fancy to cleanse ourselves. But to think back now, It may just be the norm in France, as this hotel wasn't the only one in France we had with a half door. The price dropped from the price I booked 6 months in advance directly with the hotel with a lowest price guarantee. The manager's solution was to provide us both with free breakfasts, which we completely appreciate and loved her effort to improve customer experience. Although the breakfast was the same every morning, but it was delicious nonetheless along with a nice cave like atmosphere eating area. Thank you, Krisztina for providing such wonderful experience at your hotel. If I have to suggest anything it would be to perhaps clean up and organize the luggage area a bit. It was weird to temporary store the luggage before check-in time in a hot, humid and a bit dirty room along with everyone else's who arrived earlier. Overall, We loved the area, the staffs, the room, and the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel near the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: CBKY
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Hotel Cadran this month (Sep 2011). As others have said the rooms are small, but let's face it, that's not where you are spending your time in Paris. The hotel is immaculate, the staff are extremely helpful, and the location is outstanding. The hotel is only steps from Rue Cler with lots of restaurants, shops, patisseries, etc. It is also only 3 blocks from the metro and about a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and the waterfront. We would not hesitate to recommend Hotel Cadran to our friends and children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, modern hotel in a PERFECT location.”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynWino
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited Paris, and I spent a while researching hotels and neighborhoods on TripAdvisor. I am so glad we decided to stay at the Cadran Hotel. The hotel is located in the 7th arrondissement, a block and a half from the Ecole Militaire metro station, and a short walk to the Eiffel Tower. It is located a few steps from Rue Cler, which is a pedestrian street featuring cafes, a cheese shop, wine stores, a fantastic bakery, fish market, produce stands, ice cream shops, a pharmacy, and even Japanese and Chinese restaurants. There is a supermarket directly across the street from the hotel, and an additional cheese shop two doors down (Cantin- amazing selection of French cheese). The hotel itself features a chocolate shop in the lobby. There are some amazing restaurants within walking distance (try Le Petit Bistro and Auberge du Champ de Mars). The hotel itself is quite small, and so are the rooms. We opted for the superior room, which was small, but adequate and really clean. The beds were comfortable, the room was air conditioned, and had a flatscreen TV. The modern and clean bathroom was actually a decent size, and had a bathtub, but had a strange sliding door that never quite closed all the way. We were on the fifth floor and had a corner room, which had extra windows. We were able to see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our bathroom and bedroom windows, and we could also see the action down on Rue Cler. The room had a fully stocked mini fridge, which we promptly emptied out and refilled with our purchases from Rue Cler (wine, cheese, fruit, vegetables, pastries, water- get a small case from the supermarket across the street instead of paying minibar prices). We got a fresh campagnette (crusty baguette) from the bakery every morning. Take advantage of the food shopping on Rue Cler and your mini fridge, and you'll have a great snack/picnic on hand at all times. You can even bring your picnic to the park at the Eiffel Tower, which we did. Be sure to pack a small knife (in your checked bag, of course!), plastic cups, paper plates, napkins, and a green bag so you can transport your picnic. The breakfast was included, and it featured breads, pastries, meats, cheeses, boiled eggs and a really nice coffee/cappuccino machine. The hotel also features free wifi, which worked sporadically (very annoying). Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Cadran, and would absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: gilchalm
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights over UK Bank Holiday weekend (booked via Cresta Holidays). All the many plus points of this compact "style hotel" have been mentioned by previous reviewers. I would emphasise the VERY convenient location. To get to the Cadran from CDG airport, I suggest the RoissyBus from outside the terminal, direct and non-stop to its terminus at OPERA (10 euro). Then get the metro to Ecole Militaire (Line 8) which is only three minutes walk from the Hotel du Cadran. Buy a book of 10 tickets for 12.50 euro for use on metro, buses and local trains (RER). The hotel is a 15 minutes stroll to the Eiffel Tower and the river (I timed it, and I'm not a quick walker)! Rue du Cler just excellent for eats & drinks for occasions when one might not want to venture further afield. Indeed, the whole district is a very pleasant suburb. The #69 bus from Rue de Cler seems to cover the entire city! If you're on a tight budget, use it for a tour instead of the Les Cars Rouge (hop on & off open-top bus). However, we thought the latter was well worth the 24 euro. There are four circuits, and we managed three of them in a day. Excellent commentary. One word of warning about the Hotel du Cadran. Although very clean, with comfortable beds and a good (but small) shower room, the bedrooms are VERY limited in size. We were glad we only had one holdall between the two of us. This suited us for a short stay, but anyone with a couple of suitcases would struggle to find floor space to put them down. Incidentally, the continental breakfast which was included in our package was first class. We would certainly stay at this hotel again, and recommend it to others with minimal luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the Rue Cler neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Urban-cyclist
Reviews.Content: Took Rick Steve's advice and was not disappointed. Small, stylish, impeccable hotel above a wonderful chocolate shop, just off Rue Cler, a pedestrian street that has a great mix of local shops (cheese, charcuterie, boulangerie, epicerie) and cafes frequented by both locals and tourists. Modern and well designed interiors, although the room was quite small - too small for 2 people if you plan to spend a lot of time in the room. But very comfortable, clean, and efficient if extra space is not a concern. Free in room wifi, and 2 computer terminals with printer downstairs. The whole neighborhood was great, and we had dinner in the 7th for 5 nights. Highly recommend Chez les Anges, L'Affriole, and La Fontaine de Mars

Reviews.Title: “Delightful! Will be back when we can!”
Reviews.Author: LifeinHarmony
Reviews.Content: When looking for a room, we targeted this neighborhood because it is so close to Rue Cler (pedestrian street favored by a travel guide) and we are delighted we did. The neighborhood was friendly and not touristy/commercial but everything we needed was nearby, within minutes if not yards - cafes, ice cream shops, crepes, bakeries, laundermat, pharmacie, florist, market etc. I mean everything. It was not far from the Metro (Ecole Militaire) either. But the only time we took the Metro was when we arrived at the Hotel. After that, Emily at the front desk, as nice, pleasant and helpful as they come, gave us a map and we walked the whole week without taking the Metro again - Tour Eiffel, Champs Elysee, Notre Dame, St Germaine, Louvre, Musee D'Orsay - we loved the walking and Hotel Du Cadran was perfect for that. A right turn on Bosquet brings you to the Seine. We were in Room 505 with a great (upper half) view of the Tour Eiffel that lights up and twinkles at night. The hotel has two computers for use with internet. The breakfast room was quaint! Now, the room is small and so is the bathroom and the shower gets the floor wet. There is no closet but an off the floor hanging cabinet with a hanging rod for about 10 hangers. Not what we are used to in the US. The room has various pegs to hang bags, clothes whatever, and a narrow shelf running the width of the room, clever solutions for a small space. But this was all part of the uniqueness and charm of Hotel Du Cadran! It's a wonderful place! And, we will be back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great...except for one major 'but'”
Reviews.Author: gg-kfirina
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel du Cadran for 3 nights on a mini-break to Paris. This hotel has many positives: - friendly staff, - superb location (3 minutes walk to metro station, 3 supermarkets within a 2 min walk radius (the carrefour by the entrance to the metro station is open from 7 am til midnight!), lots of cafes (serving cheaper breakfast options than in the hotel!), nice neighbourhood, etc) - nice/modern decor - free wifi & use of computers - excellent water pressure + lovely bathroom - very comfortable bed - having booked the smallest room, we were upgraded to a bigger, corner room (definitely a positive given other reviews saying how small the other rooms are!) There is however one negative for which I rate this hotel a '3' instead of a '4'. Whilst in Paris we had the misfortune that the weather was EXTREMELY humid. This in itself is not such a problem if one can go back to a nicely air conditioned hotel. The air conditioning in this hotel was weak if not almost utterly useless. This was not just an issue for our room, as the hotel lobby and hallways were also lacking that refreshing blast of cold air one normally experiences (and expects) from air conditioning! This is, of course, a very season-specific problem, and had we travelled during different weather circumstances this complaint would never have been noticed! The only other weakness of the hotel is that the doors are thin/not noise proof. You could hear everything going on in the hallway, including that 'beep' sound when people unlock their rooms with a key card!

Reviews.Title: “ok - bathroom wasn't private enough!”
Reviews.Author: AMarrLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for a four night stay. The hotel room was clean and looks good and there are several bars nearby. Unfortunately the bathroom has a sliding door which leaves a small gap which you can look through (not sound proof and considering all the mirrors in the room not very private). This killed the romance a little. We didn't pay for the breakfast- there is an excellent patisserie on the corner of the road which will provide you with breakfast and lunch for half the price. Also worth noting that it is a fair distance from the Eiffel Tower and not 5 minutes walk as they claim however it is much closer to a metro station so getting around Paris is easy.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: Abdan
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were welcomed by the friendly reception staff to the moment we left, this hotel was terrific. Room was bright and airy and even slightly bigger than we expected. Bed extremely comfortable and the bathroom was large and everything was super clean. I'm really fussy and each day our room was immaculately serviced. Only a 5 minute walk to the Metro and 15 min walk to Eiffel Tower - great position! Reception staff always happy to help with directions etc. Definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: jbrown68
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Cadran is worth everything for the location. The Champ de Mars is a mere three blocks away, and the Invalides and the Musee Rodin not much farther. Rue Cler is a half a block away with shopping and dining on a car-free street. Two blocks away is the Metro, Ecole-Militaire station. The rooms are clean and the facilities are nice. The rooms are incredibly small, perhaps even smaller than you would expect even in Paris. My only complaint is the lack of storage--we had to stash suitcases wherever they would fit and there was not a single drawer. A very narrow closet had two shelves in it, so clothes ended up scattered pretty much everywhere. One of the nice things was the option to have two connecting rooms so our kids could be nearby without sharing a room with us. Their room had a tub in the bathroom; ours was shower only. The breakfasts were good, but they are an extra 13 euros, which isn't bad considering that you have coffee, tea, juices, bread, croissants, fruit salad, yogurt, cereal, eggs you can boil yourself, salami, cheese--much more than what you would get for the same amount at a cafe. Some of the front desk staff was extremely helpful; not all though were great. When I requested help from one of the daytime staff in finding out the hours of a place that only had a French website, she seemed like I was putting her out. But the staff in the evening and the early morning were wonderful, friendly, answering questions. If you care more about location and cleanliness and safety than room size, this is the place. Perfect for families (who don't have too many clothes to unpack!).

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT BUT...”
Reviews.Author: Cody-Anne
Reviews.Content: I have mostly fabulous things to say about this hotel. Have stayed in many, many Paris hotels, and would stay here again, but you need to know (as everyone else has mentioned) that the rooms are SMALL, the space is limitted, and you are paying a lot of euros for said small space. Having said that, I had excellent service from the gals during the day at the front desk. They spoke excellent english, and were very, very helpful in giving directions and suggesting places to eat nearby. The one restaurant (Le Florimond) was a serious gem and I enthusiastically recommend it, whether you stay at this hotel or not! The room itself was modern, clean, pleasing to the eye, and very well appointed with regards to storing your stuff, which was a good thing because there is next to no floor space. No problem for my friend and I, but you do need to be aware of. The bathroom was very modern too, glassed in walls, pretty decent lighting, and satisfying water pressure. Now the location is what you will want to book this hotel for! It is central to EVERYTHING! We were minutes from the Eiffel tower, minutes from Hotel Invalides, and minutes from the metro station. We walked everywhere along the Seine and saw all of the big sights along the river, Right bank and Left. If you like to walk it's totally possible, just bring comfy shoes. The hotel itself is surrounded by brasseries, bakeries, little supermarkets, and fun shops. We decided to skip the hotel breakfast (not included in our room rate, and goes for 13 euros per person) and managed to find yummy breakfast across the street for less. We paid 171 euros a night for a double bed standard room. I have almost always paid less in Paris for a room overnight, but quality is not always the same. Overall, hotels are expensive, and if you are looking for the comforts of home without paying an arm and a leg, well decide for yourself, but 171â‚¬ was a lot. I was overall happy, but the beautiful room that was just a touch too small hurt my wallet a little bit. I will book here again, but will watch for any deals that might come up. If I had my daughter and her playpen with me, it would not have been possible to stay in the room that my friend and I had booked. So there you have it. Excellent, but small and kind of expensive for what you get. But for location, you really can't get better.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sraemurphy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful friendly staff everytime I walked in the door! If we had a situation they immediately solved it. Great breakfast. Comfortable beds with down comforters. Really great location near enough to walk to eiffel tower! Definately would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Smart, clean hotel in excellent location with very good staff”
Reviews.Author: Vortigern
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7th-11th Aug 2011 for our 25th wedding anniversary. Only a couple of minutes walk from the tube station at Ecole Militaire. A few yards from Rue Cler pedestrianised market street - cafes, fromageries, boulangeries etc. Easy walk to the Seine and Eiffel Tower. We had a Superior King which was actually two singles zipped together - worked fine. The room was smart, modern & clean, although small even by London standards. Bathroom was modern with great shower over bath. We had booked breakfast online (it was obvious to me that it was an extra, though not a to previous reviewer), however we had printed out the voucher on this hotel's review on Trip Advisor and presented this at reception when we booked in. This gave us both free breakfast for the the three nights of our stay. The help-yourself buffet breakfast was actually downstairs in the stone vaulted cellar - teas, coffees, chocolate, fruit juices, cereals, fruit, yogurt, croissants, rolls, cheeses, meats, eggs. Excellent. A couple of disappointments - the safe in the room was out of order (fixed next day, and we were able to used a sealed envelope in the hotel safe until then), the chocolate/macaron bar in reception was closed for August (reception had a limited selection available for sale though), and there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Despite these little things, we would recommend Cadran and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RandSTas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the Eiffel Tower and around the corner from a metro station in a nice old sector of the inner city of Paris. There are many smaller hotels and restaurants in the area as well as apartments where people live so it is not just a tourist area. The Hotel Du Cadran is on 5 levels and was very quiet. The staff were most helpful and found me a local dentist when I had tooth ache. They all speak English very well. They will give you advice about travel and help to book tours for you. The rooms are very small and I would recommend if you can afford it to take a slightly more expensive room for the extra space it gives you. The rooms are serviced daily and the hotel is very clean. The breakfast is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: larry0808
Reviews.Content: Great location close to the Eiffel Tower and surrounded by bars and restaurants to suit all tastes. Supermarket right across the road. Hotel very clean, funky decor and pleasant and helpful staff on reception. However, our main gripe is that the rooms are tiny - not even enough room to open a suitcase without putting it on the bed. Breakfast was pricey and not very inspiring, we chose to eat out at one of the cafes a few yards away which was much better value. Overall, a good hotel but they need to knock some walls through to make the rooms an acceptable size!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a family trip”
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 7 nights at the Hotel du Cadran and had a fantastic stay. There's a lot to love about the hotel: Rooms: we were staying with two young children (age 6 and 8) and had gotten adjoining rooms. This was perfect as the kids were able to have their own room and bath (with a bathtub) but were able to come into our room as needed via the connecting doors. A great option for families. The rooms and baths are smallish, with not a lot of room for a desk or storage space for suitcases, but we weren't expecting anything else in Paris. There were creative ways to stash suitcases and cliothes over the duration of the week. Rooms were very clean and kept up well over the course of the week. Staff: very friendly and helpful. We arrived early Sunday morning and while our rooms weren't ready, they stored our bags and tried to get us into our rooms as soon as they could. Hotel: recently remodeled according to their website. Very modern/stylish design. Free wifi throughout the hotel. An excellent breakfast served every morning (juice, cereal, coffee/tea, bread, croissants, ham, salami, cheese, eggs). While the breakfast isn't included, it was very reasonable and good quality. Location: excellent location within walking distance of the Champs des Mars/Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides. The hotel is 3 minutes from the Ecole Militaire subway station. Multiple restaurants nearby- lively area at night. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend to a friend or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: bibieke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 night and were overall happy with the room and service in this small hotel, but with some room for improvements (shower head broken, carpet in the rooms, poor lighting in the corridor, ...). Taking the elevator was sometimes a bit of a hassle seeing as there was only one lift to go between all six floors and the elevator took it's time. Size of the room was ok and the neighborhood was good with a food shop, bakery, ... all near by as well as dining and drinking facilities. The hotel gives you free access to the internet on two computers and you can even print for free. We also appreciated the airco in the room as the rooms seem to get warm easily. There was a breakfast buffet served in the cellar of the hotel and this was an absolute beautiful room!! Try to book trough booking.com for discount so you get a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: loco4beach
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff are lovely. We had a room with a king size bed. It was very comfortable and although the room was small to US standards, it was very well laid out. The bathroom was really nice and stocked with very nice toiletries. We wish we had included the breakfast with our lodging. We had breakfast there a couple times and it had a very nice selection of buffet foods (French style), cold cereals, espresso/coffee, juices, croissants and pastries, cheese, hard boiled eggs, sliced meats, jellies and jams. There were not many places to find that served breakfast. The hotel is located steps from Rue Cler which is crammed with cafe's and shops - a wonderful street! It is also located very close to the Eiffel Tower (we had a view from our room). There is a chocolate shop in the lobby. The staff was excellent. At the end of the block was a launderette which we made good use of since we were on a 2 week trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fab modern hotel in a very 'Parisian' area”
Reviews.Author: FMOS30
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I planned an overnight stay in Paris in the middle of a week long holiday in Normandy. We originally struggled to decide on a hotel - we wanted to stay as central as possible as we were only there for one night but couldn't afford to spend a lot of money. By chance, we received a marketing email from Trip Advisor mentioning this hotel and it was exactly what we were looking for - small, modern and close to the Eiffel Tower. As we booked a couple of months in advance, we got the room for around Â£130 (instead of the 250e rate that was quoted on the back of the door in our room). The local area is what I would call typically Parisian - lovely old apartment buildings, fancy restaurants, cafes with terraces for wicker chairs and tables and lots of boulangeries and food shops. We arrived at the hotel before 10am to check in and they showed us to the (locked) luggage store and told us our room would be ready at 2pm. We had breakfast in Cafe Central on the corner of Rue Cler and Rue du Champ de Mars - It was slightly expensive but the interior was spectacular and it's a great spot to people watch. After a wander around, we returned to Rue Cler for lunch at Okiwa - a Japanese restaurant with a very reasonable set menu at 10e and went back to the hotel before heading back out. Our room was on the top (5th) floor and I had requested a view of the Eiffel Tower if it was possible and that's exactly what we got - I was so happy! The room itself was not especially big but made very good use of the space. The bathroom was very stylish but there were a couple of things I didn't like about it - the bathroom door slid along but didn't lock and would sometimes just open and the shower itself wasn't enclosed so the floor got very wet. The only issues we had were that the light in front of the mirror in the bathroom didn't work and we had to call down to reception for large towels so we could shower (we only received hand towels initially). We returned to the room again before 11pm and watched the Eiffel Tower's light show (again!) from our room. The bed was comfortable and the room quiet so we were able to have a good night sleep. Check out was at 10am and as we didn't catch our train until 6pm, we once again left our luggage with reception. When we returned to pick up the bags, I visited the chocolate shop on the ground floor and bought some macarons. They were delicious - especially the salted caramel ones! I would definately stay at this hotel again-the area was fantastic and it's close enough to all the main attractions. One place I would also visit again is the restaurant Le Relais de l'Entrecote. There are 3 in Paris and the closest one to the Hotel du Cadran is on Rue Marbeuf just off the Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es. No reservations and just steak and chips on the menu. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent”
Reviews.Author: cdmolinam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Cadran hotel for a few days and aside from a painfully slow or at times unavailable internet connection, our stay was quite satisfactory. What we liked best was the location...situated in a block with tons of little cafe's and restaurants and walking distance to all key monuments (mostly Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides though we walked all the way to Notre-Dame, through to The Louvre and Champs Elysees and back in a afternoon). We booked what they call a King but found out it was a 'european king' which looked much more like the US queen bed. For European standards, the room wasn't that small (though not spacious at all if you compare with the regular US hotel rooms). Bathroom was spacious enough but it did lack some privacy due to the see through windows (from inside the bedroom) over the toilet. Room looked clean. Staff was very nice but had no clue how to fix the internet for us...solution was to go down to the lobby which was the only place where internet worked best.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Trishadunn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated ten minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower and the River Seine. Lots of lovely places on the doorstep to go and eat and drink, just sit with a glass of wine or a beer and watch the world go buy. The hotel is spotlessly clean, the staff helpful and all seem to speak English pretty well. I can recommend the Hotel du Cadron you will enjoy your trip to Paris even more.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: KMC022
Reviews.Content: good hotel great location walking distance to supermarket, laundry, variety of resturants and the sights. Bathroom small ok for us but if large person could be issue. Staff especially Emily very helpful. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: GinaSamarotto
Reviews.Content: This is a nice choice for a hotel in a central Paris location. While the rooms are excruciatingly small, this is common throughout Europe and inevitable at this price point. The windows opened and despite the busy bistro/shopping/residential area it's a pleasure to have the breeze and enjoy the sounds and smells of Paris! No problem with the linens, all were clean and readily available. The staff was pleasant enough and accommodating - and spoke far more English than we did French. Don't bother with the breakfast available... just a few steps from the hotel is the "Center Bistro' a nice place for breakfast, lunch and dinner (Breakfast 'Francais' includes espresso, croissant, jam and juice for an affordable 8e). Another option is the wonderful boulangerie right on the corner. Bike rental is on the corner (you can use your AMEX card or get a tourist pass in advance) and the metro (Invalides Station) is very close. Buy a carnet of tickets and you can explore Paris on pennies a day. Don't miss the chocolate shop 'A La Mere de Famille' down the street! Reserve your taxi in advance to get you to and from the airport! Taxis are not readily available near the hotel and you could wait upwards of 90 minutes if you dont have a reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - pleasant small hotel”
Reviews.Author: WinstonSophie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a walking tour of Paris so I.m not sure about the price if you book direct. Location is very good - away from the principle sites but they are within easy reach as the metro (Ã©cole miltaire) is a short walk away. The immediate area is semi-pedestrianised with lots of restaurants but also shops for 'real' people (i.e. non-tourists). Nice atomospere. The bedrooms are well designed but VERY SMALL. Suitable for a short stay only. Do not choose this hotel if you have a lot of luggage to unpack! The staff were welcoming & very helpful. Breakfast is simple but everything was of good quality & appetising. I'd both stay there again & recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JenToronto_Ontario
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to celebrate her 21st birthday in Paris. I took my friend's advice and stayed at the Hotel du Cadran. We love the location and the neighbourhood. It is a 3-star hotel but quite comfortable. There were lots of good restaurants, bakeries, cafes, chocolate stores in the area. The short walk to the metro was convenient and safe. The only drawback was we needed an adaptor to recharge our laptop but the only one the front office loaned us was broken. We ended up having to spend 10 Euro to buy one (which would have cost us much less back home).

Reviews.Title: “great location, fantastic staff, good prices”
Reviews.Author: js329
Reviews.Content: stay here if you want to enjoy the Eiffel tower area. positives: many bars and restaurants near by, close to les invalides and Eiffel tower, stellar staff more than willing to assist with recommendations and directions, very clean and modern rooms. negatives: rooms are a bit small and that's about it. strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money in a great location”
Reviews.Author: golfingmd
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 5 nights in Paris staying at the Hotel du Cadran. I saw this hotel recommended in Rick Steves book and decided to give it a try. It is a small hotel with about 40 rooms, eight rooms on each of 5 floors. I had to have two rooms and had 108 and 508. The rooms are small which is typical for Paris. The hotel is very clean and both rooms were no exception. One room had two twins made up as a king and the other had two twins separated. Otherwise the rooms were exactly the same. The beds were comfortable but I was glad to get back to my bed at home! The bathroom is very small. The main criticism is the shower which is very small (think cruise ship shower) with no door or curtain. It is an odd design and resulted in a good bit of water getting on the floor. Other than that and the lack of room to spread out a suitcase (there was only a very small closet) the hotel was fine for the money. I did shop around and for the money compared to other places I think this was a bargain. The front desk staff were all great and all spoke English very well and were extremely helpful. I was able to buy museum passes from them, got directions on getting to Versailles, etc. They were great. The hotel's location is very good. It is located in the Rue Cler area near the Eiffel Tower. Just down the street from the hotel is Rue Cler where there are several cafe's as well as shops, a crepe maker, ice cream place, and a grocery store as well as banks with ATM's. The Ecole Militare metro stop is a very short walk away making it convenient to get to the Metro to go anywhere. I have always stayed on the other side of the Seine but I felt this was a great location. Half a block from the hotel is a great cafe called Le Marche. Probably the best meals I had in Paris were there. Loaded with locals, the food is good and reasonably priced compared to a lot of other places I ate that cater to tourists serving mediocre food (I'm being generous) at outrageous prices. To sum it up, this is not the Four Seasons but I felt it was a very comfortable hotel at a great price in a great location and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: KDtravelers
Reviews.Content: I agree with one of the other reviews. Great location Wonderful reception staff with really good English. Staff bent over backwards to help with booking tours, taxis and providing us with whatever we needed. (except they missed a wake up call) Clean well equipped rooms. We booked a king superior room for the 4 nights we were to stay here. When we arrived, the king room was not available so we got a queen room and were transferred for the rest of the stay. They moved our luggage but I didn't like having to pack up an extra time. Actually, the king room wasn't much larger than the queen so I wish we had stayed in the queen room. We asked for a wake up call that we never got. Luckily we woke up without it and made it on time to a day tour that we took to the champagne region. The water in the sink and bathtub drained really slowly. Don't know why and it wasn't really a big deal - I just wasn't expecting that. There are LOTS of nice restaurants in the area to walk to. Location was very close to Eiffel tower and to a metro stop. Nice street to walk and look in shops and buy pastries. I would stay again if we came back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect travel”
Reviews.Author: checco-kun
Reviews.Content: I have decided to book this hotel because of the reviews reads on Tripadvisor. I will return for sure for 3 reasons: 1) Hotel position (Tour Eiffel/Champ du Mars + Metro); 2) Hotel comfort; 3) the chocolate!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay overall, but doubt I will be back”
Reviews.Author: Akire8205
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Very friendly and helpful reception staff with excellent knowledge of English - Location is fantastic - within easy reach of many of the main attractions - Room was clean and quiet - We had to move room on the second night and the hotel staff kindly arranged for our suitcases to be transferred whilst we were out Cons: - I booked a superior king room so was therefore very disappointed to see that on our first night we had 2 single beds, with separate bed linen, pushed together. On our second night (we had to move rooms because of some painting work) we had 2 single beds pushed together again BUT we had king-size linen so it was more comfortable. However, that is still not a king-size bed - I have a queen size bed at home and don't expect to be any less comfortable when paying almost 400 Euros for a hotel room for 2 nights! - I put on the booking form that the trip was for my husband's birthday - although I know nothing should be expected, it would have been nice for the hotel to make a gesture such as a small complimentary box of macaroons from the store next door to welcome us... nothing extravagant or expensive, just a little something extra that puts them above and beyond their competition Neutrals: - Room was very small. Not an issue for us, but may be for some - No coffee- and tea-making facilities - again, not really an issue for us but surprising So...overall it was a nice stay but we will try another hotel on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: ProvenceParis
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better experience than our three night stay at Hotel due Cadran last week. The staff was very helpful both before our arrival and during our stay. The room and common areas were a delight. The buffet breakfast was convenient and delicious. The location is perfect: within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, Orsay Museum, Orangerie Museum, and the Hotel des Invalides. The Rue Cler is very convenient and offers a great variety of shops, resturants, and necessary services.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DrReUZit
Reviews.Content: Wrapping up two weeks in France, my wife and I, as well as another couple, spent our last three days at Hotel du Cadran. Although the rooms were small by American standards and one of our rooms had mediocre A/C, strengths included a great location, very friendly and helpful staff, modern rooms with plenty of electrical sockets, and a very satisfying breakfast. The staff helped us make dinner reservations for each evening, arranged for a shuttle to the airport, and never failed to welcome us back each time we entered. There was a local grocery across the street, and an excellent bakery less than one block away. While we might try a different hotel next time, Hotel du Cadran was a solid, convenient choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dimitrivaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel fit the bill for us, but I do caution that the rooms are incredibly tiny! I mean really small. There's the bed, and then space to walk around the bed! We wanted to be near the Eiffel Tower off Rue Cler, so I wouldn't stay any where else. But we were only in Paris for two days, so location was everything. It would be a little cramped for a longer visit. The staff was very friendly, the decor was very clean and crisp, and two computers were in the lobby for internet access. We were very happy with our selection.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: dakkinni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in late May. The staff was courteous and helpful and spoke enough English to get by. The rooms were modern but very small by American standards, although the bed was a nice size. They were also clean. There was some street noise, but not much so sleeping was pleasant. The location was great, just off the beaten path but close to the metro and the Eiffel Tower. I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Reasonable Rates & Room With a View - LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: ladysheff
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Cadran feels very high-end, yet with reasonable rates for Paris and extremely friendly staff. We were greeted with a smile, an offer to hold our luggage and a promise that our room would be ready promptly. When we got to our room, it was expectedly small but quite adequate. If you're used to staying in metropolitan cities, you will not be surprised at the size. Everything was clean and chic. We had everything we needed and nothing we didn't. I absolutely loved the window that opened with a view right on to the Rue below. Rue Cler, a market-type street with restaurants, open-air markets, etc, is the next block over. The hotel is only a few blocks each from The Eiffel Tower and Invalides. We will be staying at Hotel du Cadran again and referring our friends and family. Go and ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: greenstarlette
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location. It is within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, metro stops, Invalides train station (train to Versailles) and an under 20 Euro taxi ride to/from the Eurostar train station. The hotel is across a pedestrian street from a grocery store and many bakeries, restaurants, cafes, cheese shops, fruit/vegetable stands and more! The location is superb! The hotel is very modern and has a lovely chocolate & macaroon shop on the ground floor. All of the rooms have a new feel and contemporary ambiance. The bed was comfortable and there is a refrigerator in the room (a mini bar but not one that charges you if you move/remove items) which is perfect to store food you buy on the pedestrian street. My parents also stayed at this hotel at and had a wonderful experience. When we go back to Paris we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean - Great staff - Great location - Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: dgilfor
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Hotel du Cadran. It was a return visit for our travel friends and I would stay there again when we return to Paris. We would have liked a little more room to move around but I understand this is normal for Paris at this price level. The bathroom was a nice size and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent jumping-off point!”
Reviews.Author: Bellzangelz
Reviews.Content: After days of researching places to stay in Paris, my husband and I chose the Hotel du Cadran and would definitely recommend it to other visitors. A business trip took my husband to Paris for 2 weeks prior to my arrival and the Hotel du Cadran was where we reunited. I got to the hotel a few hours before he did, (at about noontime, earlier than the posted check-in time), but the young woman at the desk said my room was ready. Unfortunately, neither my husband nor I speak French, but we had no problems as the hotel staff spoke very good English. There is an elevator (big, for a European hotel!) .
