One of the reasons I picked this hotel was it's advertised "non smoking" policy. I was disappointed that the first thing I noticed as I entered the room was that it reeked of ciggarette smoke! I'm not usually one to make a fuss, but this was unacceptable, so I went back down to the desk and told the same young woman who'd checked me in. Within less than 5 minutes I was back in the elevator, on my way to a different, clean-smelling room! (Amusing note: later in the evening, we opened the window and found an empty pack of Marlboros outside on the window ledge! I guess it's a hard rule to enforce, and it seems that EVERYONE in Paris smokes!!)) Although the rooms are small by American standards, we found it very adequate for the 2 of us. The style is very contemporary. We loved the shower with it's adjustable rain showerhead. (Getting out of the tub/shower might present a challenge to the less able-bodied...there is quite a noticable drop from the tub floor to the room floor, and no grab bars...just a safety note to be aware of) The was a small closet (could have used more hangers). We had a king-size bed, which was essentially 2 twins pushed together. The pillows were small and the bed was hard, but we were usually so exhausted from all the walking we'd done during the day, it didn't matter. There is a flat screen TV...(we were amused by the American shows, dubbed in French, and then, with FRENCH subtitles!) There are 2 computers and a printer for guest-use off the lobby. We had breakfast in the hotel one morning. The price was 13 euros...there was quite an assortment (breads, cheese, ham, cereals, yogurts, granola, fruit juice, good coffee) We are breakfast eaters, so this price was comparbale with what we paid in the cafes up the street for, say, an omelette etc. The best thing about the hotel is it's convenient location in a real Parisien neighborhood... I couldn't believe how close Rue Cler is...literally a 1 miute walk out the door and you have everything and anything! 2 sidewalk cafes and a bakery as soon as you reach the corner...numerous other restaurants, a crepe place, ice cream, fruit and vegetable markets, all kinds of shops...I felt like Belle in the opening scene from Beauty and the Beast!! The metro station and bus stop were in close proximity. And the Eiffel Tower was about a 15 - 20 minute stroll away. All in all, a great place to be for a 5 day stay in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ajjMichigan
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the middle of Rue Cler. The rooms were small but clean and perfect for us as we spent most of our time site seeing. The hotel is within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and Napolean's Tomb. There is a grocery store across the street and a laundry mat within a block. Lots of cafes and shops for cheese, pastries, flowers, meats, bread, fruits, etc. within a block. Close to the metro as well. The staff was very helpful and spoke very good English. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: kwolfe9
Reviews.Content: Good location, front desk staff very good, close to Eiffel Tower, and around the corner from some outdoor caffes.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: ColBabyDoc
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel located near a great pedestrian zone with many cafes. The place is modern in character and the rooms small, but they are efficient, clean and quiet. Free WIFI, but slow. Desktop computers and printers available for guests for free. Nice little breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Alie999
Reviews.Content: Such a fantastic hotel and 5min walk from the Eiffel Tower. I loved this hotel and the staff were excellent. I will stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: ANDODI
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Cadran met our expectations. American travelers should be prepared for a very helpful and easy to deal with staff, a really small but well maintained room that is clean with an acceptable sized clean bathroom. (Luckily there was a wastebasket that doubled as the support for our second suitcase.) Also, be prepared for a very convenient location in the nice Rue Cler area with a well stocked small market across the street, a clean laundromat down the side street, a well rated sidewalk cafe a few steps from the door on Rue Cler, with Ulysses en Gaule (for crepes, Greek salad and good fun banter) nearby and, if you are a walker, the Eiffel Tower, Napoleon's Tomb, Musee d'Orsay, the Louvre and more are very accessible. A Metro station is very near and an RER train station is a bit farther. We look for a hotel that is clean and well located with a good bathroom. The hotel fits the bill very well.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant little hotel. Eiffel tower just 5 mins away!”
Reviews.Author: kameleonek
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern and charming. The location is just perfect if you want to do a bit of walking about, it is close to all of the important sites and if you'd like to visit other side of the city the metro station is very near by. they have access to the Internet and sell delicious macaroons downstairs. Reception staff is very helpful even though they probably get asked the same questions all the time. Rooms are small, but they are laid out smart and very comfortable, anyway who would be spending time in their room other than getting some sleep while staying in Paris- there is so much to see and do. All in all- we'll definately be back as it was real value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and sweet hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: unclesmooth
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel du Cadran very much. The staff was very nice and helpful. They have computers for the guests to use. The location is just a half block from the Rue Cler. We didn't have breakfast because it was cheaper to walk around the corner, but I'm sure they do a good job with it. We were basically just pretty tight about how we spent our money. My only bit of advice concerns the TV. If you have a husband that is obsessive about channel surfing, take the channel changer AWAY from him. They have special channel changers that can easily screw up if you press the wrong button. My husband did it FIVE times. If it happens to you, unplug the TV cable from the back, wait a minute and replug it. That's the only way to fix it. Also, the rooms are well appointed and comfortable, but small. If you're picky about that, or need more room, I would try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: wkiser44
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted on check-in, this charming hotel was a wonderful experience. The young lady behind the desk, with wonderful English and always a smile, provide help with what to see, how to get there, where to eat, etc. The hotel is located 1 block from rue Cler, the local street market. We walked to the Eiffel Tower. Many places to eat nearby. The room was small by American standards but quite comfortable. It was spotlessly clean and well kept. The king bed very comfortable. The air conditioning worked fine though was hardly needed in April. I would highly recommend this small hotel as an excellent option in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “My new home!”
Reviews.Author: Happyhubby&Daddy
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Paris twice a year, for the past 11 years. I have stayed at 4 star down to 2 star hotels. I love the Rue Cler area but my go to hotel was fully booked. I booked at the Valadon which was my old stand by and got a room. It had been taken over by the Hotel Cadran about a year ago..When I showed up, I walked over the Cadran and found out that my room would be in their hotel. Not sure what to expect, I hoped the room was at least comfortable! All I can say is WOW! The rooms were re-furbished a few years back and now have a sleek, modern appeal. They were spotlessly clean(my #1 priority - I hate the "black hair in the bathtub" scenario when you enter the room for the first time). My second request is that the front office staff are helpful. I was incredibly overwhelmed with how gracious they were. A special shout out to Kristy - so helpful and prompt. I will never stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Parisian Get-Away!”
Reviews.Author: Soon2bMrsPeru
Reviews.Content: After a long and painful search for the perfect hotel I finally found it in the Hotel du Cadran! It lends the perfect complement to anyone's Parisian adventure. Their rooms are small compared to anything you'll find in the states but clean and well put together. My fiancÃ©e and I were there for 8 days with 2 huge suitcases, a couple of backpacks, a carry-on suitcase, (and since it was still quite cold during our visit) several very heavy and large coats and we still managed to have enough room to move around easily. The hotel was also in the perfect spot for first time visitors or even returning lovers of Paris since everything you could want is right within walking distance. There's a post office, bank, grocery stores, bread and cheese shops, restaurants,the metro, the Eiffel Tower, and Les Invalides all right in the area! Seriously all within a 5 minute walk. The staff all spoke perfect English and were very helpful. True story: My fiancÃ©e and I had booked a shuttle service to pick us up from the hotel and drop us off at the airport and we tried on our own to get a hold of this shuttle service but we could neither figure out how to dial the number correctly and didn't understand what the lady on the phone was saying since she was speaking French so...in complete frustration we go down to the lobby and ask the woman at the front desk to please help us and she completely took care of everything! Even in the morning when the shuttle was late the man working the front desk also called the shuttle service for us to make sure they were on their way. I will put in though that the safe in our room didn't work but the front desk gave us an envelope that we put our passports in and sealed the envelope ourselves and they locked it in their safe downstairs which didn't bother us at all though may be a problem for others. There's also a small fridge in the room that they use as a mini bar and that we also kept stocked with a few things that we bought ourselves. The fridge is kept a tiny bit lower than room temperature which wasn't very pleasant if you wanted an ice cold drink but did keep my pÃ¢tÃ© and cheese from spoiling so it worked for me! And since the hotel is on the corner of the Rue Cler which seems like a slightly posh hang out spot for 20 somethings the noise from the restaurants doesn't die down until about 1am. Then around 5-6am trucks start coming down the street. Dropping off goods at the many stores or picking up garbage (which we found out gets picked up everyday). The noise is quite tolerable if you've been to a big city before and if you're like me then you'll find the constant chatter and the sound of the Parisian's scooters coming and going's to be quite charming and part of Paris' allure. I only mention the few negative things I could find about this hotel because I know not everyone is like me and may not find these few flaws to be enchanting. But, truly, nothing diminished my thoughts of the Hotel du Cadran and I will definitely be recommending this hotel to my own family and friends and hope to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience, the Hotel was cozy, perfect for our visit and conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: Honzalee
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely boutique Hotel in a very nice neighborhood. The rooms are small but had everything we needed; beds were so comfortable; well-appointed room and bath; quiet at night. Traveling with a teenager and the double twin was perfect. Had a view of the Eiffel Tower at night from our room and the chocolate bar in the lobby was perfect for us. Staff were friendly, helpful, cheerful and competent. Very close to the #69 bus recommended by Rick Steves as a great way to see the city of Paris on your own as well as the Metro nearby. Walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, museums, the river, many nice bistros, shops and a great way to experience Paris as if you lived there.

Reviews.Title: “So happy we chose Cadran”
Reviews.Author: SierraMirador
Reviews.Content: After much research to find a hotel for a family of 4, we selected Hotel du Cadran and we are so pleased with our choice. We were in adjoining rooms, one with a bathroom with shower only (double bed) and one with a bathroom with tub and shower (twin beds). Working windows looked out onto the quiet side street. We walked everywhere from here, Musee d'Orsay, Eiffel Tower, Louvre/Orangerie, and in between. We felt safe walking in this area, even after midnight on the way back from the Eiffel Tower with our children. There is not much extra space in the room (normal for Paris), but it was just fine for all of us and our suitcases. The bathroom is a study in an efficient use of space and we appreciated the small refrigerator in the room. Very clean room. Reception staff was great (suggestions, directions, reservations, taxis); car to airport was early and got us there in plenty of time. Next time in Paris will no doubt be at the Hotel du Cadran!

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: astute49
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel firstly for location then used trip advisor to get views of others. This hotel does not disappoint. The area is great for some of the main attractions Paris has and when you have had a busy day there are numerous restraunts to while away the evening . The staff at the hotel are the most friendly and helpful we have encountered on our travels in Europe and the USA over the years.If like us its your first time in Paris this hotel with the friendly helpful staff is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Catymr
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Du Cadran! It is located in a nice area where you can walk around the corner and find restaurants and shops. Also, the staff were very helpful and friendly. They helped us get around when we asked for help. They speak English and Spanish. The room and restroom were kinda of small but they were really modern and chic. The bed was super comfortable. Since it was our honeymoon, they gave us a bottle of champagne. We would definitely stay there again and recommend this hotel to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood, comfy hotel and chocolate bar in the lobby”
Reviews.Author: Saraworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days upon the recommendation of a colleague. I couldn't have been happier with the hotel. The front desk staff was always very helpful and friendly and the location was perfect. The hotel is just one block off the charming pedestrian street, Rue Cler, that has many restaurants, cafes, bakeries, fruit stands and several other chocolate shops, in case the shop in the lobby of the hotel itself isn't enough for you. Also the hotel is within a few blocks of the Eiffel Tour and a couple Metro stops making it extremely easy to get everywhere by train. We only took a cab twice the four days. Commenting on the room size is always deceiving when talking about European hotels as they are almost always a lot smaller than US ones, but although typically smaller than in the States, the room was comfortable and made great use of a small space. We were perfectly fine with two of us in there, and I think we had the basic room. If you have children with you, you might inquire if there are larger rooms as I can imagine with the periphenlilia associated with kids the room we were in would have been too small for you. We didn't try the breakfast at the hotel, so I can't comment on that. But if you opt for breakfast on your own, there are so many little places within 2 blocks that you won't go hungry. The hotel is on a corner but with very little traffic going by. Even though we had a room along the street, with the windows closed it wasn't very loud. We loved having the big windows open during the day, but would usually close them at night and they were pretty soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: rkoca
Reviews.Content: Very nice and well designed hotel, Free wifi...very good macarons ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Three cheers for Hotel du Cadran!”
Reviews.Author: pbasone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel du Cadran on a quick business/pleasure trip to Paris. Staff were friendly and very helpful with directions and recommendations. Rooms were very clean, beds very comfortable, showers strong and hot, lighting excellent. Rooms are small, but they have been designed very thoughtfully to meet all your needs. Location is terrific. Just steps from the Tour Eiffel, but in a neighborhood designed for locals. Shopping, eateries, cafe's are right out the door. Charming Rue Cler is just around the corner. Restaurants in the 7ieme offer excellent dining options. Easy to access all you want to see in Paris. Don't forget to sample the heavenly macaroons from the chocolate boutique adjacent to the lobby. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at these good reviews”
Reviews.Author: enchilada72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a week long trip to London and Paris. 4 days in London and 3 in Paris. After staying here, I am surprised at these wonderful reviews. I have always trusted Trip Advisors' reviews, but I don't agree with this one. We arrived on Wednesday and really liked the area. There were cafes, a small grocery store, and a bakery all within sight from the room window. Very handy. But with all of these come the problems. The room was extremely small. It was the "Superior King"; Superior to what...I am afraid to ask. I have been in cheap staterooms on cruises that were larger than this room. So the A/C didn't work in the room, only the heat. This made it very stuffy. We opened the window only to find that the cafe was busy until after midnight. It was extremely loud. Plus our window opened right above the cafe and even though we were 4 floors up, it sounded as if we were in the cafe. As patrons left, it was a little bit quieter, but then the employees left about an hour later. With all of their motor bikes and cars now making the noise, after their post work conversations and shouting matches. Then in a few hours the other businesses are opening for the hustle an bustle of the morning. Not much time to sleep in between that. Then the walls are so thin I could hear the conversations taking place in the hall and the buzzing of the small elevator. So there is a lot of noise for this small hotel. Now for the actual hotel and it's service. We arrived and was never offered anything such as extra services, tours, maps or anything. Here is your room key and au revoir, basically you are on your own. We made it to our room with their single creaky elevator. The room is tiny. A very small armoire to hang about 4 items. No place for suitcases. No seats, but the bed and the sheets and towels smelled like vinegar. The sheets were rough like sandpaper. I ended up with dermatitis because I have very sensitive skin. They only left 2 towels in the room so I requested 2 more, and the desk clerk brought up a tub mat. This was odd. The fridge was hidden in a small hole in the wall (literally), but didn't keep anything cold. I guess basically you get what you pay for in Paris. In fact the first night (while I was wide awake listening to the patrons of the cafe below...even once the windows were closed), I spent hours looking for a different hotel on my iPad. Basically if you are going to Paris, splurge a little and stay at one of the finer hotels. It would be well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Rue Cler neighborhood chic Parisian”
Reviews.Author: Inanna12
Reviews.Content: The perfect small hotel in the perfect semi-residential neighborhood; complete with open market pedestrian street and high value intimate restaurants. Rue Cler is tucked away between Tour Eiffel and Invalides and within 15 minutes walk of the Seine. Du Cadran has managed to integrate ultra modern style with wholly Parisian chic. Easy metro and RER connections to desired sites. My standard room was compact, pleasant, and efficient with large bath and great windows. The staff could not be more gracious nor helpful. They went out of their way to make my stay feel like home. The breakfast, room and food, was a delightful way to begin the day. I am frequent Paris visitor and choose only this neighborhood. Du Cadran is best hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Greatscots
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay here and really enjoyed it for location and facilities. The rooms are small but well planned using all available space. I've never stayed in a hotel where you can watch TV through a window in the bathroom while in the shower. This nacky highlight is because of the hotels use of natural light and light saving which is a feature throughout the hotel. There are a few good quality restaurants within walking distance and the food produce shops (also local) are fabulous. Eiffel Tower is walkable. The hotel uses

Reviews.Title: “perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: sophia7777
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent...brand new, well designed, fantastic location close to the Eiffel Tower and the city center..situated in a very "parisian" neibourhood, chic, calm but also very lively. The only negative was that the room was slightly small, as with most boutique hotels...but other than that everything was great..Also good breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Consistantly a great experience, great location, the best friendly service”
Reviews.Author: ComanderCody
Reviews.Content: I have tried several other Hotels in Paris and keep coming back to the Cadran. Great location, very nice rooms, not too busy but still great shops and cafes. The service is what really keeps me coming back, the staff go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. Of cousre I can't forget the fantastic Chocolate bar in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff. Wonderful if you need to stay in that area...”
Reviews.Author: capricapers
Reviews.Content: Lovely welcome, friendly, helpful service and clean room. Excellent location for Tour Eiffel and some good bistros close by. We had the Junior Suite (ground floor) which we shared with our children; it was very clean and the beds very comfortable. Recommended if you need to stay in the area which, incidentally, felt very safe to walk around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, modern, clean boutique hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: wdriggers
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel du Cadran in Paris. We planned a trip to meet two other couples at the hotel to stay 3-4 days to enjoy Paris. Being in the 7th arr, most attractions are very convenient, the Eiffel tower, the Louvre and Muse Orsay are all within walking distance. If walking is not your pleasure, the Metro is within a few blocks in several directions. Since we traveled with our 15 year old son, we had adjoining rooms which worked out great. The staff was overwhelmingly helpful with making reservations for our entire group plus making certain our needs were tended to the entire time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Clean hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: JPiworld
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were shocked by the size of the rooms but unfortunately this is the drawback of hotels in Paris. Everything else about the hotel was perfect, the hotel and the room were sparkling clean, and the bedsheets were changed every day. The location of the hotel was also great, within easy reach of everything, a 3 minute walk from the metro and a 5 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. The hotel had a chocolate bar, with excellent chocolates and very tasty macaroons! Overall, a very nice, modern and clean hotel in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Vive la Hotel du Cadran”
Reviews.Author: madgematt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel du Cadran over Valentines weekend and the hotel helped make the trip one to remember. The service was friendly, helpful and professional. The room itself was really nice, a good size for a short stay (1-5days), clean and well decorated. The real bonus was the area. Close enough to take a 10 min stroll to the Effiel Tower and well serviced by the La Tour Maubourg metro station which enabled us to get around Paris with ease. It's about 50mins from Charles du Gaulle airport on the RER and metro. The hotel is surrounded by bistros, patisseries, resturants, markets and fromageries with a real local feel. Our stay was enhanced by knowing we had chosen well in our accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: bec30
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cadran is perfect for a short city break! The rooms are small and quite basic but very clean and has everything you need & the staff are very helpful & friendly! Also......who doesnt love a chocolate shop in their hotel!!! Location wise - perfect - the eiffel tower is a 10 min walk at the most and very easy for the metro!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, great staff and accessible”
Reviews.Author: Andyjade
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome stay the Hotel du Cadran, the room was very clean and the hotel is perfectly located to all the main attractions in Paris. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel and did not have to use buses or the metro. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially one of the ladies who went out of her way to make sure we were happy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel that is modern, reasonably priced and central. I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and small beds but immaculate”
Reviews.Author: PhilKennedy
Reviews.Content: The Cadran will be my standard stopover now for visiting friends in the Invalides area. There's nothing bland about the rooms and two very fussy forty-somethings got a real lift from walking into our room. Be warned that there's not the slightest soundproofing between the room and the bathroom. Prepared to lose all inhibitions. The design and standards of decor are leagues ahead of the other small hotels I've used in Paris at this price range (about Â£100 for the room on this trip).

Reviews.Title: “spotless, convenient, well-staffed”
Reviews.Author: prof-dean
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Cadran was a great location for a week's stay in winter. The room was small but well laid out, with a full-sized bath. The staff were great: helpful, generous and attentive. In French and in English, they were equally effective. The bed was firm -- providing a perfect night's sleep. We stored some of our luggage there while we took a short trip to London and back -- the hotel staff was very accommodating. The streets close by were full of good, moderately- priced restaurants and the river was an easy walk's distance. We will return with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and comfortable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Izza99
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon and Paris was the start of our Europe trip. We stayed at Hotel Cadran for 6 nights and we had a great time. The staff members, including the staff from the chocolate boutique were friendly, kind and very accommodating. We had arrived early and as our room was not yet ready till 2pm, they had let us put our luggage in a safe area and we were able to sight see Paris without having to worry about our luggage. Our room was very nice, there were many modern amenities and comfortable bed. The location of the hotel is very close to the Eiffel Tower and there were many good restaurants just around the corner from the hotel. It is also known to be a good area in Paris and we felt very safe walking around the district at night. The chocolate boutique in the hotel lobby was very delicious and we recommend trying the macaroons. We fell in love with Paris and we are definitely coming back to stay at Hotel du Cadran again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Hayley_Light84
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautifully decorated, with very friendly and helpful staff. The staff spoke brilliant English and were able to advise us on all questions we had. The double room which we had was very clean and nicely decorated. The bed was very comfortable with all the necessary amenities. The hotel provided us with complimentary toiletries and sewing kit (which was vital in restoring a few buttons onto my coat in this cold weather!). The individual thermostats in the room allowed us to adjust our rooms to a temperature that suited us, which was great! Also, the lighting was very impressive! We did not have a chance to sample the chocolates and drinks from the shop, but they looked great and smelt wonderful as we walked through to our room. The location of the hotel was excellent, within a few minutes of the Eiffel Tower, with a few restaurants nearby. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, as there were several cafes within easy walking distance and we fancied a walk before breakfast. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good base to see the sights from (as Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Louvre, etc are all within easy walking distance).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: vjoseph
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel du Cadran for 4 nights in January 2011. Chose to stay here from the reviews on Trip Advisor. Located close to the Eiffel Tower and Invalides. In a fantastic area for restaurants (Restaurant Mariette, Le Billebaude, Les Bosquet) and fresh produce. Easy walk to both the Metro and RER. The staff we're all very friendly and helpful, the communal areas were clean with a modern look. The bedroom was on the 5th floor, small but fine for our needs. A couple of things we did feel the room lacked were tea and coffee making facilities and an area to store bags/suitcases (there was a small area under the wall hung seat but only suitable for one medium sized suitcase). One thing that did annoy us (but only slightly) was the main door into the room had a rather large door stop, preventing the door from opening fully and finishing at quite a distance from the wall which made it awkward entering and exiting the room, especially with luggage. Apart from these minor things we had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel: - clean friendly and in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence1980
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The reception staff were very helpful, the hotel is well located and the room was clean, pleasantly stylish and very good value. Nothing bad to say.

Reviews.Title: “It was really pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: Fayez_11
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in the title above, we had a very pleasent stay. All the people at the reception were great. they speak good English. In addition, they didn't spare any effort in guiding us to where ever we want to go with all options and best choices. So, that modern style really deserve a visit and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and beautifully located...”
Reviews.Author: jbltd
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days at Hotel Cadran. The staff were very kind, helpful and well informed. I loved the minimalist decor of the rooms. They had everything you would want but in a very well designed modern concept. The bedside shelves that served as tables were a bit too small but, the bathrooms were fantastic. The up to the minute fixtures and decor really were a delight. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Also it is so well placed for both sides of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Cadran is Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: RandellT1
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at Hotel du Cadran on December 22-28, 2010 for the Christmas holidays and found it to be outstanding. Although we normally stay in the 7th near rue Cler, we wanted to try Hotel du Cadran and were pleasantly suprised. The hotel is clean and modern, the staff was quite helpful, and the location is close to Champs du Mars, rue Cler and the metro at Ecole Militaire. Although the rooms are a little small, they were more than adequate and in summer months the hotel is air conditioned. Overall we highly recommend Hotel du Cadran and had a great experience with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect winter break”
Reviews.Author: Torsika
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from Paris, and I must say we enjoyed our stay at this beautiful little hotel to the full. The room, however small it may be (but who cares anyway, as long as it is tastefully designed and clean with a very comfortable bed?!) satisfied our all needs. The breakfast wasn't on the cheap side, but it offered a substantial meal in a nice environment before we started our "tours". And the neighbourhood....was well beyond expectations!!! Friendly, small town atmosphere with bakeries,shops, cafÃ©s, cheap restaurants etc, and also quiet and literally just a few blocks away from everything! Bring your walking shoes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, hard to get sleep in some rooms”
Reviews.Author: tt293
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a total of three nights. The rooms were nicely decorated, modern and very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. However, on our first night we had a room on the first floor adjacent to the elevator. Due to the lack of sound insulation and very loud elevator doors, it was impossible to sleep. Every time somebody used the elevator, it was as if a noisy sliding door was opened and closed right next to our bed! After we complained at the reception the next morning, we received a different room, which was further away from the elevator, and a cooled bottle of wine in the room. The breakfast was good, but unspectacular, and you can find a better deal in the cafes in the neighborhood. Overall we have to say that it is a lovely hotel if you can avoid the rooms next to the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: E_kai_G
Reviews.Content: we recommend it! The location is excellent...the metro station (Ecole Militaire) is too close!!!! the hotel is very clean!!!! The breakfast is very good!!! The only drawback is that the room is too small!!!

Reviews.Title: “Third Time at This Hotel In A Year”
Reviews.Author: Ricardoswaldo
Reviews.Content: As the caption says this is our third time to this hotel in a year. The staff are always very helpful and freindly. There is a chocolate bar next to reception as you enter where you can have a drink and relax. There is free wifi at this hotel. Location is near to the eiffel tower about 5 minutes walk away. The metro is also close by so you can access all the attractions very easily. The rooms are very clean some have a shower and others have a shower and a bath. There is also a mini bar in the room. This hotel is a gem and one cannot help loving the charm of the place and the warm welcome after a hard days shopping or sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “The French are rude? Not at Hotel du Cadran!”
Reviews.Author: reinjay
Reviews.Content: I only have one complaint- our shower water temperature and pressure was inconsistent. Other than that, LOVED IT! Location! Location! Location! You can not find a better location. It is right off of Rue Cler which is easily the most charming street I have ever seen. The hotel has a modern design that is chic yet not stuffy. The staff was extremely friendly upon arriving at the hotel and that level of friendliness stayed consistent throughout our stay. This was my first trip to Paris and I should I ever return I will, without a doubt, stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: eagle1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner. Location is great! about 10 mins to the Eiffel Tour and convenience store across the road from the hotel. Many cafes and brasseries to eat in. If you want a nice take way e.g pasta or pizza, there's a nice place a few streets away. Sorry forgotten what it's called. Hotel room was just right. Down side is that a superior room is two twin beds put together. Bathroom was small but excellent for 2 people. The wi fi did not work in the room and there were no english channels on TV. Also convenient for the metro station (ecole militaire) much cheaper than a taxi. Overall a great hotel for a 2 nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, within easy reach of restuarants and tour sights”
Reviews.Author: renzo1960
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but very comfortable and modern, unfortunately there was very little hot water which made things a little a awkward especially with showering. Breakfast was ok and staff were courteous and friendly. This is hotel for couples and is not really suited to families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: CDO863
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights. Clean hotel, great location. Within walking distance of food, shopping and Parisian sights. Elevator is small and can be slow. Room is small but layout is quite functional for the size. No smoking terrace. The ride from CDG took longer than I expected, not a big deal, though, just saying... We arranged for a ride thru the hotel, our driver was on time, friendly, safe, and the price was fair (prearranged thru the hotel). Concierge very helpful and courteous. We were looking for a decent place to stay as we went sight-seeing all over Paris. Hotel du Cadran fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: yalopez
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what I was looking for. I have never traveled alone, so it was important for me to be in a place where I could feel safe being alone. Staff? Everyone was incredibly nice and helpful. The location was perfect as I was able to walk to ALL the museums on my list, and then some others. Rue Cler is half a block away, so there are lots of different places to either grab a quick bite to eat or sit down to a nice meal -- all very affordable. I promised my daughter to bring her with me on my next trip to Paris, which hopefully will be same time next year! One thing I will do differently is ask for a room in a higher floor because being near Rue Cler means lots of delivery trucks very early in the morning to the shops nearby. This hotel was definitely the best place where I could have stayed, and I know my daughter will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bimbo67
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hotel Cadran as my wife's birthday treat. We loved the situation - we could walk to all the places we wanted to see on this visit (particularly the Monet exhibition at the Grand Palais). The decor is clean and modern - great bathroom. We both slept well as the street is not a busy one. Breakfast was really good, with a charming lady (Nicole) overseeing it all. Lots of good eating places close by and the Metro (Ecole Militaire) near by too. If visiting Paris again, we would definitely return to the Cadran.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: martaplaza
Reviews.Content: Please note that I I am a Puertorrican used to the phrase "supersize", so yes, I did find the rooms tiny. We got a "cuadruple", which is a fantastic concept of one queen size room conecting with a room with two twins. This I found great, and would strongly suggest other hoteliers to adopt the idea. The rooms, though, are minuscule. You either have your suitcase available or walk around the bed. It is impossible to do both. If you want to open the window, you will not be able to walk around the bed on that side. There's just no space. Still, we were in Paris to see the city, not to hang out in the room. The rooms use minimalist decor, are impecable,and the hotel's location can't be better. The hotel is in a very quaint small side street nestled between Rue Cler and Ave Bosquet. Yes you do hear the mopeds, delivery trucks and garbage trucks (we were in the second floor), however, nothing really happnes between 10pm and 8am, so no major problems with street noise. The Ecole Militare Metro station is only a 5 min walk from the hotel, and you can walk everywhere. The hotel has great breakfast buffet. Although it is a bit overpriced at 13 euros, I think is a great way to get used to what a french breakfast is. I would suggest to have breakfast there the first morning and then head out to the many cafes surrounding the area from there on. (Yes, for us americans, breakfast is a "different" experience. My kids hated it. But hey! you are in France, so inmerse yourself in the french experience!!!) The hotel staff is exellent, friendly and corteus. Thay gave us suggestions and were available. However, on our last afternoon, we had an issue with a very strong chemical odor coming from the building next door (which was being stripped and painted). We told the front desk girl (wish I had gotten her name), and she just shrugged, said that she didn't smell anything and suggested we closed the windows (they were closed, it was 30 degrees outside). Of course I went to talk to her with the expectation of an offer to move us to rooms on the other side of the building, but her attitude was very dismissive...In all, this is a wonderful quiet "boutique style" hotel, that lets you experience Paris like a parisian, and why would we go to Paris, if not to do exactly that??

Reviews.Title: “We were happy to stay at Hotel du Cadran in Nov. 2010.”
Reviews.Author: familyDoha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, nice and comfortable. We were for five days visit to Paris and we found that the location of the hotel is very good and it is easy to reach many good tourist places by walking. The breakfast at the hotel was very good, but there is no room service for the rest of the day like tea, coffee or snacks.You can find many cafes near the hotel but it will be more comfortable if you have something at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super in all respects-staff, room, location, clean, etc.”
Reviews.Author: bwg53
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a outstanding staff which was responsive in all respects. The location provides a "village' atmosphere while being within walking distance of sightseeing points of interest. Rooms have been recently renovated and are extremely clean with flatscreen TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lauren066
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in November and we absolutely loved it. The rooms--while small--are super nice and very modern. It was the perfect amount of space for two of us. Additionally, we cannot say enough about the location. The nearby Rue Cler is such an amazing street with plenty of non-touristy cafes and shops. I highly recommend this hotel for people traveling to Paris for the first time. The staff was very friendly and spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: photokraut
Reviews.Content: i spent one night at Hotel Cadran in the 7ieme arondissement in Paris; the hotel is in a very quiet street which is not a thoroughfare; this is extremely important in Paris as street noise can be considerable already very early in the morning, think of dust carts emptying bins, early morning lorry or van deliveries to businesses, screeching mopeds etc. none of that ! the room was pleasantly modern and uncluttered, it was small but as there were no unnecessary objects or furnishings, i had the feeling of plenty of space to spread out my papers and laptop etc. there is a narrow ledge along the wall opposite the bed which is wide enough to put things like wallet, mobile, glasses, keys etc room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. the lighting is excellent in room and bathroom, it can be dimmed and there is even a reading light on each side of the bed in case you are not on your own and you do not wish to disturb your partner. a nicely sorted mini bar which i did not use. 5 min walk to nearest Metro Station (Ecole Militaire). free WiFi internet access in the room, my only minor complaint would be that the access is open and not secured with an access key. i found the staff very helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Not 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: FCPSDeputy
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with many merchants and restaurants nearby. Close to subway stop. However, the shower didn't drain. I had to take a navy shower and still didn't have enough space in the drain pan for my water. I reported it to the desk, and they didn't fix it-- two nights--miserable showers. The safe in my room didn't work even with front office intervention--and by the way--the safe is not attached to anything and can be carried right out of the room??? They have very limited HVAC. It only heats in the winter and only cools in the summer. We had two warm days in November and the only way to bring the temperature down was to open our first floor doors--a bit of a security and rodent risk. The lighting is very modern and VERY impractical. They have tight spot lights in the bathroom and only one side of your face is lit--try shaving or makeup under those circumstances. And the halls are dark enough to be part of an amusement park ride. Overall I was shocked at the high reviews on Tripadvisor. I expected much better, paid a rather high price and was quite disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “much too modern”
Reviews.Author: sonjar2000
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my daughter and had to move from Hotel Duquesne (after a week) as they were booked. The three nights in Hotel du Cadran made it much easier to go home. The staff were kind and polite, great location, the chocolate shop cute, breakfast delicious...but the rooms and the entry way were cold...not warm and inviting. The lights outside our room often didn't work so it was a little scary trying to find the elevator. I kept wishing that we had been able to book across the street at another Rick Steves recommended hotel... If you like cozy and luxurious -plus the best service in France, go to Hotel Duquesne!

Reviews.Title: “Location, courteous service, helpfulness and the best price”
Reviews.Author: rossbald
Reviews.Content: Beds are great, bathrooms adequate, shower pressure not so good on the 5th floor. Lift very slow. Breakfast great down in the cellar. Fresh food, and great coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff add to a great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sbp2
Reviews.Content: We used to stay at HdC in the late 1990s when we lived in Belgium and were glad to return there again. The style of the hotel has changed to very modern, but it is still very comfortable. What we love most is the location. It is not in a touristy area; rather, on a more "local" street with shops, cafes, and the nice Rue Cler market. You can easily get to the Ecole Militaire metro stop as well as a short walk to the Champ du Mars and Tour Eiffel. You can feel safe walking around this neighborhood. There are many very nice restaurants in the area too which is nice for a late evening dinner - no metros to figure out and very homey atmospheres. The staff is wonderful! They speak excellent English and are so helpful, whether on the telephone, on the email, or in person. They arranged and confirmed dinner reservations for us very graciously. One night, we were having troubles with the cable TV and the young man from the desk came up to check it out. He called someone else and voila! it was fixed in no time. We didn't even expect it to be fixed right away as we were going out to dinner, but prompt service is key for this staff. As a previous reviewer stated, our one complaint about the room was the heat. We, too, felt that the room was much too hot. Forget about sleeping with that lovely duvet. We usually kept the window open in the early a.m. and when we were getting ready to go out in the evening. We also had a couple of problems with the shower water coming in hot and staying at an even temperature, but mostly we attributed this to it be a hotel. It has happened in other hotels at prime times too. We had a superior king room and, while it was compact, it was perfectly comfortable. The closet was plenty big enough to hang up coats, slacks, and shirts as well as put in several pairs of shoes. You must remember that this is not a giant US hotel room. Our experience with European hotel rooms is that they are generally smaller than American rooms. The bath was always clean and fully stocked with toiletries and fresh shower caps and towels. We have recommended this hotel in the past to friends who were living in both Europe and the US and all were pleased. We will continue to consider Hotel du Cadran our "home away from home" in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Beantown2
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but comfortable. Staff was incredible in helping us get to where we wanted to go. They seemed sincere in making your stay in Paris the best it could be. Rue Cler is just wonderful. We stayed eight days and the time flew.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sandsy40
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 2 adults and 2 children aged 7 and 5 and were travelling to Paris for a quick autumn half-term trip to show our children the major tourist sites. We only had 4 nights available to us and booked Hotel du Cadran after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel was largely very much as we expected from both its own website and from the reviews on Tripadvisor. Although the rooms are compact, they are comfortable and modern. We had interconnecting rooms on the 3rd floor that were ideal for a family in our position. The children's room had twin beds and the double room had a queensized bed. The main bedroom had a shower only, the children's bathroom had a bath with shower over. The closet space was more than sufficient for our 4 night stay. The free Wi-fi and the free use of 2 computers in the lobby was a bonus. The location is quiet but convenient - just over 5 mins walk from the nearest Metro, with plenty of restaurants nearby and a good variety of shops and small supermarkets. It is also within 10-15mins walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. Reception was efficient (and spoke good English) and both check-in and check-out were painless. We ate breakfast in the hotel every morning (13 Euros) - a largely cold buffet with juices, fruit salad, yoghurt, cold meats and cheeses, cereals, French bread, croissants, pain au chocolat and other pastries, a toaster for toast - and an egg boiler. A coffee machine and tea making facilities completed the offering. Supplies were topped up frequently, or readily on request. Our children were given free jars of sweets on 2 out of the 4 mornings which was a nice touch. Room cleaning was efficent and sheets seemed to be changed halfway through our stay. Our only minor gripe was that our room was TOO hot. And the more we tried to turn down the thermostat, the hotter it seemed to get! I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, comfortable bed and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: eiffel3
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the room was very nicely decorated and the bed was so comfortable and pillows better then we had at home. The location was perfect, close to the Eiffel Tower and great restuarants near by. We really enjoyed Paris and will be coming back and when we do we will stay at this hotel again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “sadly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ptbooth
Reviews.Content: For my third trip to Paris in the past 3 years (first at former Hilton Paris, then apartment through VIP), I opted for HdC based on TA reviews and Rick Steves' recommendation for a romantic vacation for two, where I wanted the added luxury of fresh linens and room cleaning missing from apt rental, but in a great central location. Sadly, I was overall disappointed. Maybe we got the worst room(s). I chose a Superior King with hopes of a bigger/nicer bed and room, but were initially given 108, which is one of the interior rooms facing a wall on the ground floor. Perhaps in warmer weather it would be nice to be able to step through the french doors to our own "patio" area (no plants or funiture), but it was cold and dark when we arrived and it felt like a crowded cave, with a big bed you could barely walk around. After some complaining, we were moved up to 308, which had at least some more light and views of windows in neighboring buildings. First the positives. Location is great, Just around the corner from Rue Cler quaintness, blocks from the Eiffel Tower, close to Ecole Militaire metro. Staff overall was friendly and helpful, except the original clerk was not particularly cheery when I first returned to the desk after seeing the original room and asked if this was indeed a Superior King room and she said "yes it is a King bed." I liked the modern decor, slightly confusing but modern lighting control in the rooms, the King bed (2 put together) was big and comfortable, free wifi was great, and the price overall for hotels in good areas of Paris was not unreasonable. But the negatives. Lighting in the hallways was just these footlevel LEDs that triggered when you entered, energy efficient yes, but it always seemed like you were sneaking home at midnight to your hotel and had to stumble through the halls to find your room. Our interior rooms had no real view to speak of (though it was quiet). The closet was basically a very small phone booth with room for 5-7 shirts or so, some tiny shelving, a safe that only fits small items like wallets and passports (not laptops) and nowhere to put your suitcase but on the floor, which left maybe 1 foot of walking space at the foot of the bed (but blocked the window). The far edge of the bed only had enough space to store a suitcase standing up (and no walking room). The "desk" was a triangle wedged into the corner of the room under the TV, where you basically had to sit on the corner of the bed to use. Also, noise from hallways and neighbors somewhat easily heard through thin walls. And then there was the bathroom. Maybe it's just too modern for me. Not decor, which I liked, but: the shower head needed to be tightened to stay up, the open stall was narrow (and I'm a thin person!), the temperature of the water would fluctuate from burning to ice cold and back, the shelf for soap and shampoo was placed outside of the shower across the entry platform, requiring constant reaching outside the shower and complete soaking of the floor with each use, and the walls were glass and metal (which normally I like), but there was really no privacy. The sliding bathroom "door" did little to block noise or odor, so it was almost as bad as having the toilet in the bedroom. So I suppose if you and your spouse are comfortable at home leaving the bathroom door open with one another around, you'd be OK with this. And there was even a window between the bathroom and bedroom! (granted, with bottom half frosted) So I suppose you could conveniently check on your companion in the shower as needed to make sure they're OK. Or it provided natural light into the bathroom. Either way, I could have done without it. Anyway, this has scared me a bit from centrally located hotels in Paris at this price level. Maybe all the rave reviews are with the outer rooms not facing the inside, that may have different configurations. I've had small rooms in NYC and London, but I guess the small size combined with the bathroom issues just made it too much to bear. Next time I may go back to apt rental from VIP (very satisfied before) just to get the space and actual private bathroom at a good price, or chance it with a higher-ranked hotel, but I do not plan to return here. Sad. As I so much wanted to impress my partner with my wise choice, but was instead embarrassed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Cadran never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: Bob-Frederick
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Cadran was exceptional and staying there added immeasurably to the delight of our first trip to Paris. The staff was friendly and efficient--arranging excursions for us, making recommendations, and greeting us warmly upon our return each day. The breakfast was very good and we enjoyed the breakfast room. We were very happy to eat there each morning. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. Computers were available for use by hotel guests, and there was wireless Internet. The location was excellent for sightseeing, convenient for walking or taking the Metro, and near many good restaurants. We were very pleased with all aspects of our stay and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice clean minimalistic business hotel”
Reviews.Author: princesita26
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. The location is very good. Very close to the Eiffel Tower and even to Champs ElysÃ©es, if you're into walking. The street is a very quiet, clean and romantic. You'll sleep very well at night, no sound at all. The rooms are very small but clean and efficient enough. The breakfast service is modest with not very wide choice. It's enough though. The reception is very amicable and helpful, no problem at all with English. Can't say that for the Parisiens though. Be prepared for stuck up Parisiens. Overall, the hotel is a very nice choice in Paris. The location is a +.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location for all our sightseeing and wonderful nights sleep once we returned!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSpecs
Reviews.Content: Our group of 4 spent 5 nights at Hotel du Cadran. Many cafes, patesseries, pubs in vicinity. Easy walking to many sights and the metro. Smaller rooms but all the amenities we needed were so accessible. Very Helpful staff when we needed directions or recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: bluesmixer
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Du Cadran. From our room, we could see the Eiffel tour when you stand at the window. There are food and convenience stores around and a few restaurants (they are great). The hotel and room is modern in furnishing and clean. The room had a single king size that left just enough room to walk around it, but that it was not a problem. There was a "sofa/chair" in the room. The bathroom was excellent and would like to have something like that in my house. We did not have any street noise, but it helps that we were on the 5th floor. Wifi is free. Another reason I like the hotel is the staff. They were friendly and helpful in finding stuff. They spoke English which was a thrill for someone like me with limited vocabulary in french. We did not eat at the hotel because we were always on the go and wanted to get the whole experience of being in Paris. We did try the Macaroons in the lobby and ended up buying a few boxes; they were soooooo good. Overall, I really enjoyed staying at the hotel and would highly recommend it. The price was very reasonable and we even got an extra discount when we booked directly from Cadran's Website for a 3 night stay. The pictures on their Web site was not deceiving unlike some other hotels. Btw, you can leave your key at the lobby so you don't have to carry it around.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and charming”
Reviews.Author: Snasho
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the sister hotel, Valadon, just around the corner for 3 nights and then were upgraded for our final night because we were on our honeymoon. Arrived at the room and there was a chilled bottle of champagne with some macaroons! Unexpected and marvellous.

Reviews.Title: “small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: CBinNY
Reviews.Content: Terrific accessible location with shops & cafes next door; front desk staff had great restaurant recommendations & were otherwise helpful in every way you'd hope for. My corner room had patchy internet access since it's apparently farthest from the router on each floor, but the trade-off was a full bath and big windows in two directions so I decided to stay put (& occasionally bring my laptop to the lobby to work). Rooms are small -- not much desk space -- but perfectly adequate, good value. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: AllenCalgary_Alberta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel du Cadran at the end of a month long tour of Spain, Morocco, Portugal and ending in Paris. We chose this hotel because it was a recommended hotel in our Rick Steve's Paris 2010 book. Rick's books never disappoint! The location, in the heart of the Rue Clare district, was most enjoyable! There were restaurants all around the hotel as well as a grocery shop, and dry cleaners right across the street. There was also a cheese store right next door. We were able to walk to some sites from this location as well as catch the Metro that was only a block away. There were two bank machines located just around the corners of the Hotel. There is also a chocolate shop located right in the lobby of the hotel. There were two computers for internet use at no charge and they had a lovely breakfast included in the price we paid. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. Although it was a bit expensive it was a nice way to end our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff, small but immaculate rooms”
Reviews.Author: dlandjm
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the staff here. I am happy to endorse this hotel, however I did not like Trip advisor telling me I had to write 50 words. I do not have that much to imput or the time to do so, but felt the hotel deserved an atta boy.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Paris Trip”
Reviews.Author: CandCjax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I combined business with celebrating our 30th wedding anv. The location of Hotel du Cadran is awesome for light walks in the parks near by, all kinds of food at your door step, quite in your room at night, even though you sit on a busy all day and up to 12:00 pm street with locals and tourist alike. This area of Paris is comfortable for English speaking Americans. This was our 3rd trip to Paris over a 8 year span. We have stayed now at three Hotels in this area called Rue Clare and the Hotel du Cadran is the nicest. A little advise, just try to speak french first, be nice. Paris is like all big cites, people are in a busy state of mind, your on vacation. At Hotel du Cadran the staff was so helpful with questions on where something was on maps, to extra pillows. Cool cave style coffee house for breakfast or just a quick cup on the underground level. Great view of the Eiffel Tower from room 504. It's a corner room with views of Paris coming alive. Rue Clare has a great "little village" feel to it with shops, ATMs, cafes and groceries stores for that oh shoot moments. The Post Office down the street has the best exchange rate, but only small bills, $50 or less. The food around this area is awesome. We walked to the Eiffel Tower, had a picnic on the ground... "chick" thing, had to do it. But even I could walk in the shops get roasted chicken at one shop, cheese at another, bread & wine and so on. And this Hotel sits right in the middle of all this. We used Taxis, but the Metro is right there too, and with a lot of help from the staff at Hotel du Cadran you can get any where in Paris with ease. A lot of Americans stayed here while we stayed our 10 day stay. We stayed 3 nights. Then toured the country side in a private barrage boat on the Yun river in the Burgundy area. Hotel du Cadran held our baggage for the 3 day trip and we lucked out and got the same room 504. Enjoy C&C

Reviews.Title: “A very modern, comfortable and clean hotel, in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jarvis8178
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 week in this hotel, with an special offer which included a free museum-pass for 2 days, and breakfast buffet. The pass was very useful, since it "makes" you visit some places you wouldn't visit without it. And the breakfast was very good and plenty of energy for the full day (the croissants... simply delightful). The staff was very kind and helpful. About the rooms... they were very modern and the bed was large and extremely comfortable. When we came back at the end of the day, it was superbly clean, as well as the bathroom, always full of shampoo & gel. Just to say, hotel rooms in Paris are always (as far as I know) very small. These are small too, but not so much, and enough if you're planning to visit Paris and use the room for sleeping and having a little break. The bathroom is ok, the only problem I found (and I am 1,90m high) is that the space between the WC and the bathtub is a little small. Also, it is very well located, 5min walking from the closest metro station, 15min walking from the Tour Eiffel. The street has shops and restaurants (some of them a bit expensive), but the noise is not heard from the rooms (and we were in the 1st floor!). Overall, an excellent hotel and a very pleasant stay. Absolutely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Once again, a perfect place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ExpatFamily0fFive
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrific. Junior suite fits our family of 5 perfectly. This time we also went with grandparents who had a great room. So close to Rue Cler, Metro, Eiffel Tower, Invaldes. Staff is great. Room is so clean! Also-- access to computers in the hotel lobby and in the Junior suite. This was our 2nd visit to Hotel du Cadran and it was just as great as I remembered.

Reviews.Title: “Our holiday in Paris this September was...”
Reviews.Author: Holly_Mark
Reviews.Content: Our holiday in Paris this September was amazing. Our stay at the Hotel du Cadran was one main reason our stay was great. The hotel staff was extremely helpful, especially Emilie & Louise. Our room was cozy but very comfortable & more importantly very clean. And the location was perfect. Rue Cler is a quaint market area with the Eiffel Tower in short walking distance. We will be calling it our home away from home every time we visit Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: amyh808
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and did not want to leave. The hotel is very modern, and the rooms are very comfortable. We were given 2 rooms facing the street, and the noise was never an issue for us. The staff were all very friendly and helpful especially Emilie who answered every single one of our email inquiries and really went out of her way to help us. Thanks again Emilie for the excellent restaurant recommendation (Le Petit Nicois) and the macarons! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Super service”
Reviews.Author: Shootingstar_8
Reviews.Content: Staying at le Cadran for the second time and enjoyed it as much. It is a nice little establishment in 7Ã¨me, service with a smile from all staff incl night shift. Always very happy to help even over the phone when booking the hotel. The rooms are small, but so are most rooms in Paris but very clean and modern. The beds are comfortable. Breakfast is served in the basement and it is an ordinary french breakfast buffet, nothing to write home about but was included in the price so ok for us. All in all- a delight to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: davep96
Reviews.Content: Modern facility...no very modern. Close to Metro, and within a decent walk from the Effiel Tower. Very close to numerous restaurants. Nice buffet breakfast. Only significant negative is that with all of the restaurants around, it seemed that noisey trash pick-ups occurred quite often, and during the relatively early morning hours....say around 7-8:00 AM or so. Overall- We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: windgod
Reviews.Content: Very new (less than a year since remodel) and clean. Rooms are small but typical for Paris. Reminded us of a W hotel here in the states. The staff was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: sao
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris and wanted to be within walking distance to many famous sights and this hotel fits the bill. Rue Cler is at the end of the street so you have access to lots of great cafes, bakeries and various shops. Eiffel tower is only 7 minutes from the hotel. The Seine is 10 minutes away and you can buy a canal boat day pass that takes you to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Arch de Triomphe and the Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es. The hotel itself is very modern. European room tend to be small by US standards and these were small but they were very clean and functional. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We booked a trip through the hotel to Versailles and it was wonderful. They also arranged airport transfers for us and the shuttle was on-time. This hotel was an outstanding value and the location was priceless. I can't wait to go back . Merci Staff ;)

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Service in Paris”
Reviews.Author: seattlemel
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a perfect location with lots of transportation options nearby, as well as many cafes and food options just around the corner on Rue Cler. Most impressively, I fell during a sightseeing excursion and the hotel (namely Louise) was so wonderful about ordering a doctor to the hotel and even going so far as to run to the Pharmacy for me to gather the required medications as I was traveling alone. While service in France is different than in the US, this hotel and its staff went above and beyond to make sure I had what I needed. My lower rating about this room only pertains to the size - VERY small - in fact I'm not sure how two people could function in this room with luggage. That said, the room and bathroom were spotless and the bed comfortable. I would definitely stay here again if I were to come back to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel to stay for sightseeing in paris”
Reviews.Author: ChristineAustr
Reviews.Content: charming design hotel; very helpful staff; located in a very charming part of paris with lots of bistros, little shops; very close to the tour eiffel - great hotel to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: PeakeBrussels
Reviews.Content: Lovely small boutique hotel in small quiet street, friendly and helpful staff, great location close to the Champs ElysÃ©es, the Eiffel Tower (where you can catch the hop-on- hop-off bus, they sell tickets at the hotel), Place de la Concorde etc. etc . Restaurants on your door step but not noisy. Would definitely go back to this hotel. Anni Peake, Brussels

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: KATEBEC
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights last week & didn't want to leave!! hotel is so clean and modern, our room was plenty big enough for our needs, the shower facilities were excellant with clean towels each day, mini bar in room which we stocked with lager & wine from excellent supermarket just a short walk away by the metro entrance, breakfast was a very good selection of juices/teas/coffess/breads/fruit/yogurts/cheese/meats and bolied eggs. Location of hotel excellent just off Rue Cler with numerous cafes,restaurants and a wonderful boulangerie. We particularly enjoyed a restaurant called Tribeca(check it out for good pizzas pastas etc). Eiffl Tower is 20 minutes walk in 1 direction & Invalides area 20 minutes walk in other direction. If you're looking for a great hotel in a wonderful location don't hesitate to book. The one tiny thing lacking is a kettle in room but we knew this before we went so took a travel kettle etc with us. P.S U2 at the Stade de France were amazing also!!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great service and located proximate to much of what Paris has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: ibisstar
Reviews.Content: Located in a quite neighborhood, this hotel offered everything that we could have hoped for. While not a full-service hotel by any means, this hotel offers an excellent bargain for those interested in seeing Paris -- not their hotel room. The rooms, and the hallway configuration (like most in Paris), were small but who cares if you are here to experience what this lovely city has to offer? The staff was great and the chocholate lady who sold the most awesome treats was an added plus! The rooms were well appointed and tastefully done. Boutique style with a friendly hotel staff. My wife and I will most certainly stay here the next time we visit. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful Hotel, Modern interior, 10 min walk to the Eiffel tower!! Highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: a-maniac
Reviews.Content: Nicely designed rooms, very close to the metro and in footwalk distance to the Eiffel Tower. Nice cafes in the neighbourhood. Would always choose again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, contemporary & sunlit room, with extremely courteous management in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: ncdtrips
Reviews.Content: We needed to be in the 7th district and this was a perfect choice. The hotel is clean and contemporary. The room is a tight fit, with limited storage space, (so maybe not good for anyone wanting or needing to stay in the room for their stay). This was a minor (to no) concern for us, and would not keep me from booking again. The location is excellent, allowing my daughter and I to come back during the course of the day to regroup, refresh, or rest for evening plans. The management was extremely courteous, very helpful, and very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: rockford3210
Reviews.Content: The location (easy walk to the Eiffel Tower) and especially the fantastic, personal service by everyone at the front desk made this an enjoyable place to stay. While the (standard) room was quite small, of course we were not there to spend time in the room, so this served our needs very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: mctang
Reviews.Content: Just got back from vacation in Europe, and stayed at this hotel for five nights. The location was perfect, steps from the Eiffel Tower, Invalides, and the Metro stop. Also, plenty of delicious restaurants to choose from (with some guidance from the hotel staff). The room was a little small by American standards, but probably on the roomy side for Paris. Very modern and clean. Standing shower was great except for what seems to be the common European problem of spraying all over the floor outside the shower. This hotel was great, and the staff at reception was outstanding. In particular, the woman who worked the afternoon shift was absolutely great. With a bit of Parisian cynicism, dry humor, and lots of knowledge, she made our stay at Hotel Cadran a real standout.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with excellent service from staff”
Reviews.Author: KahJon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at their sister property, Hotel Valadon in a three person room for 5 nights. It is across the street from Hotel du Cadran. The hotel staffs are exceptionally friendly and helpful. The hotel is about 5 - 10 minutes walk from Eiffel Tower. We can see the tip of the Eiffel Tower from our room. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from Ecole Millitaire Metro station, 10 minute walks from RER C line that goes to Versaille Palace and steps away from Rue Cler which is probably made popular by Rick Steve's Paris Travel guide. The room is the typical hotel room in Europe. Don't expect the room to be as big as those in US. I want to praise the staff for taking good care of the hotel tenants. On the day we left, I mentioned to the staff at check out counter that I plan to take RER B to airport. Thanks to their up-to-date information, I was told that there will be about 2 hour delay on RER B due to maintenance. She adviced us to take bus and gave us detail instruction on how to do that. Otherwise we would have missed our flight. We met a guy on the same flight and told us about the hassle he had to go through because of the RER B maintenance work. Thanks. You guys are awesome. I will definitely return to this hotel when I come to Paris again and will recommend to anyone who plan to visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in typical Paris street”
Reviews.Author: WestIndies396
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th visit to Paris and 4th time in this hotel which has now been updated twice. The staff are friendly and bi-lingual, the hotel is clean, quiet and is in a brilliant location being less than 5 minutes to the Metro station and a short walk to the Eiffel Tower. There are some excellent cafes/bistros nearby as well as a fantastic patisserie. There are several very good restaurants within a short walk. All in all we have never had a bad experience at this hotel, the only shortfall is the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room. I would readily recommend this hotel to friends and family; in fact friends of ours have been on our recommendation. I fully intend to return with my children in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for one night, nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: mizzamo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, nice hotel, friendly staff, good location. Would definitely stay again. Nearest tube is etoile militaire on line 4. 10 mins walk from Eiffel tower and lots of other tourist spots within easy reach. Lots of cafes and shop close by

Reviews.Title: “Just like the pictures”
Reviews.Author: LynnandZach
Reviews.Content: The hotel and it's location were amazing. My only complaint was that the air conditioner started leaking during my first nigh and they were unable to fix it before my departure. It was working though which is what I cared about most; it was 35C during our stay. So the dripping bothered me the first night but the second night we put down towels and I slept better. Everything else was great and my room looked exactly like the picture and for a european room it was very modern, functional and although small did not feel cramped. They offer free internet which was great to organize visits and the Open Bus tour worked great as a means to travel as well as sight see around the city's different quarters. Did I say the location was amazing? Have recommended this hotel to friends who travel to Europe.

Reviews.Title: “more amazing than i remembered”
Reviews.Author: jofabs
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Paris and both stays were at the Hotel du Cadran (recommended by a neighbor and frequent visitor to Paris). The hotel is in a wonderful neighborhood with plenty of shopping and dining. The hotel is also within walking distance ( or a leisurely stroll with cafe stops inbetween) of all to see and do in Paris. All of the staff that we dealt with over our nine night stay were very accomodating and really patient as we attempted to communicate in and improve our french. Anne-Sophie deserves special recognition, she helped with directions, recommendations and a lot of friendly advice. We are already anticipating our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless gem in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: stowy
Reviews.Content: Was not disappointed by this hotel. Small rooms but very carefully equipped down to the lighting control. Like previous review just would have liked a kettle! Location was brilliant, Rue Cler was perfect for us foodies, and whole area very clean and chilled. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Small, cozy hotel perfectly located in the middle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: noodlehaus
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel is excellent. Even though they only offer breakfast, around the hotel and Rue Cler that's next to the hotel gives you lots of options for lunch and dinner. It's location also gives you plenty of chances to enjoy the local culture of Paris, and all important attractions are just a few minutes a way even by walking. Great friendly service, in a perfect location :)
