Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Visitor24071999
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable hotel. When our luggage didn't arrive, the staff were very helpful. Short walk to Eiffel Tower where you can pick up an open top bus tour or a trip on the Seine, There is a supermarket opposite and cafe's a few steps down the road. Only one small downside is there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The little hotel with a big heart.”
Reviews.Author: aduckinparis
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. It was something of a last minute trip and we choose Hotel du Cadran based on a personal recommendation. It was a very fortunate recommendation. The staff is simply excellent. We were in email contact with them prior to our trip and they provided timely and helpful advice regarding our trip and things to do. We were there for 5 days and received consistently wonderful help and service from everyone at the hotel. The desk staff all spoke English. My wife was very impressed with the cleanliness, organization, and presentation of the room. The hotel is located in the Rue Cler area and in a very "untouristy" Paris neighborhood. It is close to the Eifel Tower and the Rodin Museum and Les Invalides and other sites (we were a short walk to the docks for the river cruises). We walked to the Louvre in 35 minutes. There are dozens of shops, cafes, and restaurants within a few minutes walk of the hotel. Also, be sure to check out the chocolate shop in the hotel lobby, really great stuff! We obviously had a great time in Paris and the staff at Hotel du Cadran helped make it possible.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Cadran is very clean and modern yet completely cozy.”
Reviews.Author: Carol56003
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasently suprised by this unique hotel. Each inch of space in the small cozy room is used to maximize comfort. The location is perfect, away from the tourists yet so close to Paris life. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. I will stay again when I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and all that you need”
Reviews.Author: cpilas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great in every way that my husband and I needed. The location is a 5 minute walk to the Eiffel tower and a 2 minute walk to the metro. It was clean, very modern and had a very pleasant and helpful staff. There wasn't anything that we needed that this hotel didn't have for us. They even have free computer/internet/printers in the lobby for us to use which was helpful for us to find some restaurants that were recommended to us. And the location became even better when we realized that there was a grocery store right in front of the hotel and a delicious bakery on the corner to the left of the hotel. Again we couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Paris, Rue Cler and the Hotel Cadran”
Reviews.Author: rmitchbio
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful six day vacation at Hotel Cadran in Paris. We used Rick Steves "Paris Guide" to book the hotel. The Rue Cler area with its cafes and small shops - a great location. We were minutes from the metro station (Ecole Militaire) and bus stops and walking distance to Eiffel Tower. In the evening we would picnic in front ot the Eiffel Tower with wine and food purchased on Rue Cler. The hotel was great with very clean, nicely decorated rooms. The beds were very comfortable and the area was quiet at night. The staff at the front desk were always patient, helpful and pleasant. I would recommend this hotel to friends and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay- perfect location in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: IluvtravNewJerseyJ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our week long stay at Hotel Cadran in Paris. It is just as Rick Steves had described. We were around the corner from Rue Cler and what a great location. Very close to the metro station (Ecole Militaire), walking distance to Eiffel Tower, Invalides and Rodin Museum; great restaurants and quiet at night. The hotel was perfect; small rooms by American standards but standard for Parisien. The rooms were very clean, with modern decor, A/C and flat screen TVs. The beds were very comfortable. We had two connecting rooms ( a queen for us and two twins for our children n the connecting room) so we had enough space. The concierge was very helpful and pleasant too. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A mix of positives and negatives - would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: bartok1
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Cadran was definitely a mix of positive and negatives for me, so much so that I probably would not go there again. Let me start off with the positives. The location is great, near to the Eiffel Tower, the metro, and numerous cafes, bakeries, and markets. There is free internet access. The signal wasnâ€™t strong in my first room, but the Hotel agreed to move me to another room on my second day (but only after being a little defensive about whether or not there might some difficulties with reception in that room). The rooms were air-conditioned. The room and bed were nice and comfortable. The front desk was very nice about helping with directions. If youâ€™re lucky, youâ€™ll be there on a day when they give out samples of the wonderful macaroons that they sell. However, there were also several negatives. First, on two days, I didnâ€™t receive a requested wake-up call due to a phone malfunction. The hotel sent housekeeping to knock on my door, but on both days, they came up 30-45 minutes AFTER the wake-up time I requested. This could have caused significant problems, as I had reservations both days, including a flight at the airport to catch. Second, the hotel advertises that they work with a reliable transportation service that will bring you to the airport for a set fee (55 euro) (the signs say that they prefer this service because cabs in Paris can be unreliable in terms of availability). I requested this transportation service and confirmed the price the night before I was to leave. However, instead of calling their usual transportation service, the Hotel called inexplicably called a regular Paris taxi, which ended up costing me 11 euro more than the advertised flat fee I was counting on. Third, when checking in, I was told where and when the continental breakfast was served, and invited to join the other guests. I donâ€™t have a recollection of any mention of a charge for breakfast at check-in, or at any other time before I was ready to check out, but at check-out, the Hotel added a 52 euro charge for 4 days of breakfast to my bill. I would have appreciated knowing about the charge for breakfast ahead of time. If I had known, I would have gone to the excellent bakeries or cafes within surrounding two blocks, rather than spending that amount of money on a continental breakfast that wasnâ€™t that great (coffee/tea, juice, canned fruit, yogurt, cereals, sliced meat, packaged cheese, hard boiled eggs on 1 of 4 days, French bread, stale pastries and croissants). Fourth, there is no real desk or table in the room for working on a laptop. There is a counter space or shelf in one corner of the room that can be used for this purpose. Fifth, the Hotel has two computers for guest use on the ground floor. However, on one day when I needed to print out a ticket I had purchased, there was a program/interface on both computers that prevented printing. The two staff folks at reception said they were not familiar with how to use the guest computers and could not help me, which kind of defeated the purpose of having a public computer for printing. All in all, despite the great location, I had a mixed experience, and would not recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A* - perfect for a long romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: me1987
Reviews.Content: received excellent service from all the staff. luggage service for both before check in and after check out. room was immaculate. breakfash good. helpfull map and tourist info. well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Cadran is a lovely hotel that was an integral part of our happy trip.”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnnClare
Reviews.Content: Here are the reasons we really liked the Hotel du Cadran. The desk employees such as Anne-Sophie were helpful and responsive to all questions, and helped with a restaurant reservation, too, and our final cab reservation taking us to the EuroStar. The hotel provided Internet access and the International Herald Tribune. It was close to breakfast places on Rue Cler. The hotel was also close to a wonderful deli, a grocery store, restaurants, a laundry, and fruiterers. Significantly, it was close to the Eiffel and to the metro and the bus, so that it was easy to get to places that were beyond walking distance. The hotel room was on one level, unlike hotel rooms in Italy where the bathroom may involve a perilous step up or step down--that arrangement can be treacherous at night. Moreover, the bathroom was well-designed and stylish. The room was equipped with a small refrigerator that was perfect for left-over Bleu D'Auvergne from the cheese store or for turkey from Davoli, the deli around the corner. The room was quiet at night and had room darkening shades that were conducive to good sleep. Our best regards to Anne-Sophie and to the Hotel du Cadran!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday made easy”
Reviews.Author: Nickcorless
Reviews.Content: Map issued by the hotel in reference to the hotels positions compared to all the main attractions, the hotel will book any events you wish to attend. The rooms are standard size for Paris but very modern and very clean, with very comfortable beds and no sounds heard from outside to disturb your sleep. The breakfast is a standard continental but is exactly what you need before a day of site seeing. The hotel staff are very helpful and english speaking and there are lots of nice restaurants in close proximity to the hotel. Addtionally a metro station is just around the corner for those who choose not to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Honnymoon”
Reviews.Author: Akadanish
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, friendly staff and very helpful! Good location, near metro, near busses, near great coffee shops, near Eiffel tower! Lovely neighborhood, very local, shops and the staff is very well informed!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Camille45
Reviews.Content: Cadran is not large, but the location (on a pedestrian street with a multitude of cafes and shops) is charming. There are many "rated" restaurants with walking distance. It is very close to the Metro and makes access to the rest of the city easy. The rooms are small (as are most rooms in Paris) but are clean and well-appointed. This was our second stay here and we launched a trip by staying here for 6 days, then returned for 2 days at the end. All the staff spoke English and were very accommodating to help us when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a Paris first timer”
Reviews.Author: VS87
Reviews.Content: 2 blocks from Eiffel Tower and a short walk to other attractions. One block from the subway system. Close enough to the action but on a side street so the atmosphere around the hotel is quiet and cozy. Rooms were typical for European hotel (small) but were clean, comfortable and designed in a contemporary style but not overly done to take away from the Parisian charm. We had 17 and 21 year-old daughters that slept in an adjoining room so we had extra room to spread out. Breakfast was basic bread, cereal, fruit and yogurt but all we cared about was the caffeine from the self serve cappucino machine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, comfortable and great staff”
Reviews.Author: ConnieK010
Reviews.Content: We came to the Cadran after spending two nights , at a very big downtown hotel, where it was so crowded and noisy. We had just finished a cruise /tour and we wanted to extend our stay in Paris a few more days. We came to the Cadran, and what a pleasant surprise. The rooms are very small, but after a day or so we got very used to it, and we loved the area, and the staff. The size was adequate for my husband and I, there is not a whole lot of room to put things, but we didn't care. We heard that most hotel rooms in Paris are very small, but the bed was very comfortable, and the room had nice lighting. The hotel is right around the corner from the charming Rue Cler street, where we found cafes, boulangeries, fresh fruits, little shops, and also a laundry right down the street. We had a wonderful time, and we would go back again, and tell our friends about the Hotel du Cadran.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Cadran magnifique! Wonderful, friendly, clean, comfortable - better than home!”
Reviews.Author: Debra68
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, comfortable room with modern decor, great location, and the tastiest French macarons in Paris, right in the hotel lobby! We felt right at home during our long (but not long enough) stay at Hotel du Cadran this past June. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The rooms, small by North American standards, are smartly designed, clean and very comfortable (we did not even miss our bed at home!). The location was perfect - a great neighbourhood right outside the door, which included the wonderful pedestrian street of rue Cler, a Velib bike station, a Metro within 2 blocks, and the Eiffel Tower only a 10 minute walk away. And, Morgane, the lovely girl who runs the chocolate bar/patisserie, put the icing on the cake of a fantastic Paris experience!

Reviews.Title: “great stay at cadran hotel”
Reviews.Author: puteshestvennik77
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay in a great hotel in the center of Paris. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and extremely welcoming. I had a birthday during my stay in Cadran and due to that fact our room was upgraded to superior. And I was also presented with the nice present from the chocolate bar and a bottle of champagne for my celebration. This was very nice. But even if it was just a stay without all the extras - I am sure i would love this hotel. it is very neat and clean, very comfortable and conviniently situated. It is a good value for money. The room size is ok for the european big city hotel - just enough space for 2 people. Everything was great for me, though I am a very picky person in terms of cleanliness and comfort. i would definitely return to this hotel and i will recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great value, cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate1412
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on trip advisor & it matched the reviews & we were very pleased with the hotel. Many restruarants & gorcery around the hotel. Easy to get to metro. Excellent bakery shops nearby. The hotel tooms are very small but it worked fine. We had a connecting room with our kids which is hard to find. Tiny shower, bathroom too. (Water runs into bathroom) Not much space to put clothing but wasn't really a problem. We emptied servibar & put water & cheese in it. Stephanie & macaroon shop in lobby were great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TimmyTot
Reviews.Content: My wife, my teenage daughter (in a separate room) and I stayed here for three nights. Note that the construction work and re-decorating mentioned in previous reviews has finished. We booked the holiday out of a brochure (Cresta Cities) and travelled on Eurostar. The taxi cost approx â‚¬18 from Gare du Nord station and the journey took approx 30 minutes at 5:30pm on a Friday evening, but may take less at a quieter time. The hotel is in good quiet location, but near to plenty of restaurants and shops. Five minutes walk to the Ecole Militaire Metro station and only 15 minutes walk to the bottom of the Eiffel tower (although you can clearly see the tower within five minutes walk from the hotel). The Ecole Militaire Metro station is not on a main line, it was usually necessary to change lines at least once to get anywhere in Paris. We tended to change at Concorde Metro station, but note there was a five minute walk within the Metro station from one line to another. Staff in the hotel were friendly and extremely helpful, we had forgotten our travel plug adaptor and they lent us one while we were there. Breakfast was included in our package and was a buffet consisting of cereals, pastries, cheeses, cold meats, hot drinks and fruit juices. You could have as much as you wanted and it was good quality. The hotel has a luggage room where they will keep your bags either on arrival or before departure. We had some of the chocolate and macaroons from the chocolate bar in the hotel (note closed on Mondays). There are lots of different flavours of both chocolate and macaroons to choose from. We ate at a few different places in the locality. The best we found was Le Bosquet restaurant. We had both lunch and dinner here, lunch was â‚¬14 (per person) for a Chicken Caesar salad and a drink, dinner was approx â‚¬40 (per person) for a cocktail aperitif, starter, main and dessert. The next best was Tribecca which was good value for money â‚¬12 for main meal and drink (we recommend the Lasagne). At CafÃ© Central the meals were OK and so was the service, but it was more expensive than Tribecca and about the same price as Le Bosquet, but for smaller portions, cost approx â‚¬22 for main meal plus drink. In the evenings we walked to the Champs de Mars (big park that leads to the Eiffel Tower) it was full of people having picnics and was very pleasant. Beds were comfortable, there was a free safe in the small wardrobe and a mini bar, but we never used it because there was a convenience store just across the road open from 7:00am until 9:00pm (closed on Sundays). Le Bosquet restaurant was shut on Sunday, but the Tribecca and CafÃ© Central remained open. One afternoon we had a drink in the little Bistro right outside the hotel entrance and the staff there were pleasant and the drinks were good value. The hotel was very good, the only thing I didnâ€™t like was the ensuite bathroom door was a sliding one and poorly fitting. The hotel staff explained that the hotel had recently been refurbished and the ensuite bathrooms were built this way to save space in the rooms. The hotel lift broke down while we were in it, but it soon returned to the Reception floor (within two minutes) when we sounded the alarm and it was fixed the same day.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want in a hotel plus plenty of smiles and helpful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kazii
Reviews.Content: Great greeting on arrival. Nothing was ever too much trouble, including extra linen when requested. Great help with sightseeing. Very clean and inviting. Desk had someone there all night. Very happy with everything about the hotel. Felt safe and secure at all times over our 10 day stay. Within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. Restaurants, Pastry shops, Ice Cream shops, Fruit shops, Supermarkets and Cheese shops all at the front door. Metro Station just a 2 minute walk away... Awesome :o)

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cbstls
Reviews.Content: Found hotel from Rick Steeves guidebook. Modern, clean, friendly - PERFECT location

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: gls0506
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Cadran was recommended by a good friend as a great place to stay with our two teenagers,and we certainly weren't disappointed. Guests were a combination of business travellers, couples and families. The staff was friendly and helpful when needed. Our rooms were small (as expected) and thus with limited storage space, but meticulous and were perfect for our 5 day stay. The included breakfast was a wonderful way to start any day. The Rue Cler area was very safe, clean and full of restaurants, shops, etc. all within easy walking distance. Also only a 10 minute walk to the Tower and 5 minutes to the Metro. We will definitely stay here again whenever we return to visit Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful clean and modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Paris60811
Reviews.Content: We originally booked our time in Paris at the Hotel de la Tour Eiffel. The hotel was dirty and smelled of bug spray. After frantically searching Rue Cler for new accommodations we were referred to Hotel du Cadran. After explaining our dilemma the staff at Cadran worked quickly to find us an available room for all three nights of our stay. In addition to the beautifully modern decor and delicious macaroons, the staff was extremely friendly and attentive. We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mtallyca
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. My brother and I were in Paris for a short trip. We wanted to visit the Eiffel Tower and Disneyland Paris. The front desk staff gave us accurate directions to the Eiffel Tower and showed us how to get to Disneyland Paris via the Metro and RER train. The staff also recommended a good restaurant across the street from the Hotel. The Cholocate Bar was quite yummy! We would stay at the Hotel Cadran again

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nshvgschick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week and what a gem! The room was average size by European standards, very clean and the bathroom was awesome. I judge all hotels by shower water pressure and this one was great. The hotel is within easy walking distance of a Metro stop and Rue Cler street market where the choices of restaurants and shops is amazing. Be sure to visit the Ulysses Crepe restaurant for the best crepes in Paris - the banana and choclate crepe was decadent! The Eiffel Tower is a 10 minute walk away through a quiet neighborhood. Although it is close to many attractions, it is not in the least bit a "tourist" location. You feel like you live in this amazing city and it gives you a great idea of what it must be like to live there as a native. The staff was very friendly and helpful with directions, suggestions, etc. We will definitely stay here if we have the opportunity to visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel near Rue Cler!”
Reviews.Author: avardeman
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Du Cadran with a recommendation from the Rick Steeves Paris guidebook. We were pleasantly surprised by the modern style of the rooms. Though the rooms are quite small, we did not feel cramped at all. The rooms and bathroom were very clean. The hotel is located in a great area near many restaurants and shops and only a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: garfab
Reviews.Content: Our five days in Paris were the last days of a 23 day vacation which included London and a Baltic cruise. We were a bit nervous about our inability to speak French, but the staff was very helpful and patient with us. Because of the length of our trip we had a bit of luggage. The room was small and only had a closet, so we lived out of the suitcases. The bathroom was sufficient and everything was in working order. The bed was comfortable and the room was air-conditioned, which was welcomed as Paris was warming up. Breakfast and a 2 day museum pass was included as part of an internet special. We spent the days walking to the Louvre, Eiffel tower (5 minutes), Arc de Triomphe, Notre-Dame Cathedral and others. Just around the corner is a street with many cafÃ©â€™s so dinner was no problem. You can only absorb so much culture, so we decided to go to Disneyland, Paris. The staff made the arrangements for us. They also arranged our transportation to Charles de Gaulle airport. All in all this hotel was a good choice, and if we make it to Paris again we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Design and lots of Americans”
Reviews.Author: baileyfirestone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Cadran for 4 nights in mid-May. We were a little disturbed to see the scaffolding around the building when we arrived, but were assured that it was only painting and we wouldn't be disturbed by construction noise. Since the sunlight still came through the windows of our room on the 4th floor, we gave it a try. Unfortunately, we were awakened at 8:30am by a painter outside our window. He didn't look into our room, but it was disconcerting enough for us to leave quickly. When we returned after a long day of sightseeing, he was still there. We went down to the reception area and asked to change our room. After being told that we could change if we'd do it quickly before the new guests arrived, we hustled back upstairs and swapped to room 407 on the side without scaffolding. Much better. Lots of light and no painters. Scaffolding aside, we liked the hotel. Specifically: * The neighborhood: You can't beat Rue Cler for restaurants, food shopping and local color. It was constantly buzzing from early morning to late night. And it was not easy to get into restaurants at night because they were so busy for dinner. * Well-designed rooms: The rooms are decorated in shades of gray and red, modern and great utilization of space. A red phone booth to hold your clothes, there's a pocket door to the bathroom and ledges around the walls for stuff. * Cool lighting: There were a number of settings for lights with even a night light setting. * Helpful reception area: They were knowledgeable and helpful - even offering to call a shop to track down a lost jacket. * Computers: There were 2 desktops in the lobby for guests to use. These are the things that we were not so fond of: * Storage: Loved the phone booth and ledges, but there was no other furniture to store anything including our suitcases. We made it work, but by the end of our stay, we were out of room to store any more purchases. * Americans: Most of the hotel guests were Americans; many of whom were clutching Rick Steve's Paris guidebooks. This is one of Rick's recommended hotels and we like a less "American" experience in Paris. * RER Access: You could get to an RER near the Seine (a short walk), but if you have luggage, be prepared to lug them down the stairs. We had heavy bags by the end of our 10 day journey and reluctantly arranged for a car to take us to the airport. * Airport Transfer Recommendation: When we couldn't take the RER, we asked the front desk for a recommendation on airport transport. We thought we were getting a cab or shuttle, but they arranged for a private car to pick us up - which was quite costly. While we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel du Cadran and would recommend it to friends, we will probably stay somewhere closer to the RER next time.

Reviews.Title: “Choose This!”
Reviews.Author: LindaR2010
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous experience Paris. The Dial Hotel Ideally Located In The Rue Cler Neighborhood IS. Despite it's proximity to the Eiffel Tower It Was not a bit touristy. You really feel Immersed in the local scene and It Is An Ideal location to bus 69 and the metro. We stayed for a week and plan to stay here again When we return to Paris. The breakfast was spectacular. You Will not Be Disappointed with this property.

Reviews.Title: “Cat”
Reviews.Author: ngfiniti
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean, immaculate and modern. The bed was very comfortable. The only drawback was the hand held shower head did not stay in place causing water to splash everywhere. A bonus is the free internet access was wireless and reasonably fast.

Reviews.Title: “location,comfort,efficiency”
Reviews.Author: cny23
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from Paris and will tell you we were very pleased with the hotel. The staff were pleasant and efficient and check in was seamless. We stayed for a week and cannot emphasize enough about the perfect location of this hotel. I highly recommend the small bistro outside the front door and make friends with Pierette, the owner. She is a gem. The weather was quite warm and the air conditioned rooms were just what the doctor ordered. Lastly, the location cannot be overlooked. A lot to do within a short walking distance. I highly recommend this boutique hotel. Oh, by the way, the rooms are small but very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but don't let the chocolate bar sway you...”
Reviews.Author: kemcho_sk
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris - Hotel Du Cadran matched our criteria in Tripadvisor but it was the pictures of the Chocolate bar which swayed us (more below)!! Location was great - it's in the middle of a quaint parisian market (pleasant) and literally a 3 min walk from Ecole Militaire metro (once you know your way around) with a supermaket round the corner. Attraction wise, a five min walk from the military museum/ Napoleon's tomb and seven min walk from the Eiffel tower - make sure you are there at 11pm to see it "sparkle". Not sure why some reveiwers think the Eiffel was 15 mins away. The hotel itself: staff were pleasant, fluent in english and we were given a complimentary map on arrival which we found very handy. The standard room was of a good size, clean and bed was very comfortable and spacious. Only point of caution is the loo. Nothing wrong with it - finished to a high standard - but lack of complete privacy as no lock on the door and there is a partially see through window into the loo within the room. Not an issue for us but could be awkward for others. There was scaffolding at the front of the building and painting work going on which obscured our view of the street market. As luck would have it - we went into the room to be confronted by a painter right outside our window. We didnt make a fuss but were disappointed the hotel did not mention the works at the time of booking or at the very least, offer to discount the room instead of charging full price of about Â£150/ per night. We did mention the works when checking out and the receptionist very kindly offered the one breakfast and water from the mini bar as complementary. And finally the chocolate bar - we were dissapointed as opening hours were during the day (when we were out sightseeing) yet closed by the time we returned each evening - surely it should be open in the evenings when guests return? The pictures on the website probably make the bar look bigger than it really is and the chocolates were expensive!! Apologies for the long review but just giving our honest experience. I would recommend as had no issues and great location but just bear in mind, for Â£150 a night you are getting just a room and nothing else... but then again, appears that this is the norm if looking for a decent hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayDonkey
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at Cadran Hotel. On arrival the receptionist was very welcoming and efficient, including offering a complimentary bottle of champagne as it was out first time in Paris. The standard of decor in the room, and throughout the hotel was modern but very comfortable, with a quirky clock theme. Our room was very well appointed with everything you would need for a weekend away. Whilst others have commented on the size of the room and showers, we did not find them to be too small at all, and were exactly what you would expect from a city centre hotel in Paris. Breakfast was continental in style, with an excellent range of cereals, breads, croissants, cold meats, yoghurts, juices, teas and coffees, all of which was of a good standard and constantly being refreshed. The dining room is situated in the vaulted basement, and is nice, bright and airy. We also liked the fact that the hotel served breakfast until 11am on weekends. We found the location of the hotel to be perfect for our needs, being less than five minutes from the Seine, Eiffel Tower and Metro station (Ecole Militare). Near by were a number of good restaurants and a good choice of shops on Rue Cler. We would not hesitate in returning to Hotel Cadran, and hope to do so later this year! [At the time of our visit the hotel was having some minor building work to the facade, but we did not find that this disturbed us at all, even though there was scaffolding outside our window].

Reviews.Title: “Well placed and well managed”
Reviews.Author: BillDC20007
Reviews.Content: This is a well managed hotel with friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were clean and well laid out. It was in a great location letting us enjoy a lot of Paris. Being right next to Rue Cler was also a great extra, since that street is a perfect Paris street.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go during next 2 Weeks!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gonzalejMiami
Reviews.Content: Arrived this week and they are doing construction on the facade of the building. If you like waking up at 8am with jackhammers and pounding on the window outside of your room then stay there. Very unprofessional of the hotel not to tell us prior to arriving that they were under construction. We could have changed hotels before hand, but not in their interest. As has been mentioned before rooms are small which is not a problem but the bed was too small. I am 5 ft 9inches and my ankles would hang from over the bed at night as i slid while sleeping. the showers are the smallest i have been in. you hit your elbows as you turned around in them. The hotel is in a great spot but would look at other options.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are very neat, clean modern and...”
Reviews.Author: BenElting
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very neat, clean modern and stylish. The staff is very friendly and helpful, even though we were unable to speak any French. The amenities offered were great, including wifi throughout the hotel, Internet access from computers in the business center, an outstanding breakfast, and a chocolate bar. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is in a good location, very close to the metro, and a few minutes walk to the Eiffel tower. All in all, this is my kind of hotel, and we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: acciodogs
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Cadran became our home away from home due to the volcanic eruption in Iceland, which extended the duration of our original stay. All of the staff were wonderful and helped us with the ongoing travel problems. Rooms were modern and clean, with breakfast every morning downstairs (continental style). The free wifi access was a great help. Very well located in the Rue Cler with easy access to the Metro and within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. They also have a chocolate bar in the lobby with handcrafted chocolates!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel close to eiffel tower”
Reviews.Author: Natalie25
Reviews.Content: Booked as a city break last summer. I have only just got round to writing the review. A lovely hotel very close to the eiffel tower. Rooms were very clean and quiet, never heard any noise at night. Never had anything to complain about so never really talked to reception. However they were very friendly always saying hello whenever we went in or out. We always had breakfast early so there was always food/drink available. Overall a pleasant stay in a good location. I would recommend to anyone who wants a hotel close to the eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “never been treated so badly”
Reviews.Author: FamilyfromAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: What a terrible experience. The staff could not have been more rude or "out to lunch." We booked what was advertised online as a family suite of two rooms. When we showed up (my wife and I and 4 children under 10), we were coldly dismissed at the front desk, told we could only sleep 2 in each room. After a short, brutish fight, we had no choice but to book yet a third room. And then we found out why only two per room: the rooms were so small you could barely fit in one adult and one suitcase in each room. The showers were so small you actually had to be careful not to bang your head. And god forbid you trouble the staff for anything. Just plain uncaring, unfriendly and very inexperienced. Would not recommend to an enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, stylish and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Shiput99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cadran in March 2010 for 120 Euros/night, breakfast included. The small hotel is located near the Eiffel tower. To reach the next metro station, it takes you only 3 minutes walk. The staff is very helpfull and charming. For example, as we missed fresh fruits for breakfast, they just bought some for us. The room was very clean and stylish, although it was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Rooms + Great Location + Comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: neige8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find in the 7th arrondissement. It is just off of Rue Cler (walking street with small food shops and cafes) and blocks away from the Eiffle tower. We loved exploring the small, one-way streets in this neighborhood and always felt safe walking around at night. The Metro is just 4 blocks away, so it is easy to get around the city from the hotel. The contemporary rooms are small- but you will be thankful to have a big, comfortable bed to come back to after a day of roaming around Paris. The bathrooms have modern fixtures with a nice shower and bathtub. The people at the front desk are friendly - helped us make dinner reservations and arranged transportation to the airport. We did not have breakfast at the hotel because we preferred sitting at a cafÃ© on Rue Cler. Although it is close to the Eiffel tower, the area feels more like a neighborhood and not totally overrun by tourists (granted, we were there in October). The one huge advantage of staying so close to the tower is that you are afforded the luxury of a quick visit in the morning, at night, or during sunset- the view is always spectacular! We really liked this hotel and the next time we are in Paris we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Small Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kvofromca
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be a pleasure under any circumstance, but I had my stay lengthened by 5 days to a total of 10 because of the iceland volcano. While the rooms are small like most Paris hotels, I never felt cramped. Some bright accents in the room lightened the feel. The amenities in the room were completely modern. Though I was on the top floor, the water pressure never gave out. Also no problem with the supply of hot water. The bed was quite comfortable, an important item for me since I have trouble falling asleep. What really makes this hotel special is its staff. They oriented me to the neighborhood,, arrange tours which by the way were excellent, and took care of repairs rapidly, like the elevator becoming inoperable one day. However, they really shined when air travel was curtailed by what the french called a cloud of cinders. There was no problem with extending my stay and they began to give me a few extras without charge. While I and my fellow stranded guests were in a stew about how to get home, the hotel staff remained calm. Also I noted a sincere empathy for our plight. The neighborhood had multiple cafes and bistrots steps away. The Eiffel Tower was a quick walk as well. A bus that went to the Champs Elysee was at the end of the block and the subway was 10 minutes away with my slow walking. Within a block were also a drug store and coin op laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean but small rooms, decent value.”
Reviews.Author: Geaux1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on location near the Rue Cler area, which we enjoyed on previous trips to Paris. And it truly is about 15 steps from Rue Cler. The hotel is smallish, and the rooms even smaller, but very normal by Paris standards. Good staff as well. They were in the midst of some outside renovation work so there was scaffolding on the outside walls, but thankfully the work didn't start until well after we were gone for the day, and they offered free breakfast in exchange. Great location which was all we wanted from Du Cadran anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Linkysmom
Reviews.Content: Great location near Rue Cler and Eiffel Tower. Rooms were small, but quiet and comfortable. Very clean. Nice to go back to a quiet neighborhood after sightseeing. Very close to metro. Breakfast not worth it, go to local cafe for a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near metro and dining.”
Reviews.Author: cmania
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I stayed at this hotel and I really like the location of this property. There is a pedestrian street to the left of the hotel and there are cafes, restaurants and shops. It feels as though you are in a neighborhood. The hotel is close to a metro (Ecole Militaire) and it is convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “very nice Cadran”
Reviews.Author: johnny1922
Reviews.Content: Agree with most reviewere, this is a very nice internally modern, hotel. But avoid the rip off Bar Central nearby. This faux-traditional Bar on Rue Sainte Dominique in the 7th charged me 18 Euros for a very small cognac and when asked to explain how they could consider this reasonable, advised me that I was lucky I was sitting at the bar - if I'd been at a table, it would have been 24 Euros. No wonder it was very quiet. If you're in the area go to Cafe Roussilon round the corner on Rue Cler or Recruitment Cafe 200 yds east on Rue St Dominique, both of which are very nice and charged a reasonable 7 Euros or so for almost double the measure.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location - Not too touristy”
Reviews.Author: bondigirl-sydney
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel is exactly what we expected based on the hotel website and previous Trip Advisor reviews. Suited our needs perfectly for our 2 night stay. Definitely recommend the location, 15 min walk from many sites including the Eifel tower and great places to eat located around the corner. No need to pay extra for breakfast at the hotel if it isnâ€™t included in your price, an abundance of great cafes and patisseries to chose from right outside. Also handy is the close metro station, Ecole Militaire (line 8). We came to Paris on the Eurostar and took the metro from the station to the hotel (journey took less than 30 minutes). I wasnâ€™t wowed by my experience and would try another hotel on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Top design, modern and cosy”
Reviews.Author: baribalbear
Reviews.Content: We were happily transfered from their brother hotel across the street: Valadon Hotel. The room was small but very nice, cosy, clean and modern. The weather was so cold that we loved to spend time in. Breakfast was nice and all service people were helpful. The location of this small hotel is the best, close to the Eiffel Tower and to Invalides. Two metro stations are within walking range and the neighbourhood is safe, clean and full of activity (shops, markets, restaurants, etc...). Definitely a supreme experience. A pity I wonÂ´t be able to afford it if I ever want to go back and pay the price it actually costs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mgor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. The hotel is very clean and modern. The rooms are on the smaller size compared to american standards, but nevertheless they have adequate room for 2 large bags. The rooms have mood lighting, an LCD TV and two large windows that look out onto the street. Our bathroom was spotless and a good size, it also had a a tub. We were very satisfied with the hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful whenever we needed directions or any help. The location of this hotel is perfect. It's almost right on Rue Cler - a nice local street with various wine, cheese shops and nice small restaurants. A couple of restaurants are right outside the hotel doors, they had pretty good food and were generally packed in the evenings. There were two convinience stores across the street from the hotel, which we found useful. The metro stop is about a 5 min walk from the hotel, so is the Eiffel tower. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The trip of a lifetime and with a view!”
Reviews.Author: mcds96
Reviews.Content: I took the wife to Europe and decided to stay here based on my guide book. When we arrived we were told that we had been upgraded to the top floor to one of the rooms with a view of the Eiffel Tower! Could lie in bed and see it light up at night. The staff was wonderful, the location was perfect and the chocolate bar downstairs was GREAT for a mid-day hot chocolate break. The restaurants out the door and the bakeries down the road where excellent. We loved the hotel and would go back ANYTIME!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated for Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: rsthomas11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Valentine's weekend having never being to Paris before. The hotel was situated a few minutes walk from Ecole Militaire Metro station which made it easy to visit all the must-see places in Paris. The rooms were small and there was not much hanging space but for a weekend it was fine. The rooms were clean and the maid changed bedding & towels every day. We were on the 5th floor and could see the top third of the Eiffel Tower from our room (a bonus as we didn't expect to!) We couldn't hear other guests in their rooms although sometimes we could hear showers running when in the communal areas. The only downside was the lift - it was out of action Mon-Fri 10am-5pm which was hard work after a day out walking in Paris. The staff were all friendly and spoke good English. All the floors also had free internet wifi access so we could still keep in contact with home easily. Don't book direct as our room was advertised as â‚¬240/night and we only paid about Â£120 via Eurostar website so shop around before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris hotel for families with small kids”
Reviews.Author: criticdesandiego
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it's located in a quaint neighborhood near the Eiffel Tower and the Rodin Museum, and we weren't disappointed - not only was the hotel cool, trendy and comfortable, but the kids loved it's quirky design and easy location. A quick walk took us to the Eiffel Tower, parks and the Seine and the Metro station is only 2 blocks away. The kids made friends with the sweet woman who owns the bistro across the street, and she made them chocolate crepes for breakfast each morning (and served me an award-winning cafe au lait). The French are known for their food, and although this hotel does not have a restaurant, there are so many on the same block that we could have eaten all day long. Add to that a cheese shop across the street, a cook's shop down a bit, a bakery on the corner and a grocery store just down the way - we had everything we needed right on our little Parisian avenue. I should note the hotel has a breakfast room with everything you need, and there is a fantastic designer chocolate and macaroon retailer located in the lobby - I brought a bunch home to share with friends. The suite we stayed in was perfect for a family - a queen bed plus two twins and an extra twin that doubled as a couch. We had plenty of room in our very well-engineered and appointed room. The kids loved the bathroom because the shower is literally in the center of the room - no walls or curtains. Great place at a great price - we are already wondering when we can get back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: erica210
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Sept 2009. The hotel is adequate - clean, modern, rooms a tad small and as mentioned the bathroom sliding door leaves little privacy but the best part is the location. Yes it's close to the Eiffel Tower and near the Metro, but the neighborhood itself is wonderful. Restaurants right on the corner (fyi they stop serving food around 11pm like most places in Paris which coming from NYC I can't comprehend), patisseries, boulangeries, large street wide markets and plenty of stores to browse/shop.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Cass and Age
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Cadran in December 2009 / January 2010. The hotel seemed newly renovated. Our room was amazing. For a hotel in Paris the room was huge. We had heaps of room. The room was really modern and the bathroom was beautiful. We only had a couple of issues during our stay. The lift broke down three times. Take the stairs! The male receptionist was really friendly and helpful but the female ones made no effort whatsoever to be friendly. We avoided asking questions at reception until the man was there. The location is fantastic. About a 10 minute walk to the Champs de Mars. There is a little street just behind the hotel that has heaps of fresh food shops, bakeries, and restaurants. We didn't have to leave this area for food in the evening. There is a laundry mat on the corner which came in handy. We would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel right by the Eiffel Tower!”
Reviews.Author: pixiedust22
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 4 people going for a long weekend in Paris. I did some major research on tripadvisor, and wanted a clean, modern hotel, well located and not too expensive either - Hotel Du Cadran met these specifications! (We booked through Expedia)..The hotel is pretty easy to find (print a local map before you get to Paris, nearest metro stop is Ecole Militaire)..Very friendly staff at reception, they reserved our 2 rooms adjacent to each other, just as I had requested via email before arrival, gave us excellent walking maps / guides of Paris, and kept our luggage safe in the storage room as we had arrived before check-in. Rooms are pretty small, but more importantly, clean, modern (funky lighting, plasma TV, nice bathroom, cupboard to hang clothes etc etc)..You can walk to the Eiffel Tower from here, PLENTY of restaurants and bakeries nearby..and metro close to go everywhere else - just see the location on a map of Paris! We had to get cabs at night to go to bars / clubs (in Latin Quarter, Marais etc), but that was easy enough! The hotel would happily phone a few restaurants for us to make reservations every night too. Overall I recommend for couples, small groups of friends, even business travellers if the location is convenient! Especially if you don't like the antique / old-style hotels - this is modern and CLEAN!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: plunky_wotzit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a stunning area of Paris, walking distance from the Eiffel Tower but far enough from the main streets to get an authentic Parisian experience. There are some good restaurants and bars close by and the staff at the hotel are very helpful and friendly. A memorable holiday. Thank you Hotel du Cadran : )

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, and awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Captpablo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Paris now 4 times and always tried to find the perfect Paris hotel. I have read a lot of reviews as well and finally decided to book this one. If your looking to stay near the Tour Eiffel then this is a great option. First the location: Perfect for first time in Paris - Why? located in an area that is comfortable and gets you used to how life is in Paris. Easy to meals, snacks and drinks. Hotel - Comfortable, clean, nice bathroom, Tv with english channels. Breakfast - was typical EU breakfast. We ate their only due to convenience since we were flying home that afternoon. My recommendation is to head to any of the local cafes and live like the locals. Price- expensive as is Paris. This was the only real downside. Stop looking and enjoy this hotel and area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel in Rue Cler district”
Reviews.Author: PoniGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights in this hotel. The room was terrific - loved the King size bed and the bathroom shower was great. The hotel is updated and has done some renovations. It is located in the Rue Cler area which we loved. The staff was really friendly and if you love chocolate they have a chocolate shop/bar in the lobby. Breakfast was terrific and was worth the extra price. I highly recommend this hotel - it looks like the pictures on their website. Kate Wilde

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, but: tiny, no lux touches, uncomfortable beds---merely ok.”
Reviews.Author: sked789
Reviews.Content: Had a room here for two nights based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor. As others note, the location is good, near the Eiffel Tower and many cafes and interesting shops. The place seems quite new and is very clean. Quirky modern decor which did little for me. The bad aspects which need more emphasis: even by Parisian standards our room was tiny. You have enough room, barely, to walk around the bed, and no more. The view is of the nondescript building across the street. The doors are acoustically transparent and you will enjoy listening to doors closing and any conversations other guests are having. The beds are cheap and uncomfortable, the linens likewise. The wifi was so weak that I could get it on my laptop but my iphone didn't even see it, and it was very slow. There are no robes, slippers, nice toiletries, or any other little luxuries one might expect in a $300+ room. The woman at the front desk was otherwise pleasant, but four times watched us (a disabled man and a petite woman) lug our bags into or out of the storage room without lifting a finger to help. The guy at the front desk barely spoke English. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well designed and friendly”
Reviews.Author: gleditsia
Reviews.Content: Friendly personal reception. Cleverly designed bedrooms with good soundproofing and good bathroom. Excellent breakfast for France. Conveniently located with good choice of nearby reasonably priced restaurants. This would be our first choice when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Just Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: OhioJoAnn
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough wonderful things about the employees of this hotel, as well as the hotel itself. From our initial contact with Marta to our end contact with Louise, we could not have been more pleased. As wonderful as these two women are and were most of our daily contact was with Emilie. This woman went out of her way to assist us and even made alternate reservations for a tour for us when our original choice was booked. A special thanks to Emilie and Marta for the complimentary macaroons! I do not know the woman who cleaned our room, but she did a superb job also. Our room was clean, spacious and had a wonderful bathroom with plenty of hot water. We truly loved the people at this hotel and enjoyed our comfortable room immensely. The hotel is in a wonderful location and we walked everywhere including the Eiffel Tower, (10 minutes), The Arc de Triomphe, (20 minutes) and not sure but around 30-40 minutes to the Louvre. Paris is very pedestrian friendly and the people are lovely! I would be remiss not to mention how close the hotel was to the Rue de Cler. This street is one minute from the hotel and offers wonderful food, outdoor markets and great gelato. We never really planned on staying in Paris but Pittsburgh had a direct flight to there so we decided to stay a few days before heading to Italy. We are so glad we stayed there and will definitely be back and book the Hotel du Cadran without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “we had a fabulous time”
Reviews.Author: gdduffy
Reviews.Content: paris is a beautiful city, and to stay at a hotel that has a chocolate shop in the lobby with wonderful people around to assist in all of the crazy tracelers needs is even better. the room was small, but the service, smiling helpful people, tasty european style breakfast and "clock" (i love all sorts of clocks) decor made our trip even more fun.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: OmakParisFan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Cadran sits in a neighborhood that is five minutes from the Eiffel Tower. Our room overlooked a street that each morning came alive with the sights and sounds of numerous shops, including bakeries and restaurants--it gave us a good picture of daily life in Paris. Metro access is two block away and the staff is most helpful with any travel needs, including arranging a shuttle to the airport. Breakfasts were hearty and the chocolate bar tasty. This hotel is a hidden treasure in Paris and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, quirky hotel with great location and the best bath tub in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: jodithgrace
Reviews.Content: We just spent five days in Paris for my husband's birthday. We chose the Cadran from Rick Steve's book, and really enjoyed it. I had been worried about the reviews complaining about the lack of space for luggage, but we really didn't have a problem. There was a stand for each of our suitcases and a small closet. We did live out of our suitcases, but it wasn't a problem. The room is small, but very clean and the staff is friendly and English speaking. The bath tub was great, which for me is a major plus. The lighting system is a bit quirky..I had trouble turning on my bedside reading light without turning on other random lights as well. Another quirk is that with all of the hotel's obsession with clocks, there wasn't one in our room, and we never knew what time it was in the morning without squinting at our watches. So bring your travel alarm clock. The location of the hotel was ideal. Right on the Rue Cler, with its shops and cafes. And withing walking distance of The Eiffel Tower and L'Invalides. We could even see the Eiffle Tower from our window, which is a MUST for a stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, fresh, elegant, and well situated!”
Reviews.Author: Gabi11
Reviews.Content: I was so pleased I found this hotel! It is relatively small, but staff were very friendly and helpful. As my school French was not up to much, I spoke English and that was no problem since the desk staff speak English well. Small and immaculately clean, my room had a very comfortable queen size bed, a beautifully designed and well thought out bathroom with the latest in tap ware. The lighting too was very modern, cleverly designed and efficient, especially the bedside reading light which can be a problem in hotels that assume guests do not read in bed! Also noteworthy is the breakfast room in the basement, again modern, cleverly designed and offering a good variety of breads, croissants, small meats, etc. This is great value as it is included in the price of the room. For those exhausted from walking around Paris during the day, there is a lovely and inexpensive restaurant practically outside the front door where one can sit and watch the world go by while having a nice glass of local wine! And, as one of my reasons for coming to Paris was to visit the MuseÃ© Quai du Branly, it is only a 10 minute walk away, as is the Eiffel Tower. I'd stay at the du Cadran again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely week-end !”
Reviews.Author: GrifterParis
Reviews.Content: Great design hotel centrally located and just one stone away from Rue Cler. Everybody was friendly and we would like to use this review to pass our thanks to Marta and Emilie at front desk who were great to us. The room we had was spotless clean and efficiently furnished. The bed was big and comfy. Wifi works just fine and came free. We sampled some of the macaroons from the bar in the lobby. They were so yummy that we had to purchase some when we checked out to take away. We enjoyed our stay very much and will definitely come bacK.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: hvcc
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel staff, especially Martha, went out of their way to help us as to where to eat, how to get places, etc. Especially since our French was very limited. We loved that the hotel was so near the attractions yet it was in a neighborhood in Rue de Cler, and not a tourist trap. My only objection was that we definitely could have used some drawers and more hanging space, unless you're packing very light.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Parisian hotel with helpful friendly staff !”
Reviews.Author: newjerseyidol
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the charming RueClare area where the markets are open daily for fresh foods. We wanted to stay in a hotel which was more Parisian than American and this suited the bill. The rooms are small but we expected that in Paris. The staff at the hotel speak English and can help with directions, reservations, recommendations. Emilie (front desk) was a pleasure and great source of information and helpfulness to us and others during our stay. We would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMamaFL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in September. It is a wonderful hotel. The front desk staff is pleasant and helpful. The room, bathroom and lobby areas are very clean. The room is small but we had no trouble, we packed 2 small suitcases, which was easier. Internet service was excellent, along with the breakfast, which was included with the room we booked(not your typical American breakfast but a typical European breakfast, which we really enjoyed). The location is awesome, we walked to the Eiffel Tower 2 nights for a picnic, which we picked up along Rue Cler and at the very convenient grocery store nearby. There is a Metro stop nearby and we used it frequently also. This si a great hotel for the price and location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: donna1126
Reviews.Content: HI, My Granddaughter and I stayed in the Hotel Du Cadran in Pa;ris for a week in August this year. We had a great time and found this hotel on Trip Advisor after reading the reviews. Paris is huge and trying to find a good place to stay is a challenge as there are so many hotels in 20 different areas. We decided on this Hotel because it was close to the Eiffel Tower, the bus lines and the Metro. When we go back we will stay there again. It; is in the best neighborhood, Rue Cler. There are cafes, pastry shops, grocery store, etc. within easy walking distance. The front desk staff was so helpful getting us from here to there on numerous occssions. We took alot of busses as I would rather be above ground and see the sights. They always got us where we were going and back home again by providing the bus numbers in both directions and it worked every time~! This is a small Boutique Hotel and the rooms are small as are all the rooms in Paris. This was not a problem. The beds were very comfortable, the best I've ever had when traveling. They actually have Duvet's on the beds and the best pillows. The bathroom is small also but has everything you need. To make your trip easier, please take converters and adaptor plugs, you need the long round adaptor plugs. (To use the Blow dryer you need to hold down the blue button the whole time you are drying your hair ) There isn't a restaurant here but they do offer a breakfast buffet in a cute spot in the basement . We didn't eat there as there are so many places around there to try. Hope this review helps and we had a great time in Paris and a great time at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, but super location.”
Reviews.Author: BigJoeTheDiver
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny, and there is no where to put your stuff. So pack light! All you need are some pants, a couple of sweaters, a coat, a scarf, and a hat . The location of this hotel trumps all the shortcomings. One building away from the Rue Cler Market Street. You will not need to go anywhere else to eat your whole trip. There are two small markets across the street for wine and staples (you will want a normal size bar of soap for your room) Just pick any bottle of French wine for around 8 Euros and you will be pleased. The bread and pasteries at the bakery on the corner are perfect, even the chinese restaurant is good on the Rue Cler. And the chees and meats! Oh my God. Metro stop is great to use from the entrance around the corner. If something bothers you about your room, tell the staff, they will try to fix it. I just wish they had better closets, shelves, or SOMETHING so you can get to your stuff withouty riffling through your suitcase constanly. We could not walk in our room withoug jumping over stuff on the floor. We had to roll on the bed to get from one side of the room to the other. ON the other hand, they have the BEST bathrooms. And the walk to the Eiffel Tower is just 5 minutes. The view when you step around the corner will take your breath away. Take the van tour they recommend early during your trip at night, makes planning other excursions easy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdJonesey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on brief trip to paris and found the whole experience to be fantastic. The staff were friendly and informative and spoke excellent english. The rooms were small but very nice and clean as was the bathroom. The hotel is boutique looking and very clean and tidy. The area of Rue Cler is beautiful as it is walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and the surrounding streets the hotel is located in are brimming with quaint shops, restaurants and cafes, and a supermarket. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as there were plenty of nice cafes around. I very much enjoyed the hotel and surrounding area and can'y recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful english speaking staff”
Reviews.Author: MgoBlue7
Reviews.Content: The location was great, minutes from the Eiffel tower and metro station. Cafes around, a small grocery store and laundry right across the street. Rooms were small but neat and clean, bathroom was surprisingly large compared to room. Didn't have a safe - apparently the previous guest stole it!! - but they were very professional about keeping our valuables in the hotel safe - gave us a receipt too. Staff spoke English and was very helpful with directions. On a quiet street. Only downside was the Air con was working but just barely. Breakfast doesn't have anything hot like eggs, only toast, croissants, cereal, soggy fruit and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gillamg
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and had a fantasic time, the room was compact but larger than those I have stayed in London. It was very clean and modern and was kept clean daily by the lovely staff. The reception staff were very polite and spoke English easily. I would very much recommend this hotel for its location as it was absolutely perfect for a romantic get away. My only very small observation is that the cafes outside start putting their chairs and tables out at 6.30am each day so take ear plugs if this bothers you or get a room away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: carolonmac
Reviews.Content: Hotel Du Cadran is ideally located at the corner of Rue Champs du Mars and Rue Cler. A few blocks from the Eiffel Tower, Ecole Militaire, and Hotel Invalides, it is wonderfully situated in a fabulous neighborhood filled with bistros and anything else you'd ever want.. Step out the door and a few steps away you can treat yourself to an array of delightful cheese and wine shops, bakeries, fruit stands, specialty chocolate and ice cream shops, and outdoor cafes. In fact, every day, Rue Cler is bustling with wonderful activity from early morning to late at night, Despite all the nearby activity, noise is never a problem, however, and you'd never know so many wonderful things were going on right down the street. The neighborhood is very safe. A metro stop is around the corner, as well as a bus stop, but you can walk very easily to a lot of attractions. The Seine is right behind the Eiffel Tower, where you can take a day or night cruise along the river. The hotel staff gives great directions and recommendations to help you plan your day. The Cadran is a small hotel that was totally renovated in recent years, and it has a sparkling clean and fresh, contemporary feel. There's lots of glass, mirrors, and stainless steel to make the hotel seem bigger and pleasantly new, and the rooms are very tastefully decorated. The hotel owner/manager loves clocks, and you'll find interesting clocks all around to give some special fun to the decor. Space is used very efficiently. The marvelous air conditioning is a plus in the heat of summer. The beds are really comfortable. There's a safe in every room. Every bathroom has a hair dryer. There's free internet access off the lobby, and free newspapers are available daily.. For an extra cost, a very nice breakfast is available, with an assortment of breads and pastries, meats, cheeses, yogurt, fresh fruit, juices, and a fabulous coffeemaker that zips out great coffee, cafe au lait, cappuccino, or hot chocolate. Alternatives to the hotel breakfast are right outside the hotel at the bakeries and cafes that open very early. The hotel is amazingly clean, and the reception and cleaning staff are extremely friendly and accommodating, providing ice, extra towels, and anything else you might want. And don't worry if you can't speak a word of French, because the reception staff is fluent in English. To top it off, there's a specialty chocolate bar and macaroon shop right in the hotel. I can't say enough about this little hotel. My friend and I enjoyed 8 delightful nights here, and we would definitely stay here again, if we were ever to return to Paris. The location and accommodation can't be beat. Carol Costa Springfield, Massachusetts, USA

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royalty.”
Reviews.Author: Bill73AL
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the south of France and had alot of luggage. I said it looks we could use a large room. The desk clerk, Lawrence said that can be arranged for the same price. It was so nice. Cadran Hotel has recently modernised and it was good in the past. it is even better now. The Hotel has a nice efficent and friendly staff. It has an excellent location whether on business or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, spotless, efficiently-run, perfect location, charming neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Fab411
Reviews.Content: We had 2 connecting rooms since our 12 & 14-year old children were with us. We found this hotel in a Rick Steves' guide and were not disappointed. The Rue Cler neighborhood is delightful, with many wonderful dining options ranging from bakeries to French cafe's, Chinese and Japanese, Italian, and our favorite--a gelato shop!!! Even better, there is a very clean and easy to use laundromat very close to the hotel, just a short walk on a side street. Two metro stations are also within easy walking distance. The manager and front desk staff were very efficient, polite, and helpful. Noise was not a problem. For those who complain of noise in hotels, bring earplugs. Loved having 2 computers in the lobby to easily access internet and e-mail (free). We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: isairasiki
Reviews.Content: The room was quiet without street noises, it was clean, and the beds were comfortable. The hotel was close to the train station, and walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The bathrooms were small and the splash glass door in the bathroom shower would have been better if it covered the entire length of the bath tub. We would have preferred a coffee/tea maker in the room instead of having to go downstairs in the mornings for coffee/tea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly, hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: onendone
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. It was in an excellent location (close to the Metro, Bus Line, Rue Cler, many cafes and restaurants, and a supermarket. My 16 year old daughter and I were together. We booked a room directly on the site as a package deal (King room, 2 day museum pass, and breakfast buffet). The room was small (as expected), but space was used efficiently. Our bathroom was spacious so that we could lay out our toiletries, and it included both tub and shower. We could see the top portion of the Eiffel Tower from our room (which to me was cool to see it "twinkle" for the first 5 minutes of the hour starting at 10:00 PM. As mentioned by a previous reviewer, you do need to use your hotel room key in a slot on the wall in order to activate the lights. Any needs that we had were met right away, and the staff was friendly. They were helpful. When I told them that I was working on my French, they were willing to help me along. Overall, it was a great place to stay, and I would stay there again if ever in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: eboomer
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights while we vacationed in Paris. During our trip, we walked everywhere, and the location of this hotel is perfect for ending the evening at the Eiffel Tower and then walking "home." The rooms are quite cozy - there is a very small closet, no drawers, and the bathroom door slides closed - not much space and very little privacy. I'm glad I was traveling with someone I like. Still, a reasonable price for Paris, and an unbeatable location.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Onthenextflight
Reviews.Content: Our friends who have lived in Europe for the past seven years recommended Hotel du Cadran because they've stayed there three times now. I hemmed and hawed and researched a ton and finally ended up picking it. Why did I waste time even LOOKING anywhere else?! The location is absolutely perfect, the rooms are great (I've stayed in smaller rooms in NYC), the service and friendliness were impeccable, and the design was perfect. Oh, and not to mention the macaroons at the chocolate store in the lobby. Loved, loved, loved Hotel du Cadran! Do not pass go. Don't look elsewhere. You will not be disappointed. In fact, we're already dreaming about our next trip to Paris and staying at du Cadran.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: travellers_from_oz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in March 2009 at the start of our honeymoon. We chose it because of its location near the Eiffel Tower, the Rue de Cler and many other spots. It didn't disappoint and we had a wonderful stay. It is a short walk to the Tower, many other spots, and not far to walk with luggage from the MEtro or TGV (I forget which stations unfortunately!) It is around the corner from the Rue de Cler, which has many wonderful fresh produce stores and many cafes/bistros. This was the best location we had stayed in (on our budget!) in Paris by far as it had the best proximity to places we wanted to visit. There are countless places to eat within a short walking distance. The hotel is a beautiful old building on the outside, but the inside (both rooms and lobby) are newly furnished with a very clean, sharp, bold edge which was a nice surprise. Rooms are small but fine for a couple. Bathrooms are quite new and work well. At one point our electricity stopped working, it turned out it was a problem on the whole floor- we were swiftly moved to a new room on another floor with no complaint. The breakfast was probably one of the nicest on our trip- fresh breads and pastries, and good coffee. There are a few hotels on the same street but after seeing the rest I'm very glad we chose this one- there is another very nice one though it is much pricier, and the rest leave much to be desired. We would definitely stay here again when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “small but perfect”
Reviews.Author: guccilady
Reviews.Content: great location, small but very clean modern zen like. great staff very helpful. little supermarket across street many restaurants and metro close by. stayed for just a layover would definitely stay at this hotel if in paris

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern hotel which maintains a quaint feel”
Reviews.Author: dvg_loves_cali
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my one night stay at this hotel and I wish I had stayed longer. I found it to be an incredible value and I would stay here again. My room was a corner room on the third floor (Room 313). There were three windows which opened to look out onto the street below through a wrought iron railing. One of the windows was located above the bath tub, which added an air of elegance. Just *having* a bath tub in Paris added an air of elegance. It was great to lie on the bed and feel the warm cross breeze carry through the room with a lot of natural light. The room was fairly small, but decorated in a modern style with an LCD TV on the wall and a safe. Wireless Internet was free, but didn't work particularly well. The front desk was staffed 24 hours per day. There was no room service nor any restaurant. The lobby of the hotel has a chocolate shop in it. I believe there was complimentary breakfast in the morning, but we didn't try it. One thing I found odd is that when leaving the hotel you had to leave your room key at the front desk. I could not figure out a reason for this. Surely the hotel has duplicate keys so it is not for their benefit, so to whose benefit is it? When we returned from our adventures they asked for our room number and gave us the key, but never asked for any ID. I can't say that I understand this policy nor did I much care for it. The hotel is on a quiet side street with a good cheese shop, a market, some cafes, two bakeries, and a bar all in spitting distance. The Metro is a little farther away, but the location is very convenient to the Eiffel Tower and we were able to easily walk from the hotel to the Seine and all the way to the Louvre without a lot of effort so we never needed to take the Metro. We took taxis to and from the airport (about 40 Euros) and the hotel was very helpful in making sure we had a cab in time to make our flight. One more note: I felt like an idiot for returning to the room and not being able to turn on the lights, for there is no switch. One must insert his room key into a slot for the lights to turn on. I assume this is some sort of attempt to save energy by forcing you to turn out the lights while you are away. I had never stayed in a hotel with this feature (even in Europe) and it took me some time to figure it out. It would have been nice if the front desk had warned us in advance before we fumbled in the dark for longer than we should have, which is why I am warning you myself. We had been looking at hotels in the Latin Quarter, but our top recommendations were sold out and we were glad we ended up here instead. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel - perfect location, great rooms , very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Shannaghn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a recent trip to Paris. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel - very trendy decor, small boutique hotel feel to it. The rooms were fresh and bright with modern decor, great bathroom (although no shower curtain) and nice linens. Reasonable room for luggage - closet with hangers and shelves. Safe and fridge in the room. Free WiFi. The hotel's location is fantastic - short walk to the subway and in the heart of the Rue Cler neighbourhood. The hotel staff was very helpful and tried to answer all our questions - however they do not have anyone to help you with your bags and were not able to answer some basic questions (Where to buy a new camera memory card or where to find a certain store in the city?). We were hoping since we dont speak French that they would help us find answers . . . but we had to figure it out on our own. They did arrange a taxi for us to the airport.
