Cafes outside the hotel (Cafe due March and Cafe Central) are great for a quick lunch of people watching. Le Bosquet restaurant at the end of the street is definitely worth visiting for dinner. They had great escargot (best we have ever had) and creme brulee. Overall, the hotel was wonderful and we will definitely stay here again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in Paris/ like new, very clean hotel/helpful English speaking staff.”
Reviews.Author: SearchingForTheBudda
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Cadran is located in the perfect spot for seeing Paris.Five minutes from the Eiffel Tower. Less than a mile from the Louvre, the Arc Triumphe,the Musee d'Orsay, the Seine, Napoleans Tomb, Champs Elysee, .... Less than 100 feet from the famed Rue Cler market area with it's great cafe's and shops in blocks of pedestrian only traffic. Minutes from Metro and Bus stops. The hotel and rooms have just undergone total renovation and appear brand new. From the appearance of our room we may have been the first to stay in it. Small but nice and could not be cleaner. The staff was great help to us, arranging for a car service to pick us up at the airport, advice on restaurants, car rental, sightseeeing, shopping. Marta at the front desk assisted us with something every day. We loved her. She helped make our whole trip easier, better and more fun. Whatever her salary is it should be doubled (at least), she is worth every Euro. To Review; Perfect location, clean and quiet property,very helpful staff. What more can you ask for? C.Stanton

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel- family room was modern, clean and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: ExpatFamily0fFive
Reviews.Content: This is a great place. We have three young children and were dreading the Paris accomodations but this hotel was beyond expectations. The family room was small (but we are in Paris) but it was just perfect- modern, immaculate and quiet. The lighting was so well thought out that you could read in bed and not disturb the sleeping children (which is not always the case in most hotels). The air conditioning was easy to set and the room was so comfortable (after a large hotel in Brugge which we could not control the temp this was pleasure). Brand new computers and laptops available. The market street behind the hotel was a great bonus to get food quickly and easily in the morning. The walk to the Eiffel tower was beautiful. Since it was so close, we saw the tower in the beautiful evening and morning light! The kids could not have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel in the heart of Paris!!!!”
Reviews.Author: iloveparis4ever
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in this wonderful hotel and i was satisfied from the beginning till the end!!It is in a perfect location, just a few minutes from the Eiffeltower and the Invalides away and it was just completely renovated and is now very modern and trendy!!! I was also surprised how clean this place was and how the staff helped me with all my demands. Very friendly!! Moreover the rooms are very comfortable and fully equipped (also with WIFI for FREE!!!) And if this all wouldn't be enough, it has a extraordinary chocolate bar/boutique where you can drink excellent hot chocolate with original flavours or try many different macaroons or chocolates :) the cadran hotel is just an amazing place and i'm sure i will go back in my following trips to paris!

Reviews.Title: “little gem of a hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: dukemeister
Reviews.Content: stayed here a couple of weeks ago and it was great hotel is very well located only a couple of mins walk from nearest metro and 10 mins walk from eiffel tower plenty of places to eat on the doorstep and found a fab restaurant called le bosquet very near at the end of the street excellent food and service and not too expensive hotel small but done up to a very high standard, the room was spotless all newly decorated and although not huge was adequate breakfast was good continental with enough choice for us staff very friendly and helpful we would definitely stay here again if we ever go back to paris which we probably will if we get the chance as we loved it

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deacy
Reviews.Content: I really can't fault this wonderful little hotel! Firstly the location is great - in a bustling little neighbourhood that is full of character with lots of lovely little cafes & bistro's serving good food/drink and plenty of atmosphere! The hotel is also just a 5/10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower which makes for a lovely evening stroll. The hotel itself is superb - very clean, tidy and well run with polite & helpful front desk staff who all speak good English, there is free internet access available via the laptops set up downstairs and a lift for those who don't fancy the stairs. For those who take breakfast it is offered downstairs in a wonderful basement area and these is plenty on offer with as much coffee as you need! The rooms are pretty much perfect - a good size (Americans note - this is Europe so don't expect city centre rooms to be huge unless your budget is too!) with a huge and very comfy double bed, flatscreen TV, great lighting & aircon (all controllable from the bed), free safety deposit box, and a great ensuite shower room - again, very modern & exceptionally clean. We stayed in a first floor room at the front of the hotel and have to say that, even with the windows open, we didn't find the street noise a problem - and if we did we could have closed the windows & shutters and flicked on the aircon instead! One last piece of info, the hotel is a 16/17 euro taxi ride from the Eurostar terminal (Gare du Nord) and a short walk fromn the nearest Metro Station. Overall this is a wonderful little hotel and a great base for a break in this fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, convenient & accessible”
Reviews.Author: Rainbowlad
Reviews.Content: My French colleague recommended that we stay at any of the hotels in the Rue Cler neighbourhood during our 4 nights stay in Paris from 27 March. Based on good reviews from other guests who stayed @ Hotel Du Cadran, we decided on Du Cadran and we are glad of our choice. Room is reasonably spacious and comfortable and I love the bath toiletries provided. Breakfast is also good and I love the tavern feel of the breakfast room. Rue Cler is just round the corner and we could get nice pastries from a bakery and there are many cafes, including a Chinese cafe called Traiteur Chinois where you can have a reasonably good meal. A small supermarket is just opposite the hotel. The hotel has a small cafe bar that serves colourful and delicious macaroons. To the left of the hotel, there is Restaurant Du Marche that is extremely popular with the locals. Service & quality of food is good and the main reason why it is always crowded is that it is reasonably priced. A big plate of salad topped with tandoori chicken slices costs Euro 10. This area is so accessible. On the morning that we decided to make a day trip to Lisieux by train, we took bus No 28 to Gare St Lazare @ Euro 2.20 each. Bus journey took 10 mins. The Eiffel tower is also within walking distance. We will definitely stay at Hotel Du Cadran if we decide to visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: JennyDAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Cadran is in the great Paris location of Rue Cler. You can walk to the Eiffel Tower and are also close to a Metro stop. Rue Cler is also a great neighborhood to explore with plenty of restaurants. The room was comfortable but small. The bathroom was fine with a full shower. The hotel includes breakfast which was pretty good (croissants, coffee, fruit, cereal). The hotel also has wireless internet as well as a computer for guests to use. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room. Ok Location”
Reviews.Author: lucylu888
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel du Cadran for four days. The hotel is relatively close (a couple of streets away) from the Metro...which is very convenient. The Metro is a vital part of transportation in Paris. The hotel is a hop skip and a jump to Rue Cler which is a quaint street filled with cafes. In the morning, they sell fresh baked goods, fresh fruits, fresh veggies.. fresh everything!! The Eiffel Tower and Hotel Invalides is very close by too. The hotel employees are all very nice and try their best to make our stay pleasant. The hotel itself looks newly renovated but you can tell its an old hotel. The elevator is a bit rickety... there were a couple of times it would stick and we were stuck. The rooms are SUPER tiny. If you're on the larger size.. you may not like this. I probably wouldn't stay here for another visit.. I would stick to the other bank because its more livier over there. At nite, there's really nothing to do around the hotel. There is free wifi which is GREAT! I do think the hotel is a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: akasnowboard
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and speak great English. The maid service was excellent. The hotel was completely renovated in the last year or so and everything looks and feels new. The rooms are small but not too small. The hotel is a 5 min walk from the subway and 10 minute walk from Eiffel Tower. There are nice cafes and small shops right outside but there is very little noise. Each room has it's own A/C unit. Nice soaps, shampoos, and fresh towels were provided each day. The breakfast was also nice. The area is very very safe. The only negative was that the wake up call on our departure morning never came...that cost us an extra 25 euro in taxi fare. They claimed that they called and we didn't answer but the chances of that are about .0001%. Never in my entire life has the phone rung or an alarm gone off that I haven't woken up. And if we didn't answer, why didn't you call back? Most likely they just forgot. It would have been a *big* problem if we had not have had a taxi waiting for us which caused them to recheck their wake up call list. We could have easily missed our flight. I learned a lesson - always carry an alarm clock - never count on the wake up call. Still, the hotel was excellent and I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ATLTraveler88
Reviews.Content: This was a nice surprise - a clean, modern hotel in a good neighborhood with very friendly service. I initially wanted to stay in another place down the road, but I'm so glad we stayed here. The room we had was small and the bathroom was even smaller, but what do you expect in Europe? It all looked recently renovated. We had a mini fridge and flat screen TV. They have 2 computers that you can use free of charge. There are lots of nice shops nearby including a couple of cheese stores, a bakery and a couple of grocery stores. It was a 5 minute walk from the Ecole Militaire Metro and a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. This is the place I'll stay at in Paris from now on. The price is reasonable for Paris as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: OxfordFloyd
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel. V clean rooms, small but Ive seen smaller. Location is ace for the Eiffel Tower and Batobus into town. Not so good for Metro but why go underground when theres so much to see up top? Not a lot of bistros/cafes around the hotel but that does make it a quieter area. A/C is still up the swannie so you have to leave the window open at night otherwise youll fry. Check that before you book in the summer. Thoroughly recommend, children loved it too. Dont forget to go to the cheese shop a couple of shops doen the Rue du C-d-M. Great cheese, still eating it now!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: tom10000
Reviews.Content: We reserved true Expedia for three days in PARIS. Third time we have been in Paris. We found un original and quiet trendy place. Specialy the CHOCLATE BAR in the hotel. First time I tried MACARONS.That was a delicious trip. If you like chocolate you would like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great value and will definately be back!”
Reviews.Author: miche_16
Reviews.Content: As a single female traveller I did a LOT of research before I left for Paris as to where to stay. I wanted something in a great location, very clean, comfortable, safe and not overly expensive... when I got to this hotel I got all of that! I was pleasantly surprised how clean and modern the hotel was, and it was located in a fantastic area (lots of shops, resturants and about 5-10 min walk from the Eiffel Tower). I stayed for 5 nights at the end of February and was relieved that I lucked out and made a great pick, and the desk staff were helpful and friendly. When I got there the rooms had already been renovated, although the lobby was still under renovations, although if it looks anything like the rooms did it will look fantastic! Others have montioned that the rooms were fairly small, and yes they were, but in Europe standard hotels are NOT the same size as North America so it should be expected. The elevator was pretty small, but I only used it upon arrival and departure anyways since thats when I was carting the luggage, but otherwise the stairs were absoutely fine to use on a daily basis. This hotel was fantastic and I would definately go back here if I was to stay in this area of Paris in the future!

Reviews.Title: “safe, select area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: penky
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, on a trip called "Secret Paris - walking tour" by Travel Editions, which I highly recommend, with educated,knowledgable, amusing guides, 3 little walking tours in 3 days. The hotel is immaculate, comfy beds, lovely breakfast, nice staff. Very convenitent. The area is really nice with lots of proper Parisian shops, not touristy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern, Close to Eifel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Corkonian0
Reviews.Content: Stayed he for 2nights in March. Newly renovated hotel. All works seems complete as nothing was happeing when we were there. the lobby is finished. Rooms small but made the best of the space.Very clean. Flat screen tv, mini fridge, wardrobe, safe. Really clean bathroom with bath and shower.Shampoo & shower gel supplied. Plenty of lighting. didn't eat breakfast as there are plenty of little cafes around the corner at half the price. Location: Take Roissy bus from CDG to Opera & then metro line 8 to Ecoile Militaire. only 3-5min walk from there. 10min walk to eifel tower. Lovely area. Would definately stay here again. Staff helpful if looking for information.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, if a little warm!”
Reviews.Author: DJ_Billy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just off a bustling side street, between two main boulevards near the Eiffel Tower. The area is a little quieter than many other parts of central Paris so itâ€™s a bit more relaxed. This is quite an upmarket area and so the restaurants and cafes are somewhat more expensive than in, say, the Latin Quarter. However the cheaper areas can be easily accessed on the Metro from the nearby Ecole Militaire station, as can all of the main tourist attractions. This may not be the ideal place to stay however if you plan to return to your hotel before going out to eat in the evening. The hotel is in the process of being renovated. The rooms are all completed and when we were there the lobby was being fitted out. This didnâ€™t cause too much inconvenience however and it looked like it was nearly done. The rooms were fairly small but nicely finished, with a minibar and large LCD TV. No tea/coffee making facilities or bath though. The one problem with the room was the heat. This was the middle of winter and yet the room was stuffily hot. The air-con didnâ€™t really do anything and opening the window let in a lot of noise. Other than that the hotel was fine. We didnâ€™t try the breakfast. It seemed expensive at 12 Euro and the local cafes bakeries and supermarkets were a much more reasonable prospect.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed Feb. 3rd one night. The room is small but everything is extremely clean and modern. No bathtub but lovely shower. I've noticed some of the reviews complain about street noise the way to avoid this is to ask for a room higher up. There is a small elevator. The lobby is underconstruction but looked to be moving along quickly. There is not a lot of space to walk around the bed but you are in Paris - how much time are you going to spend in the room. As for the location, the hotel is ideally located within a 10 minute walk to the eiffel tower. The street the hotel corners on is a market street called Rue Cler. The street offers a supermarket across the road and lots of cafe's. Highly recommend Tribeca for dinner and Cafe Marche for lunch. Street also offers a bakery and fruit stands. The bakery is ideal for a quick baguette or quiche. All very nice. If you enter the city via train through Gard du nord the hotel is easily located via the metro system. You will need to take two trains. the first train is about 3 train stops and the second train about 10 stops. A very quick and easy ride. Cost is 1.60 euro's for the train. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Modern room and in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: CY392YF
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel overall, although the outside of the hotel looks way smaller than in the picture, the reception was very small as well. The location is great, about 3mins walk from the metro station and loads of shops and restaurants around, a supermarket is right opposite to the hotel. The room was very modern too, with fancy lighting controls (although i don't feel they're necessary but they look pretty cool), LCD TV and power shower with plenty of hot water. You also get the normal stuff in the hotel, a safe in the funky orange wardrobe and a fridge that's hidden behind the door although it doesn't have coffee/tea facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small and lovely just renovated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: The_travel_kid
Reviews.Content: This small hotel in the hearth of the 7 arrondissement just a few steps away from the Eiffel tower and the Ecole Militare has a very close and comfortable access to the Metro line 8. The hotel was under renovation so all the room were new and clean. The size of the room as happen in Paris was small but the atmosphere was cozy and very welcoming. The queen size bed was very comfortable and warm. The breakfast on the basement grotto was limited but delicious with tasty small croissants. The staff was always ready to try their best to accommodate our requests and needs. Our overall stay was very positive. We will certainly take this hotel in serious consideration on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Cadran - A Jewel”
Reviews.Author: freqnttrvlr7
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Cadran was just/is being refurbished (mid-January 2009). The rooms are well-appointed and very modern, but course, small. The lobby is in the finishing stages of remodeling, but certainly did not give the feeling of being in a mess. The continental breakfast was great and the staff was very attentive. A wonderful place to stay in the Eiffel Tower area.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MacMil
Reviews.Content: This is good standard hotel in an excellent location. I went to Paris to visit the Mussee d'Orsay for the 1st time and revisit the Louvre. This hotel was a covenient location for my purpose. I didn't bother with the metro and simply walked to the Mussee d'Orsay in about 25 minutes. The hotel itself is undergoing renovation but it was not a problem for me. The room I stayed in (206) was lovely and I have to say a lot of thought has gone into the overall design especially the use of space in the bathroom, lighting, decoration, quality of furniture and fixtures and fitting etc. The bed was very comfortable and the shower excellent. I took the hotel's breakfast at 13Euros which seems a bit pricy until you realise that the cafes and bars in Paris are quite expensive. Another reason I ate the breakfast at the hotel was that they do good coffee (I drink 3 cups in the morning!) which is something hard to find in Paris. The local area has a nice feel with lots of cafes and shops. This was my 6th visit to Paris and this is the best hotel I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel near Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: citytraveller1976
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK, small and stylish. The personnel are polite and and service minded which is not the case with all the employyes in tourist industry in this country according to foreigner , ) The surroundings are nice and piecefull. If you fancy Eiffel tower this is a good hotel. If you would like to be in heart of the partying, this might not be your choice..

Reviews.Title: “Great locataion”
Reviews.Author: Nirain
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, cool decor and very close (10 mins. stroll) to Eifel Tower. The area the hotel was located in was great for Cafe life. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandOwl
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, lovely staff, definetly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: texasfm
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for our family. We have 2 boys ages 12 and 13. We had the family suite which was actually 2 rooms with our own little hallway with a separate door. The bathrooms were actually a fine size and the beds very comfortable. The hotel is very close to a metro stop and 5 minutes to the Eiffel Tower. The lady at the front desk was extremely helpful. The breakfast was very good. The only complaint was we were on the first floor and we heard quite a bit of noise. I would recommend staying on a upper floor and on the back side of the hotel to try to eliminate some early morning noise. (5 - 6am) But, by no means would this prevent me from staying there again. Very good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at Cadran”
Reviews.Author: DocNZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and most spoke English fluently. Check-in was efficient and it was easy for us to store our bags for the day after check-out. The reception area has just been renovated and was modern and welcoming. We had a free Seine River cruise as part of the Christmas special and this was a lovely added bonus for our trip. Our room was very clean, warm, quiet and comfortable. The beds are amazing - you'll be sure to have a solid sleep. Bathroom was small, but very clean and modern. The shower was great - although due to the design, water does tend to end up all over the floor. Towels are fluffy and plentiful. Our room was small, but had everything we needed. Flat screen TV included! The decor is simple, modern and funky and the lighting system for the hotel is unique and inviting. The free wifi in the rooms is also a great asset to this hotel. The breakfast is very good for Paris standards. The coffee machine is a dream in the mornings (hot chocolate is yum!) and there is a really good amount of choice - esp for a small hotel. The breakfast room itself has a lot of atmosphere - we loved it! We also absolutely loved the location of this hotel. It is easy to find and is so close to many great sights in the city. However, as I mentioned above, it is very quiet and private. We visited the market street of Rue Cler daily and had many a wonderful meal / snack there. Cafe Central, Cafe du Marche and Tribeca are all very good. The crepe place down the street is also def worth a try. Cheap and delicious! I have been to Paris 3 times before this trip and our stay at Cadran was FAR superior to anything else I have experienced. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but especially young couples and singles (and anyone wanting a clean, comfortable, safe, modern and friendly stay in central Paris). We had a friend meeting us in Paris and she stayed at the same hotel and was also very impressed. She used to live in the city and agreed that it was an excellent standard of 3-star hotel. For the price, it was very good value for this city and I have the feeling that this hotel will be very popular for years to come. Book early! We would absolutely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: chirita47
Reviews.Content: the hotel is ok (even if the rooms are very small),in a very nice part of paris and with very modern decoration .Unfortunatelly they were refurbishing the brekfastroom and it was too little space in the lobby.the personal is frendly and the sarroundings are marvellous

Reviews.Title: “Loved du Cadran”
Reviews.Author: fussyaussie
Reviews.Content: Hi, just wanted to tell you that we had a wonderful 5 nights at the du Cadran in Paris. The hotel looks like it has been recently totally refurbished and everything was new and funky. The actual room itself is small but adequate. Probably the only criticism is that there is insufficient shelf space - only a ledge. But the cupboard is good and the bathroom is fantastic. Flat screen TV and mini bar. We didn't take up the breakfast option - it looked pricey at e13 pp given that the hotel is 20m from Rue Clare where there are wonderful restaurants, bars, bakery etc. You can live like a local and it made Paris very reasonable for us. Bus and Metro access was simple and all in all du Cadran was excellent value especially by Paris standards. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: greywolf20k
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a romantic weekend in Paris and to celebrate my girlfriends 30th birthday. The hotel met every one of my expectations and I didn't mind the superior room size at all. The bed was perfect and provided a very peaceful nights sleep. The hotel staffs were extremely friendly and provided excellent recommendations for eating and we were not disappointed at all. It was very cold outside and the temperature of the rooms was at an acceptable level though the temperature in the room was not able to be changed (I think the thermostat was stuck on a pre defined setting), though it didn't matter as the setting was perfect for sleeping. I would definitely stay here again as the location and the fresh food markets around the corner made this hotel one of my favourite places to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but...”
Reviews.Author: HauntedMansion
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here in November 2008. The hotel is excellently located, close to the Ecole Militaire metro station and rue Cler for shops and restaurants. The Eiffel Tower is a short enjoyable walk from the hotel. The room was very modern; the only major drawback being the very firm bed. The bathrooms were very compact and the shower without a door was strange and resulted in a lot of water ending up on the floor of the bathroom. The room and bathroom were both kept very clean by the hotel staff, and plenty of fresh towels were provided daily. The front desk staff was always very polite and spoke good English. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: JToce
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Cadran is a block off Rue Cler on Champs de Mars. Situated between the Eiffel Tower and Napoleon's Tomb (Invalides) the location is perfect. The neighborhood is the perfect idyllic french street- excellent cafes on the corner, bakers, butchers, and wine stores all within stones throw. We're quite active- so one day we walked all the way to the Arc du Triomphe and the next all the way to Notre Dame. For everyone else, the #8 line is nearby, and takes you anywhere you need to go. We stayed in a "Superior King" room - although a french king must be smaller than it's US counterpart. The bed was comfy enough. The room was clean and modern, with an excellent view of the street below. The bathroom was equally well designed. The lighting system is especially nice and has a 3 setting dimmer in every room. The room also came with a flat screen tv- although only CNN and BBS were in english. The only problem we had was the electronic key card system went down, and the manager had to let us into our room on the second day. Meh- they'll fix that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in paris”
Reviews.Author: GEORGESDusseldorf
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at hotel du cadran. Very clean and well decorated rooms. we have been sevral times in paris, and this time was the best. The hotel is in a very quiet area, near eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull honeymoon in Paris !!!”
Reviews.Author: ninoNew_york
Reviews.Content: We chose hotel cadan for ourhoneymoon followingthe lovely reviews we readand we had a great stay.we let them know on arrival that we were on honeymoon and they immediately upgraded us to a superior room with no extra charge (great!). they recently renovated aal the ooms and we were on the top floor with a little viewon the eiffel tower. the hotel is vey clean and staff was hepful during our stay. They booked 2 superb restaurantin the neighbor and helped us gething a shuttle back to the airport. Wifi was working fine and the temperature of the room was nice. We really enjoyed our time in paris and have no problem recommending this hotel to our friends, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: sawsawparis
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is located near the metro station, Ecole Militaire. The size of the room is the average size of hotels in Paris (I mean it's small), but it is clean and comformtable. You can find a good cheeze shop (Marie-Anne Cantin) and a good bakery (Pain d'Epis) near the hotel. You had better to buy some bread and take them at your room as breakfast, because it is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but...”
Reviews.Author: bambam775
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is very clean. There are some renovations still being done in the common areas of the lobby but it did not interfere with anything. The staff was wonderful! We had problems with the Wi-Fi, which was anything but high speed, and the whole hotel was set to heat for the winter. Our room stayed extrememly warm so we had to leave our window open all night long. The surrounding stores receive deliveries at very early hours therefore we had the noise of those deliveries come right into our room. With that, we did not get much sleep even with ear plugs! Carole at the hotel was very helpful and gave us a reduced rate for our trouble so staff was never the issue. We would not stay here again nor recommend anyone to unless the things mentioned would not concern them.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TerryOldAgeDancer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at this lovely hotel. This hotel has great location that many restaurants and stores are near by. Hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful. They booked shuttle to pick up us at airport and arranged taxi took us to train station. We booked our room directly through hotel web site. Our room rate includes breakfast daily and 2 days museum pass which is really handy for us to skip lines at major attractions. Our room was small but very clean. Turn down services were provided every nights. The area is very quiet in the evening. Bathroom is modern but shower area is very small without curtain so water running all over. This is our first time in Paris and really happy with this hotel. We would recommend this hotel to everyone without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Dieterj
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and me stayed at the hotel Cadran over the wekend. The room we had was perfect. It was newly renovated, clean and had a modern design. Also the location of the hotel is perfect. It is only a short walk away from the Eiffel tower. The metro station and lots of good restaurants are just around the corner. Even though the room was very quiet. I highly recommend this hotel and I will definetly stay here again at my next Paris visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liv_IRL
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I are just back from a 4 day visit to Paris. We stayed in this lovely, modern hotel. The staff at reception were very friendly & helpful. Our room was small, very clean & very modern. We had a view of the top of the Eiffle Tower. Each night our bed was turned down for us. The Hotel is in a great location. There are plenty of cafÃ©s, restaurants, bakeries, supermarkets etc. near the Hotel. There is a lovely small bar across the road from the Hotel, the staff were lovely & friendly. The metro is near the hotel which is great for the journey from & to the airport & also for going sightseeing. We went on a Bicycle Tour which I must say is such a great way of seeing the city. We booked with "Bike about Tours" www.bikeabouttours.com Our tour guide Paul was really friendly & pointed out different sights that you would only see & hear about on the bike tour. We did a night cruise on the Seine which is so Romantic & really worth doing. We booked with "Vedettes Point-Neuf" www.vedettesdupontneuf.com I would definately recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hotel du Cadran”
Reviews.Author: kg99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Room 505 at the Hotel du Cadran for 5 nights in October 2008. We had a lovely stay and agree with almost all of the comments in previous reviews. Our room was neat and clean and nicely tidied every day by the housekeeper. Room 505 has a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower which was especially nice at night when the lights make the whole tower twinkle for 5-10 minutes at the top of each hour. The street was quiet at night and we found the bed comfortable. The room is tiny and there isn't a closet (just a place to hang 4 hangers) but that is typical for Paris where space is a premium everywhere! The breakfast was included in our package and it included fresh juices, cereals, yougurt, canned fruit, delicious coffees (expresso/cappuchino machine) and teas, and wonderful baguettes with jam choices as well as a selection of pastries. It was tasty and very handy to have breakfast right at the hotel (served 7 - 10 am daily) but I'm not sure we would have paid 26 Euro (for two) each morning which is what is normally charged for the breakfast. The location of this hotel is superb! It is right in between the Eiffel Tower and the Hotel des Invalides (Napoleon's Tomb/Army museum) with a 2 or 3 block walk to the nearest metro station. There are lots of shops and restaurants right by the hotel and a small grocery store (closed Sunday) across the street from the hotel. We strolled to dinner each night and found Le Cafe Constant to be our favorite. We found the staff polite and helpful. Most speak English very well and they were quite helpful answering questions, making reservations, ordering a car to the airport etc. They happily loaned us an adapter (ours was outdated and didn't fit) and a cork screw which we appreciated. There are a couple of areas the hotel could work on but again these were minor for us and didn't spoil our stay. The showers are goofy (see previous reviews) - great water pressure but it goes all over the place. The lobby definitely needs updating - the sofas are quite worn and the ceiling is spotty - but our room was updated and modern. And it would have been nice to have a proper closet but again, not an essential. All in all we were very pleased with the Hotel du Cadran and would comfortably recommend it to anyone heading to Paris. Thank you to the staff for our lovely stay! Bonjour!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Cadran”
Reviews.Author: cathyAlberta
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small boutique hotel. Staff very helpful, breakfast very good and rooms all newly renovated, clean and comfortable. Small as usual from what I hear in Paris. Location great!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel du Cadran!”
Reviews.Author: nicholeshirene
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Hotel du Cadran for four days in October. We had such a lovely time! The staff really made the stay so enjoyable and made us feel very welcome. From the time of check-in we were impressed. We arrived very early on the first day and had asked the hotel if we could leave our bags there. Instead they invited us to have breakfast, and then went out of their way to see if there was an open room that we could check into early. During breakfast there was a very nice young man that spoke perfect English. He was so friendly and talked with us about what sights we should see and gave us some inside tips of what to do while we were in Paris. The room was very modern and chic, yet the hotel overall felt more like a quaint and inviting bed and breakfast. I highly recommend Hotel du Cadran. The staff, service, and location are fabulous! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: erfield5
Reviews.Content: Newly remodeled, very comfortable beds and all the modern conveniences. Wonderful location convenient to the charming small French- frequented restaurants. Has it all and very reasonable rates. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Live it, Love it.”
Reviews.Author: Chez-OZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic spot. Cafes, deli's, boutique supermarket, just outside the front door. Short stroll to the Tower from were you can do the Hop on Hop off tour. Our room was newly renovated. The decor was very modern, but it blended with the older exterior of the hotel. Only whinge would be for those of us that have small kids and dont get to stay out too late, it would have been nice to have a few more english speaking TV channels but that would not stop me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel du Cadran”
Reviews.Author: Traveler08Utah
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because we wanted to stay in a Paris neighborhood not at an American chain hotel. The Hotel du Cadran was a perfect choice. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The neighborhood was wonderful. There are restaurants and a wonderful bakery just down the street. Not to mention the Eiffel tower is a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VegasandBust
Reviews.Content: My wife found the hotel online and based on other reviews decided to give it a chance. We could not have been more happy with our choice. The staff were friendly, very helpful and suggested several local places to dine, which all proved to be levels above the more touristy options. The room was a bit smaller than American standards, but fittingly sized considering the location. Everything was very modern, clean, and well up kept. We would and have recommended the Hotel du Cadran Tour Eiffel to people visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: SKarri
Reviews.Content: Nothing more we can ask for. The hotel is conveniently located with nice Cafe's nearby and just a block away from the Metro station. I never had to take a cab to visit the places in Paris. The staff were friendly and the rooms were very clean. not to mention the lights in the room were very well designed.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel du Cadran”
Reviews.Author: USLouie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent, safe location just a few minutes walk from the Eiffel tower. There are restaurants right outside the hotel along with grocery stores,a post office, a few places to shop and about a block away from a metro station. We highly reccommend Cafe Central right outside the hotel for dinner, we had a some spectacular dinners here. Our waiter got to know us and would just bring out our usual drinks. The risotto with asparagus and chicken is great, the pan seared tuna and my husband had a duck entree that was out of this world! The room we had, 505, was small but expected, newly decorated and clean. We could see the Eiffel at night from our room. They have hairdryers in each room and an iron you can borrow from the front desk. The hairdryer in the bathroom has an outlet fit for U.S wattage that we used to plug our cell phones into but you will need a converter for anything else. We only had two issues, the closet in this room was more like a cabinet without a bottom in it. The cabinet took up most of the wall space on one side of the bed and if you weren't careful could hurt yourself (which we did a couple of times). The other issue was the shower, there isn't a shower curtain so by the time your done water was everywhere and there isn't a shelf to put soap, shampoo, etc. All in all minor things we could live with and we would definately stay here again. I went in a friends room, 404, and it was a corner room with two windows, also with a view of the Eiffel. This room was much larger, has a bathtub with a shower and full sized closet. If we go back I'd probably opt for this type of room if available. The hotel also arranged a shuttle service to pick us up from the airport and take us back. We had a minor mix up on the pick up but it all worked out. It costs 60 EUR, cash only, and we would use their service again also. The staff was very helpful, courteous and willing to help provide whatever we needed. It was a pleasant stay and after seeing some of the pictures of hotels in Paris on Tripadvisor we were very relieved to see we choose the right one.

Reviews.Title: “Second year of satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: scrameric
Reviews.Content: Last year was particularly good as breakfast was included in the price. This year the rooms have been refurbished tastefully, but the lighting is a bit over the top. Wife unable to apply make-up easily owing to the lighting/mirror situation. This is a minor detail, and doesn't detract from the total enjoyment of our visit. The staff knew we were visiting Paris for our 55th. Wedding Anniversary, and a bottle of Champagne arrived in our room almost as quickly as we did. The staff are all delightful individuals, and the breakfast is to be recommended. Will be booking again for our 56th.---(God willing) Eric & Elsie Armstrong, ENGLAND

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern hotel for the area!”
Reviews.Author: MeekoOrangePark_FL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 4 nights at the Hotel du Cadran. I guess they had overbooked the hotel on our 1st night so they actually had a room for us at a close by hotel. For the trouble they gave us a bottle of Champagne and two 2 day Museum passes. The other hotel was ok for the night but the Hotel du Cadran was much nicer. The rooms are smaller as others have said but they are fine for the amount you are there. The bathrooms are very nice.. it is a different shower.. you do get a lot of water all over! But they do have a regular Blowdryer on the wall.. not the older style. We loved the free wi fi as we had just come from Disneyland Paris where you have to use Orange in the lobbies and pay. This hotel is so close to the metro and there are so many good little restaurants to eat at. We enjoyed the restaurant that is right across the street.. was not as busy but was very quaint. We would not hesitate at all to book again at this hotel. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, quiet, modern, and clean”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelSunnyvale
Reviews.Content: We are a 50-something gay couple (relatively quiet and retiring) that stayed for 6 nights at the Hotel du Cadran in an exterior standard room on the 3rd floor this past September. We initially heard about the hotel from Rick Steves' "Paris 2008" guide and, based upon the preponderance of positive reviews from tripadvisor, decided to book our Paris stay here. Our experience matched those described by previous (recent) "positive" reviewers: the convenient location (close to major monuments, subways, restaurants, cafes, and grocery stores - without being in the middle of the overly crowded "touristy" areas); the welcoming, efficient, and helpful staff, the clean, modernized, (albeit "small"), and quiet rooms, with excellent Wifi access; the unusually complete breakfast (with cold-cuts in addition to the usual cheeses, croissants, yogurt, juices, coffee, cereal, etc... - (I believe no eggs, though). One thing that I didn't see previously mentioned is that there is a convenient self-service laundromat located within a block of the hotel that I would recomend to those that need to wash clothes during their trip. AN ASIDE: There is one thing that I'm somewhat hesitant to comment upon, but am doing so in the hope that it may be of benefit to other gay travelers in Paris. We found that almost everywhere we went (especially subways), that we were greeted with unwelcome, sometimes rude, (uneasy?) stares. Sensitivity to such behavior is, of course, individual, but we were a bit surpised that in a cosmopolitan city such as Paris that we (as a gay couple) would appear to be such 'freaks" worthy of notice. Despite this annoyance (which, after all, can be experienced in other parts of the world), we fell in love with Paris ... can 30 million annual visitors to Paris - according to wikipedia - all be wrong? However, I thought I'd just mention this so that others in a similar position are forewarned to this possible reception and can be prepared ahead of time. NOTE: this observation does not apply to the staff at the du Cadran who were all very friendly to us.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and clean”
Reviews.Author: BookieFlorida
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, near restaurants and the tower. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly. The only improvement I could suggest is to let the guests know what the "bar" in the lobby is all about. Can one get a cup of coffee at any time? Is there a charge?

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again In A Heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: OrangeNYC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our honeymoon in Paris and stayed at this charming boutique hotel in the 7th Arrondisement. We could not have been happier with our choice! Hotel du Cadran is in a quiet neighborhood within a short walking distance to Champs de Mars, the Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler and the Ecole Militaire. Many nights my wife and I would walk through the neighborhood looking at the Eiffel Tower. The room was clean and bright. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They were all fluent in English. They actually managed to book us on a van to the airport in the middle of a general transit strike! The lobby was charming and has large windows looking on to a charming side street. The breakfast room is an old cellar with arched ceilings. It was such a great and welcoming space. Breakfast itself was a nice little spread. There was cheese, bread, cereal, milk, juice, coffee, tea, etc. And the best part? When you sit down the attendant places a warm croissant in front of you. It is delicious and the wife and I have been thinking of those croissants ever since we left. I really only have one quibble with the hotel: I wish there were irons and ironing boards in the room. You can borrow one from the front desk, but that's a little annoying. But that's really a minor complaint. We cannot wait to get back to Paris. And when we do, we will stay at Hotel du Cadran!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the 7th District”
Reviews.Author: Canadian590
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our mid 30's travelling with a baby and just spent three nights at the Hotel du Cadran. It was in a great, quiet location just steps from Rue Cler (cute street with cafes, cheese stores, flower shops etc). We booked a superior room with a king sized bed (two twins pushed together) and thought that the room was clean, contemporary and well put together. The room was small (as are all hotel rooms in Paris) but we managed to fit in a small playpen and two suitcases. The bathroom was equally small but recently renovated and very clean. The lobby is in need of a major update but we've heard that renovations will be occuring in November 2008. Overall, had a great experience at this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hays2427
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for spacious rooms this is not the place for you, and Paris might not be the place to visit. Your in Paris there very few reasons to be in your room your in Paris. This hotel made our visit very enjoyable. The staff was very nice and spoke great English. The location was perfect. Its not on a main street but close enough to get were ever you want to in minutes. There are great shops all around. The Cafe Central is a great place to eat any meal. The staff is very friendly and speak good english. The location alows you to feel as a local (or as close as you can feel).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean room”
Reviews.Author: caroeh
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel the last week of August/2008. Stayed for 5 nights. Booked the hotel in a bundle package with train from London using the Eurostar website. The hotel is located within 5 blocks of Champ de Mars. The Eiffel tower is about 8 to 9 blocks. The nearest metro station is Ecole Militare which is only 3 blocks from the hotel. The staff always nice and helpful, and didn't have any problem communicating in English. Our standard double room was great (room 203), everything looked cleaned and in place. Most 2-3 star hotels in Paris offer really small rooms, so we were not expecting anything big, however the people here have manage to make the most of it. It has a flat screen tv with 20-25 channels (only 2 of them in english). It also has a small desk and night tables on both sides of the bed. All the linen provided was very clean, and our room was done and left spotless on a daily basis. The bathroom, even though is tight, is very clean and has very contemporary decor. Shower has a good pressure. One drawback is that we couldn't manage to keep the water from the shower inside, so every day we left the bathroom floor all wet, but every time on our return from sightseeing, we would find it again all dry and perfectly clean... spotless (literally!!!). The space usage in this hotel is so wise that they have also managed to fit in a mini-fridge through a wall. Our window was facing the street, but we were never bothered by any noise. Can't say anything about breakfast in the hotel as we never tried it. Fortunately, the hotel is just a step away from a couple of restaurants that are open all day, a boulangerie (for fresh bread and pastries), a right across the street there is a mini market where you can find everything (even fresh produce). If you want to eat something quick and cheap, I recommend going around the corner. It's a greek restaurant but they also sell great crepes for take away (2 to 5 euros), but beware, if you order to eat in, the price will double!!! All in all, expect a small but very clean and nicely decor room. Will definitely book again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Break”
Reviews.Author: GwenanLiverpool
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely clean and well decorated. We stayed in a twin room which was very small, but this seems to be the norm in Paris. The shower in the bathroom was excellent, the only complaint is that there wasn't any air conditioning in our room. The staff are helpful and speak good English. The Hotel is in a great location, very close the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides. There is a tube station within a couple of minutes walk which is ideal for exploring the rest of the city. We would definitely stay at the Hotel Cadran again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Cadran-Paris Gem”
Reviews.Author: LSChampagne
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Cadran could not have been better. The location, the room & very nice bathroom and the incredible service we received from the staff was amazing for the price. The staff helped with everything from hard to get restaurant reservations to assisting my nephew with travel plans. The staff was very knowledgeable about the sights in Paris and would call to get information they didn't already know. Laurent was especially helpful. I will definitely return the next time I'm in Paris. (Note: The least expensive rooms are small, but very comfortable and nicely decorated. Two people may want to ask for a slighly larger room.)

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the great reviews!”
Reviews.Author: holidayloverFalkirk
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of all the wonderful reviews on Tripadvisor and was really excited about another visit to Paris. However, on arrival we were told that our room was unavailable (sick child - heard it before, must be unlucky!) and we would have to go to a hotel across the road. We ended up really lucky in the Relais Bosquet with a superior room which was huge (unlike the Cadran) and with free breakfast (which we didn't have in Cadran), and where the service was exemplary. Suspect we were moved because others were prepared to pay more! Not a good practice and extremely annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff & location”
Reviews.Author: RichardinOrmond
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel newly remodeled, very contemporary in design, the beds comfortable, the A/C excellent and the entire property exceptionally clean. The room was a bit small, even when compared to European hotels; however the bathroom was great. The hotel staff is exceptional, eager to help and fluent in English. The staff even helped translate TGV tickets I purchased todetemrine if I could change these. Staff pleasantly handled our last minute request to extend our stay (when they were completely booked) even though it required the juggling of reservations two days in a row and constant checking for cancellations. Finally, when bookings made it impossible to stay longer, the hotel staff located another nice hotel within walking distance, reserved the room and prearranged check in so we did not need to complete a registration form at the second hotel (Hotel Londres Tour Eiffel- also an excellent hotel with charming rooms and an exceptional staff.) I must mention that staff did all the above without any additional inquiry or prompting and kept me regulaly informed. Other requests for directions, taxis and information were handled pleasantly and professionally. The hotel has is excpetionally well located one half block from Rue Cler. Rue Cler is hard to beat. Restaurants (cafes, brasseries, Chinese, Vietnamese, Japanese, Korean, crepes and take away) shops (cheese, produce, meat, fish, wine), landromats, a post office and a super marche are all within an easy 5-10 minute walk, mostly on a street with no traffic. The Eiffel Tower is close by (15-20 minutes) as is the Metro I travel more than 200 nights per year on business and have experienced the exceptional and the absolutely awful. I highly recommend this hotel although the rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for Paris city tour”
Reviews.Author: KevinMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris for 4 days 3 nights, this hotel is perfect for it's location, only 15 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower and 3 mins walk from the underground. Staffs speaks good english and friendly, rooms are super modern and clean, although a little bit to the small size. The surrounding is really nice, supermarket is directly opposite to the hotel and there are cafe and restaurant next door. VERY GOOD OVERALL, highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A little gem close to Rue Cler”
Reviews.Author: KeepItLight
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel du Cadran for four days in mid-July 2008. It is very close to the several attractions (Eiffel Tower, Ecole Militaire, Hotel des Invalides), but tucked far enough away from the touristy madness that can be a turnoff in any large, popular city. The staff were very warm and helpful. They spoke English, so no need to feel intimidated if you speak very little or no French. Wireless internet access was reliable and free, but you'll have to go to an internet cafe if you need to print anything, Rue Cler is just around the corner and filled with cafes and small shops in case you do not want to spend all of your money in expensive restaurants. I did not give a perfect rating for a few minor reasons: -lack of closet space -small room -slow elevator -loud door leading to staircase (if you choose to not use the elevator; you could hear it slam *every* time someone went through it.) Despite these minor "drawbacks," I would definitely stay here again. The price was great, the bed was comfortable, the room was updated and modern, and the hospitality was fabulous. I really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NICandALYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a great location. The tower was less than a 10 minute walk as was the River, yet the hustle of the tourist stampede was a million miles away from the hotel. Immediately outside the Hotel proved to be a great place to soak up the atmosphere of the Paris we wanted to experience, the place where the Parisians kick back and enjoy good food and wine at very reasonable prices. The rooms in the Hotel were immaculate and decorated to a very high and contemporary standard. Ignore some of the photographs that are still lurking around on the web as these show the Hotel before its makeover. The rooms are compact and perhaps better suited to those tourists that are not of a fuller figure. Glass walls, mirrors, air conditioning, limestone tiles, power shower, mood lighting and chic decor make for a sensual stay; with French doors overlooking the relaxed bistro area. Would we recommend this Hotel? Definitely, and we are looking forward to our next stay there. x

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: liannak
Reviews.Content: Beautiful modern rooms and a great location, who could ask for more? The service at the front desk was always helpful and friendly. We had a minor problem with our room, and they went above and beyond to solve the problem, and gave us a bottle of champagne for our "trouble." Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: acydc9
Reviews.Content: Our experience in Paris was greatly enhanced by our stay at the Hotel du Cadran. The rooms are clean and modern. The staff was very courteous, very friendly and very helpful. The location is convenient to all forms of public transit and many of the most popular sights are within walking range. The neighborhood is noted for the wonderful Rue Cler market but it also is home to many fine restaurants and cafe's. When we return to Paris, we will not hesitate to book a room at the Hotel du Cadran .

Reviews.Title: “Stylish rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Savillee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the recommendation of Rick Steves who always gives great advice. The rooms were quite modern and stylish (albeit small). The hotel has recent;y been renovated by a delightfully playful interior designer. The rooms were a bargain for Paris. The best part was the suberb location from which to explore Paris. It is a block away from the Rue de Cler, the subway, and a bakery which sells transcendental pastries. We had a great five day stay, and would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: karn75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel because of its location. Not only was it a perfect location choice, the the service was above and beyond. The receptionist was always very helpful and when there was a problem in our room (minor leak from the ceiling in the bathroom), the hotel staff was extremely attentive and responsive. The rooms are somewhat small, typical of Europe but very modern and clean. There are great restaurants within walking distance and the Rue Cler (open market) is a great experience, expecially in the morning. We will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: snow3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great area of PAris. Not in the middle of a touristy area but a great neighbourhood. The receptionist was very helpful and had excellent ideas for walking etc to various sites. A small but well organised and planned room. Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cesmithsyr
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, should be a higher star rating. The hotel is location only a short walk to the Eiffel Tower, it is in safe area with lot of restaurants and shops. My husband and me stayed over two nights in the hotel. The hotel upgrade us free to the jr. suite, it is has a large room/bathroom for Europe. The staff were great, English spoken and helped us with every need. We forget our train tickets, but the hotel found them and make sure we got them back. I would recommend this hotel to anybody, when we travel back to paris, we will staying here again. To help save money, buy breakfood at the local stores and buy metro day pass, to reduce the walking you have to do. Great Paris activity, take some bread, cheese, and couple of bottle of wines and go sit under the eiffel tower at night, a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: johnnyAoregon
Reviews.Content: Booked on Venere.com. This hotel was an outstanding find. Right off the Rue Cler, close to Metro Station, walk to Eiffel Tower. Modern, quiet and a very helpful and cordial staff. Small room, but very modern and tastefully decorated. I heartily recommend the du Cadran to anyone wanting to stay in the 7th A.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place And Value For Money, Greece”
Reviews.Author: DimAthens
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to metro station, is not noisy, it was very clean, near rue du cler (a very beautiful street). room was not spacious but it was not a problem. Rooms are renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rickyrickett
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for two nights early in June. This was our first trip to Paris, and we went to do nothing but sightseeing. We therefore wanted a nice hotel in a central location for a decent price. The Hotel du Cadran is exactly this! It is a simple little hotel in a fantastic location. 10 min walk to the Eiffel Tower, and a walkable distance to the Louvre/Musee d'Orsay and Arc de Triomphe. However, it was a bit chilly when we were there so we relied on the Metro (station is 3 mins walk) which is very quick and cheap. The Hotel is located next to a lovely little market street with some great market shops, a bakery and cheese shop nearby and some great restaurants (breakfast at La Petit Cler was fantastic). It was also in the process of being renovated (mostly done I think) most of the work seemed to be downstairs when we were there, so it did not bother us. Plus, this means the room was newly decorated, which was nice, and the bathroom excellent and modern. The rooms are small, and the bathroom will only fit one at a time, but this didn't bother us over two nights. Staff were very helpful and all spoke good English (though a few French courtesies go a long way, especially in restaurants. Definitely would stay again. On a side note, check out the Buddha Bar near the bottom of the Champ d'Elysees (Louvre end) - exceptional food.

Reviews.Title: “Modern conveniences and very comfortable beds! Great deal for Paris.”
Reviews.Author: K_and_J_858
Reviews.Content: Clean, contemporary and really comfortable bed! I've give the mattress a sleep number of 80 - 90, great for bad backs! They are in the process of remodeling so we did have a lot of construction noise during our stay, but we were mostly gone or so tired when we were in the room that we slept through it. The rooms are tight by American standards, but fairly generous based on other hotel reviews I've seen on this site. The front desk staff were very helpful and spoke very good English. They let us leave our luggage til check in time, since we arrived early in the morning. The hotel provides a very generous breakfast consisting of coffee and espresso drinks (cafe au lait, cafe creme, cappuccino, espresso, etc), tea, three kinds of juice, cereals, fruit, yogurt, cold cuts, three types of cheese, croissants, baguettes, butter, fresh jams, nutella. Everything was delicious. This easily saved us $30-$45 a day for an equivalent breakfast for two at a cafe. They have internet access in the lobby (one computer) for 3 euros/half hour (I think). We paid 185 euros a night for the room and breakfast, not a bad deal for Paris. The Rue Cler neighborhood (7th arrondisement) is beautiful and very quiet at night. If you're looking for nightlife hot spots this is not it, but the advantage is peace and quiet after 11:00 p.m. This neighborhood is known for its daily street market - fruits, prepared foods, bakeries. You are close to a post office, the Metro (less than 5 minute walk), 15-20 minute walk to Eiffel Tower. There are two supermarches in the immediate area (like a big convenience store - groceries and some toiletries). I would recommend the Cafe du Marche for dinner. This was a Rick Steves recommendation and he was right on the money. Less expensive than other cafes in the area, and better food. The chicken is to die for. Great house wines for cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Immerse yourslef like a Parisian in this terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elsirt
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at Hotel Du Cadran. The room was newly renovated and, although small, made excellent use of available space, and was surprisingly uncluttered, even with multiple travel suitcases. It was very smartly designed, with a flat screen television, sophisticated multi-port lighting system, and contemporary bathroom. The location was absolutely perfect. We walked to most major tourist sites and museums, and when our feet failed us, the L'Ecole Militaire Metro stop was 3 minutes away. The shops and eateries on Rue Cler supplied the most delicious, cost-effective breakfasts every day. Bread, cheese, wine and fruit were all right outside the door. We highly recommend this hotel to future travelers.

Reviews.Title: “good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vegastica
Reviews.Content: good Hotel half way between Invalides and Eiffel Tower. Newly renovated room, very slick , very high tech looking. Room are average size for Paris and within this price range.Bedding may be a little to firm for my testy hipbone but the accomodations are a sure bet if you are staying in Paris. You are steps away from a magnificient bakery, traiteur, and cheese store. Rooms are well equiped an the king size bed very appreciated.The breakfast is served downstair in a very lovely vaulted old stone room and for the price of $13 Euro you get a good complete breakfast with all the coffee refills you want. (the dollar is very low but the value is still there because a cafe creme in Paris costs 4 euro on average and no refills), so take advantage of breakfast and then start wondering in the world ,and explore the gay Paris. Nothing to do with the Hotel but parisians on the left bank are a little snoody and stuffy. Don't let that offend you. It is the nature of the beast. Will stay in this Hotel again and will recommend

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: afabrega11
Reviews.Content: We have just spent the first five nights of our honeymoon in the Hotel Du Cadran. The hotel is currently being remodeled, but they have finished with the rooms portions. While working in the lobby you do have to pass through a bit of a mess and it was unfortunate that this was not communicated to us prior to arrival. Still, our stay wasmagnificent. The brand new renovated rooms are modern, the beds are large and comfortable, the bathrooms are impecable and have all the amenities for a very comfortable stay. We had an incident where the elecricity blew out due to an unknown circumstance and damaged my husband's electric shaving machine as well as our cell phone charger. The owner insisted that it was our things that blew up a feuse (is that how one writes it?) and she was not responsible. Still, she gave us another cell phone charger that does not even work. We had to go and spend 60 Euro to replace what was broken. Proxemity to everything, the street perpendicular to rue du champs de mars where the hotel is situated is gorgeous. full of restaurants and markets and flowers. true parisian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience overall”
Reviews.Author: bubuLondon
Reviews.Content: GOOD: - Excellent location for sightseeing. The Eiffel Tower is just a short walk away, a choice of Metro stations nearby, and you can also explore the Paris sights as you walk the Seine. - Excellent location for food. There are tons of cafes and restaurants just around the corner along Rue Cler. Despite the activity, its not a noisy area. - Clean surroundings. The user pictures here give an accurate representation of the room conditions. Decor was tasteful and felt pretty French to me. One of the users got a flat screen TV -- I didn't, and the BBC channel was not working so I had no English media whatsoever. - Room size. I had a corner room and it didn't feel small at all. Had about 2 feet between the wall and the bed, so there was space to move and stand by the windows. - Nice staff. Very enthusiastic and friendly. See below. NOT SO GOOD: - Thin doors, I could feel my neighbour closing his door. - Construction work. Did not bother us much, but the builders use the same lift. I do not remember too much noise, except for the occassional drilling on one morning. But why spend your visit to Paris in the room anyway?! Like I said, overall it was a good experience. The staff were also very helpful, I emailed them to confirm my booking and they responded quickly to my query. While we were staying there, we asked for their recommendation on a good place for French onion soup. They suggested the cafe across the road, which unfortunately was closed since it was a Sunday (do try it out and let me know!). Anyway, they called up another restaurant nearby and booked us a table straight away. I am not sure if they honestly booked a good restaurant or if they received some sort of 'referral commission' from that, but I was touched by their gesture. And, the meal was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Construction going on at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicagolandgirl
Reviews.Content: HI We just stayed here 2 weeks ago. Great location. A few blocks from the Metro. Around the corner from the Rue Cler Market. In walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. Staff spoke English and were very willing to assist in anyway they could. We had a double room. Very small. Tiny amount of space between wall and foot of the bed and wall and one side of the bed. Room was clean., We had a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower. There is no shower curtain, only a small 1/4 glass wall. Bathroom was modern. Just beware they are doing construction from early morning on some of the floors. It was very loud mid day when we stopped back at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sethina
Reviews.Content: We loved the Du Cadran! The staff were simply excellent and extremely helpful. The price was right for such a great location!! The rooms were small, as are most in Paris, but well designed, very clean , and newly renovated on the floor we stayed The staff actually upgraded us to the newer rooms just because they had one available. The lobby was quaint and the surrounding shops were lovely with a bakery and cheese shop on the same street. We were just a few minutes from the Eiffel Tower. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again in the future. C'est Magnifique!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Surprise”
Reviews.Author: tevetv
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! This hotel is in a fantastic area of Paris, close to everything, and the open air market is less than a minute walk. Mornings start with fresh from the oven pastries, wonderful coffee, and a market where you can order a custom crepe, any fresh fruit, or sit down at a number of restuarants. Two grocery stores are available and the evening cafes are incredible with good food at good prices. the neighborhood is very well kept. The hotel was the best surprise of all. Yes, they are under renovation, a soft well-planned renovation. The renovated rooms rival any boutique hotel. The rooms are small when to compared to our American standards, but the design is incredible. Crisp, extremely clean, and equipped with all of the gadgets to make you realize that thought for comfort was certainly the number one consideration. The rooms were elegant and artistic, this may be one of the best kept secrets. Staff was friendly, and the manager Carol was exceptional in her commitment to customer satisfaction. We were on our Honeymoon on this trip and the Hotel Du Cadran, was one of the experiences that made our stay remarkable. Being a seasoned traveler I do not have a single hesitation in recommending this hotel and would be the first choice on our return.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it !”
Reviews.Author: STOCHOLM
Reviews.Content: First, I would like to disagree with the comment below that I find unjustified and instead congratulate the whole staff for a lovely stay. Merci. I booked at le Cadran after reading all the good reviews of the previous guests and was looking to visit. Everything was as expected : Le Cadran is a charming little hotel with an excellent location and being so close to the Invalides and the Eiffel Tower, both walking distance from the hotel as well as the lovely Rue Cler with its village atmosphere and its mouth-watering shops was great ! The reception staff was fluent in English, polite and always eager to help with all my queries. The Buffet Breakfast was served into the lovely cellar vault downstairs and I found it very good. Regarding the room, it was pristine, comfortable and of normal size by European standard. I must say that these renovated rooms pictured on some of the reviews look state of the art. I will recommend Le Cadran to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lot of Money For What You Get”
Reviews.Author: Jonnym_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over New Years. The hotel is in a great location, 10 mins walk to the base of the eiffel tower and right next to the Rue Cler which has plenty of cafes, but all quite pricey. The breakfast area in the hotel is great and the breakfast offers cereals and hot drinks. Apparently you can ask for bacon and eggs but never had the confidence to ask, plus there was nothing in the breakfast room saying you could ask for them. After checking tripadvisor for this hotel today, there are pictures of a room at the hotel, which are far better than the room i had, my room was very basic with old furniture, bedlight hanging off the wall and small tv. The pictures on tripadvisor of a recent guests stay include big flat screen tv, newer furniture and a throw on the bed. For Â£130 a night, i was very dissapointed especially as i payed extra for an executive room. The hallway leading to the room was awful aswel. The lady at front desk was not the friendliest lady ever, you have to say hi etc and we didnt get a bye when we left. So... that lets the hotel down aswel. The way the hotel looks from the outside is also dissapointing, with shutters falling off and looking worn. Need a paint!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Comfortable Hotel, Deserved of its many good reviews”
Reviews.Author: holstrav
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel, tucked away on a side street in Paris. Small but perfectly formed, its an ideal option for touring the 7th district as well as the rest of paris obvioulsy. We found it very central and easy to get to and from. We stayed over New Year, initiall chose it to be near the Eiffel Tower, wrongly assuming that the new year celebrations woudl perhaps be focused on it. I was wrong and there are only fireworks there on Bastille Day apparently. The Champs Elysees is the place to cram yourself into, althought we chose Disneyland Paris to see the fireworks and they were spectacular. Back to the hotel. The staff are excellent, most helpful with any question or request. We had a room on the 5th floor, which has been refurbed recently (the entire floor). I guess they are working their way throguh all the rooms and the public areas. Our room was compact but not to the point that it was an issue. Comfortable Bed, Stylish yet minimalist decor. Flat screen TV on wall at the end of the bed. Small Shower room but with wonderful fittings and whilst small did exactly what is should for a shower room. Toiletries and towels were all good quality. Little mini bar cleverly tucked behind the door. Very clever use of space in a smaller room. We had breakfast which was very pleasant and not bad value at â‚¬10. Yes the lobby furniture is a bit dated but still comfortable and im sure its only a matter of time before its replaced in line with the rest of the refurb. The surrounding streets are allive with a mixture of cafes, bars, shops and restaurant as well as residences. A little gem in the heart of paris and i heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, but pretty basic”
Reviews.Author: suchaprincess
Reviews.Content: This past November, my husband and I traveled to Paris for Thanksgiving week with five (5) other couples from around the US. This group of friends has spent Thanksgiving in Paris every year for the last 8-9 years, but this was our first trip to Paris. We researched the Hotel du Cadran on-line, but made our final decision based on the reviews on TripAdvisor. This sight never steers us wrong. The hotel was in a perfect location...literally 20 steps from Rue Cler, a perfect little street filled with bakeries, bistros, cafes, pastry shops, grocery stores, flower/ fruit/ cheese vendors. It couldn't have been a better location. The metro station was only one block away, but we also happened to be there during the week the RER (metro/subway) transportation workers were on strike. It could have been a sticky situation, but we bought 3 day passes on the Open Tour busses (bus stop was only 2 blocks away from the du Cadran) and they took us every where we needed to go. We were able to hop on & off as we desired and we saw everything we wanted to see perched high atop an open air bus.... it was great! The weather was cool, bright & sunny. The hotel itself was clean and tidy. The clerks were gracious, pleasant and helpful.... and spoke English. The hotel lobby, although smallish, was probably very lovely at one time. However after years of being in a sunny window, the leather sofas & chairs need some TLC. The continental breakfast was more than adequate with cereal, yogurt, baguettes, a lovely latte machine, jams, nutelle, ham, cheese and delicious croissants. When booking your room, try to negotiate the cost of the breakfast in with your room. Otherwise, I think it is about 10-15eu per person. With us traveling during a slower time of year and that we had 6 couples, they were willing to bargain with us to get the business...and it worked. It was nice to not have to find a place to eat breakfast before you even start your day. The rooms were immaculate but very, very small. However, we understood that the rooms would be tight, so it had no negative impact on us. The tv was only about a 13" with one or two news channels in English. But not to worry, you'll be so tired from walking and sightseeing... you'll be asleep before you have time to watch tv. The beds were comfortable enough, but low, low to the floor. The pillows were goosedown and very nice, plus the bed had a crisp, snow-white duvet cover that is changed with every guest. I loved that.
