I hate having blankets that someone else has slept under up near my face. The duvet system alleviates that problem. Just basic amenities in the room. The bathroom was standard size... all white marble and squeeky clean. The nicest part of our stay at the Hotel du Cadran was their hospitality. Since there were 12 of us, we totally filled their 'lobby'. So in the evening they graciously allowed us access to their 'breakfast' room ... providing we cleaned up our mess and put it back the way we found it. Each evening we would all convene there to drink wine, eat cheese, pate and bread and discuss where we went and what we did all day. It was a beautiful end to each day. It was one of my favorite memories of the trip. I would definitely stay at the Hotel du Cadran again. It served us well, was immaculately clean and centrally located, plus the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: McTravel55
Reviews.Content: Great stay at a very reasonable price. The hotel is clean with excellent friendly service. The front desk personnel were always polite and willing to help or answer our questions. The bathroom is as good as most hotels in the United States. The room is much smaller however, that is normal in Europe. The bed was fine. One of the best features of the room is the very large old French window which fully opens to the street below. The lobby had a small bar and lounge which looked nice but we did not stop there. The hotelâ€™s best attribute is that it is located in the heart of Paris. It is approximately a five minute walk to the Eiffel Tower through a very safe and nice section of the city. But better than the Tower is the numerous cafÃ©â€™s within a 2 minute or less walk from your room. There are literally more than a dozen great places to eat and drink as well as fantastic bakeries within a one block radius. Directly across the street from the hotel is a very nice small grocery store which sells almost any thing you may want. The Louvre and Notre Dame are also less than a five minute drive. All in all, my wife and I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent (but not great) Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rlsnyc04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Cadran this past weekend, and were very thankful for its location near the Eiffel Tower and shopping areas because the Paris transit strikes cut off any metro access. The room was very clean (though tiny! and a bit sparse) and staff friendly. However, some things to note that I felt were missed since so many others gave glowing reviews and rated a 5: 1) Definitely cannot see the Eiffel Tower. In fairness, we did have a low room, but I would doubt any room could see the tower...or maybe just a piece of it. It is very close walking distance, but several streets away so many buildings between. I wasn't expecting to see it, but just don't be fooled by the name. 2) LOTS of construction noise. They are apparently renovating the rooms which is a good thing, but we were awoken on Saturday morning around 8am to constant loud noise (definitely on our floor). 3) Public areas very dated. The English guidebooks in the lounge area definitely helped, but compared to other 3 star hotels we walked by, this lounge area was definitely in need of updating. All in all, it was a fine stay for a weekend but I would not likely go back - I know Paris is expensive but this was still over 140 EUR a night and I think we could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the Hotel du Cadran”
Reviews.Author: TammyWendell
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Hotel Du Cadran in July of 2007. We had booked two interconnecting rooms, as we were a family of four travelling together. Upon checking in, the interconnecting rooms weren't available, but we were across the hall from one another. The desk staff was extremely apologetic, and upon arriving in our rooms we found a note apologizing along with bon-bons for the kids and a bottle of champagne for us! Breakfast every morning was wonderful. The croissants are unbelievable. Our rate also included museum passes which was huge given the crowds in July. I would stay at this hotel again if going back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: voyageurSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Hotel du Cadran. The hotel is in a great location around the corner from an open market. The staff was wonderful! They went out of there way to make sure our first trip to Paris was a memorable experience. We would book this hotel again our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: Paul-and-Mel2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Du Cadran in October 2007 for 3 nights and found it to be charming. First impressions were good. The lobby was lovely and very clean and the lady behind reception was very nice and cheerful (as were all of the staff). Check-in was simple and hassle free. We read on here that the rooms were small and it was. However, it was more than adequate and kept very clean and tidy for all 4 days. The bathroom was an excellent size and had everything required. We particularly liked the breakfast room in the cellar (don't worry, it has been renovated!) It had a chilled out atmosphere and the food was excellent. It made a refreshing change from the scrum at the Disney hotel for the previous 2 days. Location was brilliant. Handily placed for The Eiffel Tower and a nice walkable distance from the Arc d'Triomphe/Champs Elysee. Overall we had a fantastic holiday and would highly recommend Paris and the Du Cadran to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: funaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel! The staff was very friendly and informative. The Eiffel Tour was with in walking distant. The room was always kept clean by housekeeping, the area was safe, and their was a supermarket right in front of the hotel. We also liked the fact that their were a lot of resturants around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Would easily stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff3
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, small rooms but decent sized bathrooms. Kept clean. Good location. Reasonable price. Very helpful and friendly front desk. Would easily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NutmegUnionville_Ct_
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel du Cadran was always so pleasant and helpful ,from making dinner reservations to hiring a car to meet us at the airport. The room was small but newly remodeled, very clean and we even had a view of the Eiffel Tower. The location near Rue Cler is perfect and the metro stop is just two blocks away. Our stay in Paris was wonderful and the hotel and it's kind staff was a bonus. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in a small neighborhood hotel, in a safe and charming area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; extremely pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: bridgewater99
Reviews.Content: This pleasant hotel is in a great location- safe, easy to walk to sites, close to restaurants and shops. Just as important, the beds and pillows were very comfortable and our room was quiet and dark at night which made for great sleeping. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was good and convenient. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: DoubleSour
Reviews.Content: Have to say I loved this hotel. The surroundings the people and the food. Rooms small but what can you expect your in Paris. excellent staff and very friendly. The location is superb near the Eiffel tower and there is a convienience store just below across the street . But the best was the bakery just at the corner.. Experience it you'll love it..Bonjour

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BinaryMoon
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in a very good location. We got stuck on the ground floor behind reception with no key (the previous occupants had taken it with them). Room was clean and presentable. As others have mentioned it was a little small, but I don't see this as a negative thing. There were shutters on the windows and being a ground floor room we had to keep the shutters closed to maintain our privacy. This in turn meant we had no natural light coming in. The location is wonderful, the Eiffel Tower is very close, as is a Metro stop - so you can get around easily.

Reviews.Title: “sweet little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynniepie
Reviews.Content: stayed here April 06, hotel staff so sweet, a friend decided to join us and they added a cot, and when they forgot the night we arrived, they gave us a second room that night until morning to move the cot, rooms are small but bath is terrific, the Ru Cler right out the door was a safe area with lots of shops. staff helped out when my friend lost her wallet, made the local calls and we were able to retrieve it! for my sons first trip to paris it was an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Hotel but Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SouthernBelle50
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms for 5 days in May. When we arrived, I was very disappointed in the hotel lobby. The leather sofas were cracked and worn and the whole room looked disshelved. All 3 bedrooms were extremely small, which we expected, but my husband and I could not even pass each other in the room. The furniture was very worn, the beds were practically on the floor, and overall, no ambiance. However, the bathrooms were modern and very nice. The only reason to stay at this hotel is the service and location. All the staff was very helpful. The front desk was attentive and very nice to help with questions, reservations, calling taxis, etc. One day after sight-seeing all day, I came back to my room to find my bottle of white wine on ice by the head housekeeper. What a nice surprise! The neighborhood, Rue Cler, is absolutely fabulous. My husband and I both agreed that when we return to Paris, we will definitely stay in the Rue Cler again but probably choose a different hotel. The hotel is in the midst of renovation and they had a photograph of what the renovated rooms will look like and they will be "ultra modern" which is not in keeping with this old hotel. So, for that reason, we will look at other hotels in the area next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good central Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: thenick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel du Cadran for three nights in mid July. Found this little hotel to be a good base for exploring central Paris, being close to a lot of the sights and with good cafes and restaurants in the surrounding streets. I originally booked a twin room but was able to change on arrival to a double which looked out over the main street. Room was very clean and comfortable. During my stay there was some top floor refurbishment work going on during the day time so if you are planning a stay soon and intending on sleeping late, you might want to check if this is now complete. Overall found the hotel to be reasonable value for money (~ â‚¬100 per night) and given its proximity to many of the sights provided a good location for checking out central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay....”
Reviews.Author: Cougwife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Contacted the hotel directly and was able to get free breakfast thrown into our package (normally 10 euros per person). The breakfast was just fine w/ us - bread, cheese, croissants, cereal, etc. We were very worried because we had heard the hotel would be undergoing renovations at this time, but all that was going on was the top floor was being painted. Room was an ok size - desk, king bed, closet and enough room to put our 2 suitcases. Pros: Quiet, friendly staff, decent breakfast, good proximity to Eiffel Tower and short walk to Ecole Militaire metro stop Cons: Leaky a/c & leaky sink (they did fix these problems), toilet was running (even after they though they fixed it), bed was hard, only English TV was CNN international (not that we expected any more than that), not really any night time entertainment in this area

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel very close to the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: swiss787
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a nice residential area about 500 meters from the Eiffel Tower. The metro stop Ã‰cole Militaire is right around the corner. The hotel itself while clean is in need remodeling, the room itself was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jerseytraveler19
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this small but charming boutique hotel and were very satisfied with all the amenities. Our room was small but very clean and neat. The bathroom had plenty of hot water in the shower with good water pressure. The beds were comfortable - not luxurious. The staff cleaned and freshened up the room daily. The breakfast buffet in the lower level had plenty of choices and was well stocked. It was open early and late enough to accomodate eating any time of the morning. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful - from making a pot of tea for us in the afternoon, to resolving a booking problem with a tour we had scheduled, to suggesting sights to visit during our stay. They all spoke English very well. The location was perfect - 2 blocks to the Eiffel Tower, a few steps to the lively and well known market street, Rue Du Clef, with restaurants, a patisserie, an ATM machine, and other charming shops. The metro stop was a 5 minute walk away. The neighborhood was quiet and there were no disturbances at night even with the windows open. There is also access to the internet in the lobby. I would visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pickeringcouple
Reviews.Content: A nice 2** hotel in a great location. Upon arrival there was no water in the hotel and the elevator wasn't working due to repairs That inconvenience only lasted a few hours. We were given room 504 whcih is a very small corner room. The air conditioner wasn't working iand the room was extremely hot. We requested to be moved after the 1st night as the room was 27C. We were moved to a room on the 2nd floor that had air conditioning that worked. Once moved no further problems. Staff were friendly and assisted re transportaion, dinner reservations. Rooms were clean and the bed reasonably comfortable. Would recommend, but try not to stay on the 5th floor where the rooms are smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: mavicat
Reviews.Content: I can only add what others have said regarding this small hotel. We just returned from a four night stay. First of all, the staff is etremely nice and polite and all requests are seriously considered and met. The rooms are small but then that's Europe, especially Paris where space is at a premium. Yes, the rooms are a bit worn but then there is a renovation in the works t according to the photo in the lobby and the room we saw(courtesy of housekeeping) it will be ultra contemporary (alas paris seems to be going that way). however, that's the slightly downside. The location is perfect, the rooms are clean with nice amenties and our room had a view of the top half of the Eifel Tower. For pricey Paris, thought we got an ok deal with breakfast (which is very good) and a two day museum pass. It is a slight walk from the metro but then don't even consider Paris if you don't like to walk. There are at least four excellent restaurants within a two minute walk from the front door of the hotel (We heartedly recommend the La Petite Nicose) All in all, a nice stay. Do have to add with a bit of a chuckle because it always seems to be the case, the rooms are not exaclt as they appear on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: eijoiner
Reviews.Content: The hotel was brilliant, lovely room, staff were really helpful. They made my boyfriends birthday a great weekend. Our room was over looking the eiffel tower. Breakfast was great. Strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wakka
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Cadran for a week in early March 2007. I have to say I was very impressed. The location was excellent. The hotel is situated within a two minute walk to Lâ€™ Ecole Militaire metro station. You could walk to the Champ de Mars and get a great view of the Eiffel Tower within ten minutes. We would often walk to see it lit up at night. It was so good having this icon so close. In fact all the great sights were within about a 30 minute walk of the hotel. However my favourite and lasting memory was the Cadranâ€™s proximity to Rue Cler. The fresh food markets on Rue Cler were so fantastic. We sampled everything from crepes, to cheeses, wine and bread. I felt we had the ultimate Parisian experience right at our doorstep. There were also a number of nice bars and restaurants around the area. The staff at the Cadran were friendly (with one exception) and knowledgeable. The rooms were not enormous but I thought were good quality for the price. Unfortunately our bath plug was faulty so we couldnâ€™t have baths but that is a minor complaint. Another minor problem was the air-conditioning. The room was quite hot at night and the air-conditioning didnâ€™t seem to work. The stay was also somewhat marred by the arrogance of one staff member, a grumpy old man, who was on reception the night before we left. We had paid to use the internet for half an hour, however 5 minutes into our session the hotel computer crashed. When I went and told the grumpy old man what had happened his response was: â€œSo what do you want me to do about itâ€�? I had never experienced such rudeness our entire stay and found his attitude very frustrating. We explained that we needed him to re-enter the password into the computer. However he was still too lazy to do his job, so he gave me the password, â€œCADRANâ€�. So if you do stay here give that password a try for some free internet time. Also on our final day, our stay was further marred by the airport pick up service that the hotel had arranged. Our car failed to turn up. This probably was not the fault of the hotel, but I remain slightly sceptical. But enough of the negatives. In all it was a very positive experience staying here. I loved it and would definitely stay again despite the minor problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a word of warning...”
Reviews.Author: Pat_Pending
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights from 26th April 2007 and can only add to the glowing reviews with regards to the quality and location of the hotel but with the following proviso, of note particularly for visitors thinking of staying here before May next year. The amenities state that the hotel has air conditioning but does NOTsay that it is only on during the summer months - May to September! During our stay the room temperature never dropped below 28C but staff were adamant that it could not be turned on before the usual date as it was controlled via an external source. As there was a heatwave on we found the nights particularly uncomfortable and may not have stayed here had we known about the restrictions. Otherwise we would really recommend this place and would stay here again (between May and September!).

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: NDRT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel du cadran between the 20 April- 23rd April for a long weekend. We had a lovely time in Paris visting all the famous landmarks. The hotel was above average for a 3 star hotel because everything was provided within the hotel. The hotel was within walking distance to the metro and local buses. Bus tickets and metro tickets are really cheap I would advice you to boy a carnet of 10 tickets. All famous landmarks are in close proximity to the hotel which is an advantage. It is situated within a quite area. There are plenty of places to choose to eat as well as a local market on your door step. The staff were really welcoming. The room was compact room and could have been a little bit larger. A large range of food is provided at breakfast for those staying bed and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Parisien Experience!”
Reviews.Author: JodieBath
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a mid-week stay at the Hotel Du Cadran in Paris. This hotel was absolutely fantastic. There was nothing particularly fancy about it, however the location was ABSOLUTELY SUPERB, the room was fantastically clean, the staff were so very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The room was of a relatively small size, but then they generally are in Paris. The mini-bar was also very reasonably priced. All of the major sights were within easy reach, the Eiffel Tower only a 7-8 minute walk from the hotel. Everywhere else is also within reasonable walking distance, however the Metro system is invaluable in getting around the city easily and cheaply. A ticket costs about 1Euro 80 and is valid on any line for 2 hours after purchase. I would strongly recommend the Lonely Planet guide to Paris as this has very easy to decipher Metro maps as well as excellent general info on the city. We had an absolutely fabulous time in Paris and it is a trip that I will remember fondly.

Reviews.Title: “Springtime In Paris”
Reviews.Author: sarah3b
Reviews.Content: Spending Easter in Paris in itself is a wonderful experience. Adding to the Parisian delights is this delicate hotel, 10 mins walk from the Eiffel tower (which follows you wherever you go) and situated within easy reach of the metro meaning you have access to all areas! The hotel staff were fabulous, recommending places to go and are on hand 24/7. The rooms, although small were immaculate with clean linen each day and a fully stocked, extremely reasonable mini-bar. They supply maps, reading material and a corkscrew if you get stuck! There is a fabulous patisserie at the end of the street and the bar across the way serves ice cold, very welcome mojitos which at the end of day spent walking around the streets of Paris come highly recommended. C'est tres formidable with the want to return - soon!

Reviews.Title: “no frills but good value”
Reviews.Author: duff_gnash
Reviews.Content: A no frills hotel, but good location for all the sight seeing spots of Paris. The staff are very friendly and the hotel is clean and tidy. The room we had was small. Local cafes and shops on your door step. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent value”
Reviews.Author: RFuk
Reviews.Content: We were a party of four and have just returned from a short midweek break to Paris . We all agreed the hotel was good value, clean, well appointed and friendly with a good breakfast. It is well situated in a reasonably quiet area a short walk from the Tower and within easy reach of the Bus, Metro and water Taxi's if required. A choice of good resturants and food shops are close by. We would not hesitate to use again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: StevenB33
Reviews.Content: Just go back from Hotel Du Cadran. It's very basic but clean. However, the rooms are small but so are most in France. The bed was hard as a rock and very low to the floor. Very uncomfortable. TV was on a 13" but if you don't speak French, CNN and the BBC are your only English choices anyway. The people are very nice. The hotel offers 2 day Musuem passes includdes Versailles. Well worth it. The location is wonderful. Very central to everything and a full selection of markets, cafes, pasterries, etc. They claim they are updating there rooms soon. If so, this is a great place and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Mauigal2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Cadran is a great place for a long weekend holiday with husband or girlfriend. We especially liked being so close to the Metro, the wonderful markets on Rue de Cler (great olive oi store!) and the restaurants and bistros close by when we didn't want to venture out any further. Hotel is very easy to get to by Metro from Gard du Nord. The hotel has a very friendly staff who are eager to help you, breakfast fills you up, and it's a great place for women to stay who are traveling alone. I went with a girlfriend this time but my husband will come with me the next time so it's nice for couples, too. If you're not looking for a fancy place but clean (and a great shower!), close to restaurants and transportation, this is the place. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Cadran, Paris”
Reviews.Author: G-Carlin
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location. The rooms were not large but clean and comfortable, we were out most of the time anyway. I noticed at reception that the rooms were due for renovation, the bedrooms were a little tired and out of date. The bathroom was very clean and there was lots of hot water and a great shower. We had asked for a room with a view and were a little disappointed not to get this. We were given Room 407 (superior, king size) which was at the back of the hotel with no view but it was very quiet- which was good. There was lots of choice at breakfast tea, coffee, fruit juice, various cereals, youghurt, fruit, jam,cheese and ham. There was also plenty of toast, french bread and of course fresh croissants. Our breakfast was included in the price of our stay. There are a few supermarkets nearby and lots of cafes and restaurants, though we mainly ate at night in the Latin Quarter which had lots of choice, nice food and cheaper menus than elsewhere. The only down side of our visit to Paris was the number of homeless people living rough, especially on the banks of the Seine. There seemed to be people begging at all the tourist spots and we were constantly warned about pick-pockets. Watch out for the "oh, I have just found this gold ring, could you give me money for it if I give it to you". You have been warned, please be very careful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, few steps to the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: stretch8674
Reviews.Content: Fantastic weekend in Paris spent here. The hotel was very easy to locate from the map on website, within five minutes walk of the metro. The staff were all very friendly and welcoming and happy to assist. The room was excellent, clean and well maintained, with a comfy bed. Breakfast room is very unique too. We chose this hotel for it's location and ease for visiting other Paris attractions and it didn't disappoint. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, just friendly service and clean room.”
Reviews.Author: DCJh2007
Reviews.Content: We relied on Trip Advisor to help us pick this small hotel in the 7th eme in Paris. What the hotel lacks in amenities, the friendly service and neighborhood makes sure your trip is top notch. We had a small room, even though it was a superior. This didn't bother us too much as all we needed was a bed. The bathroom was clean, modern and nice. Our window opened up to the courtyard which was also lovely. Pros: First and foremost was the surrounding neighborhood. We simply loved it! The Rue de Cler was the most quaint and friendly we experienced during our entire trip. While there wasn't much nightlife, in every other way it was perfect. Every bakery, shop and restaurant was better than the next one, and we didn't think that would be possible after our first lunch at the Cafe du Marche! The staff of the hotel were very helpful and friendly. I appreciated thier willingness to let me try to speak in French, but thankful that they were happy to speak in English. They even sent postcards for us, which was sooo nice after seeing the lines at the post office. The Cons: The hotel is nothing special inside or out. The rooms are clean, the bed is utilitarian and the services are standard. Our TV was difficult to work and we had to ask for directions to use it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location !”
Reviews.Author: retguyscott
Reviews.Content: just got back from a weekend in paris and had tha best experience,due in no small part from the hotel and staff(especially Sonia).The hotel is a very short stroll to most of the sites of paris.also,as stated from other reviews there is a very quaint street with many shops and cafe's located a stones throw away.Had a great time and lucked out weather wise,highly recommend this hotel because of the service and location,will be going back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: PearlGirl25
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via the Eurostar website for my birthday weekend in Paris after reading the reviews, and was pleased with my experience there. My first preference when choosing a hotel in Paris was location and cleanliness- both of which was perfect! It was in short walking distance from the Eiffel Tower, Louvre, etc. and right near a metro station. The hotel staff was helpful and spoke English back to my broken french and held our bags after check out so that we could walk around the city before we caught the Eurostar back to London. The room/bathroom was small, but I had been warned that Parisian hotels were. The hotel breakfast was fine for what we needed. I am going to book there again for my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for single woman”
Reviews.Author: BijouxfromPasadena
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many little three-star hotels around Paris, and found this one to be the best value due to it's location, cleanliness, helpful staff, and tasteful, well-equipped room. The tea kettle and biscuits are a nice touch. The breakfast room is very charming and they provide a very good continental breakfast. The lift wasn't working for half of my stay, but they assured me it was being fixed once and for all. They did carry my suitcase down the stairs when I left without any grumbling. I like the location for easy access to a couple of good cafe's and grocery shops. When I traveling solo, I don't like to be out much after dark, but here you can easily eat a nice dinner a few steps from the hotel or buy food items while you're out during the day for a bed picnic. Rue Cler nearby is a walking street full of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Do not hesitate to patronize this wonderful establishment!”
Reviews.Author: zyllom
Reviews.Content: My entire family stayed at the Hotel du Cadran for New Year's and we could not have been happier with the accomodations or the personal and professional service of the staff. The front desk attendants, in particular, were exceptionally helpful, patient, and kind. The breakfast was delicious and situated in a lovely and ambient dining location. The location of the hotel was fabulous, too . . . near the Eiffel Tower and close to many delicious restaurants, markets, and cafes. The rooms were beautiful, nicely appointed, and more than adequately sized. All together, a wonderful trip; do not hesitate to patronize this exceptional establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Felt at home at du Cadran”
Reviews.Author: Luicri
Reviews.Content: Personnel makes the difference... Great value for the price (was planning to stay there again in 2007 but I see they have increased the price). Small but nice rooms (what else is new in Paris?).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location/staff”
Reviews.Author: English_Setter
Reviews.Content: We've been to France/Europe many times in the past 10 years, and this was one of the best 'in-city' hotels for the price. Not luxury - but very clean and extremely well placed near the market. Easy walk to Metro, numerous nice restaurants and between two parks. The staff was fantastic, particularly when attempting to return a rental car at rush hour. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitsey
Reviews.Content: nice clean hotel, five minutes walk to the Eiffel tower plenty of restauants within five minutes all very clean and friendly staff. I would recommend this hotel. A&R

Reviews.Title: “perfect for first time travelers”
Reviews.Author: katieksalazar
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had never been overseas and we had no idea where to stay in Paris. We searched many websites and decided on the Hotel Du Cadran.I t was awesome!! The staff was very helpfull, the metro was close and it was a great location overall. I would recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely people/Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarajgd
Reviews.Content: Due to a glitch in our travel plans, we had an extra night in Paris. (How bad could that be??) We were fortunate that the hotel had a room available and found it to be lovely and convenient. The people speak excellent English (and don't mind doing so); the hotel was lovely and our room was more than adequate (we did like having the tea kettle). Breakfast is served in a vaulted basement room...plenty of coffee, juice, etc. We would most certainly stay here again and would recommend it to anyone. JGD

Reviews.Title: “Service & helpfulness was INCREDIBLE !!”
Reviews.Author: S_Leach
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect, however upon our arrivel we were pleasantly surprised, to say the least. The young woman at the desk gave us recommendations for places to have dinner - the place she especially liked was a HUGE HIT (La Litote around the corner - more incredible service & wonderfully inventive & fresh dishes) She also booked a night tour of the city for us and called to tell the restaurant we needed to be finished by a certain time to make the tour. Our entire stay the service & friendliness were ABOVE & BEYOND what we have come to expect in the travels and places we have stayed - business and personal. My husband & I would HIGHLY recommend the Hotel du Cadran to anyone. Not only is the service fantastic, but the location is charming ( more residential and fresh food markets on cobbled streets - great little shops I managed to spend $ at as well!!) & central (walking distance to Eiffel Tower) When I wasn't given a receipt at a shop, one of the yound ladies wrote a note for me that explained that I needed a receipt for the purchase to have when I went through customs to go home ... she actually wrote the note and it made it so easy to go back to the shop owner - who couldn't speak english - and have the receipt made up. The staff at Hotel du Cadran made staying in a foreign country easier. They gave directions, held our luggage, wrote notes, booked reservations ...... and were SINCERLY friendly and happy to be of service to us every step of the way !!!! Thank you - we will be back one day Stephanie & Ken Leach Calgary, Alberta Canada

Reviews.Title: “The Main Reason Our Stay in Paris Was So Great”
Reviews.Author: laubo
Reviews.Content: We chose l'Hotel du Cadran because of all the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel lived up to its reviews and more. The staff is wonderful, and they all speak English. I appreciated their responses in French, when I tried my French. It helped improve my pronounciation. The location is superb -- quiet, charming, within easy walking distance of the Eiffel and the Seine, and a ten second walk to Rue Cler. Part of Rue Cler -- the part closest to the hotel -- is a pedestrian area, with restaurants, small shops, including grocery stores, bakeries, pastry shops, and more. We ate all our dinners, had our mid-afternoon crepe, picked up a freshly made sandwich from an outdoor shop on our first day in Paris, and picked up a very good bottle of wine for 1,89 euro -- all on Rue Cler. The nearest metro stop is only a couple of minutes away, but the Rodin museum and Napolean's Tomb were so close, we didn't need the metro to see them. Our room was smaller than a typical American motel room, but certainly fine for the two of us with our three pieces of luggage. It had a king-size bed, its own AC, a bathroom with shower, and a closet. Everything was very clean, and well maintained. We were quite comfortable for the four nights we were in Paris. Most importantly, we slept well, because the hotel, and the surrounding streets were very quiet, all night long. When we go to Paris again, we won't consider any other hotel. Mr. and Mrs. Morris

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: 18golfer
Reviews.Content: Review by: Mr and Mrs Edwards, Essex, England. We stayed there for a 3-night break in early September. It's clean, and the staff are very very helpful. The rooms are not over-large, but for a short break as tourists, what do you want ? Its value for money, and we found it ideal. The local area surrounding the hotel is great - plenty of good value cafes/restaurants/bars within easy walking distance and it's in a quiet area, so sleeping at night is no problem, unlike a lot of Parisian city areas. A metro station is very close by, as is the Open Top sightseeing bus route. The Eiffel Tower is a 10 minute walk away, and we would seriously recommend the Towers' night-time, on the hour, light show. It is dazzling.

Reviews.Title: “What service!”
Reviews.Author: Bobinchicago
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with a wonderful staff. After the first night, we asked to switch to a room with a view (higher floor) and they were happy to accomodate us. I think you have to be on the 4th floor or above to see the top of the Eiffel Tower. Not much, but at least you can see it sparkle every night on the hour. The staff speaks English and were almost too cheery. It's like they're overcompensating for being rude to Americans for decades. Just kidding, they were very nice and fun to talk to. The breakfast was satisfying (croissants, granola, milk, juice) and the basement dining room was amazingly quaint. The cobblestone street around the corner was a sight itself with many small shops with fresh pastries and flowers each day. It has a great crepe stand that is open late at night for when you get the munchies. I ate 3 crepes in one day! The subway is a 5 min walk away, not bad at all. The room itself was average size for Paris (small) and the furnishings were dated but functional. The comforter on the bed seemed like 20 years old. I once saw this 20/20 report on comforters in hotel rooms where they used a ultraviolet light to see all the ... well, I won't go into that here. The room was clean and the bathroom was fantastic -- it had a tub! That is rare in Paris hotels. And don't believe the stories about a tiny elevator, it was fine! It held both of us and all our luggage. We had a wonderful stay and would happily stay there again. Thanks Hotel du Cadran!

Reviews.Title: “great location, but terrible accomodations for people travelling with children”
Reviews.Author: Pachou
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, but I wouldn't recommend it to any couple nor family. Only the loner traveller will find it enjoyable. The rooms were the smallest I had never seen.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Orion777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel August 6-11th. I have got to say that if you cannot afford to stay at George V (where I always get my hair done when in Paris) then this is THE hotel to stay at. We arrived a few hours early and we were checked in immediately as the room was already prepared. The front desk staff is the friendliest and nicest and always ready to help with anything. Karen, Emily, and Sonya (and Gabriel the late night desk clerk) were the greatest! They arranged to have someone pick us up at the airport, made restaurant reservations for us, and gave us info and help for just about anything we needed. They spoke perfect English and I learned so much about how to get around in Paris from them. And you can order Louvre tickets and the Paris hop on/hop off bus tickets right there at the front desk and save a lot of time! Also, the location is great - only a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. My son even did laundry at the lav-o-matic around the corner - the washers cost but the dryers are free. The neighborhood has little markets, restaurants, etc. - VERY convenient. The hotel room was a decent size for a boutique hotel - In other words, we could unpack our suitcases and leave them sit out, not all scrunched up as in other boutique hotels. And the bathroom was just like being in an American hotel - very nice and roomy with lots of amenities, even shoe shine sponges. The air conditioning and everything worked great. The lobby is so nice and cozy and they have books and games sitting out and a little bar - it is just like being in your own den back home. My family will always stay at this hotel now that we have discovered it. It is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Du Cadran!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMimi
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Hotel Du Cadran. the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were extremely clean, especially the bathrooms. The hotel is in an excellent location, walking distance to the Eifel Tower, as well as the metro and good restaurants. I would definitely recommend a stay there, and would go there again on our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Made our Trip Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: blah114
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but VERY VERY clean. The staff at the hotel is charming, nice, and willing to do anything for you. They advise on where to go, when, and by what means. The biggest pluses for this hotel are its small size and its location. Why go to Paris and stay at a "Marriot" when you can stay in a charming "Parisian" hotel like this one at much cheaper price? The hotel is about 4 blocks from the Eiffel Tower and resides in a nearly silent neighborhood at night. The hotel's off a road, that's off another road, right by cafes, and the La Rue Market area. We felt like residents instead of tourists because we stayed in this area. The breakfast each morning was efficient, never overly crowded, and good. Basic bakery bread, croissants, juices, very light and quick for a long day of sight-seeing. The beds were hard, but that's our style. Again, the room was spotless, modern, and quiet. The air conditioning was not very powerful, but sufficed. We were never uncomfortable. The front desk staff responded to every e-mail, question, and arranged for taxis and supplied great advice. The lobby has maps, books for reading, tour offers, along with a nice cozy fireplace. This is not a typical hotel, but rather an inn. Its location is astounding.. we were right by everything. We took the double decker tour bus and used it as a taxi. It was mostly good other than one driver that would stop for no reason for 20-30 minutes. The Louvre has got to be seen to be believed. It was the best trip ever and staying in this small hotel really enhanced our enjoyment... from the friendly staff, to the quiet rooms, we loved the place. Bathroom was SPOTLESS.. everything was so clean, smelled of Mr. Clean even (not annoying, just proof that the room was cleaned meticulously.. Oh yes, having the small safe was great for passport storage.. we also loved leaving the key at the front desk.. it hearkens back to an era where hotels were about service as much as accomodation. The hotel is under new ownership, but hopefully the staff will be kept (Reesa, Emilie, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Wonderful Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our European adventure and for the last 4 nights were at the Hotel du Cadran. The staff was welcoming, helpful and friendly from the very moment we checked into the hotel. The rooms are good - based on European standards for size - and had great water pressure for showers. The rooms were very clean and had individual air conditioning. The location is great, from my perspective, for a number of reasons. 1. Metro stop is just 5 minutes up the street. 2. Quiet neighborhood. 3. Right off Rue Cler - a wonderful street with a pedestrian market. 4. Eiffel Tower is just 10 minutes stroll. 5. Two groceries right across the street. 6. Good bistro and restaurant choices. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a relaxed stay in Paris. Another great recommendation from the staff, the restaurant Leo le Lion - right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel du Cadran on Trip Advisor. It is a charming hotel right off Rue Cler, a open market street with only foot traffic, and a convenient 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. We traveled as a family and had two rooms with their own hallway. We were able to lock the hallway door and keep our room doors open which gave the feel of a suite. One of our rooms was a corner and had two windows to the very Parisian street. Even though it was a tad chilly, I simply had to sleep with the windows open to hear the bustling Paris mornings as deliveries were made to shops along Rue Cler. We were within easy reach of the metro which we took to the French Open. The staff was very accomodating as well.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel du Cadran on three occasions over the last three years. We spent a week in early April 2006 and found the Cadran to be as nice and comfortable as our first stay. It is a small very friendly hotel with excellent staff and location. The staff are very pleasant and go out of their way to be helpful. The location near the Rue Cler, a lively pedestrian only neighborhood of cafes, markets and small shops, is superb. The Cadran is one block from a subway, a 15 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and a convenient walk from numerous other sites of interest. Wireless internet access (wifi) is available for those who have their own laptop computers and there is an available laptop in the lobby for guests to use. The rooms are clean and neat and the prices are quite reasonable. We are already planning our next stay at the Cadran.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & pleasant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mroaks78
Reviews.Content: Hi, I would just like to set the record straight about some of the reviews on this site about the Hotel Du Cadran. My wife and I stayed here in Febuary and found it to be very clean, quite, and very comfortable. It is in a perfect position for exploring Paris, the Eiffel Tower is a very short walk away and the nearest metro station is even closer. During our stay we checked out the Eiffel tower, Arc De Triumph, Louvre, Notre Damme and The Catacoombs (I would highly recommend going there). All in all a very pleasant hotel. The only downside to Paris that I found was the Airport!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: CalGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 8 nights at the Hotel du Cadran. We found the hotel / room to be clean, safe and in a great location. The included breakfast was always fresh, the coffee excellent and the staff very pleasant - coffee refills, etc. Our experience with the front staff was equally pleasant as they were helpful when we needed information and courteous when we did not. The room was of average size, based on our experiences in other European cities - my only complaint was the size of the tv and a poor remote! The elevator was rather slow, but we were on the 1st floor above the lobby, so the stairs became our option except when moving luggage. I would have to say that the convenience to sites, metro, eating areas, and just positive vibes would encourage us to consider and recommend this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, But poor accomodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's location. It is within 5 mins walk of the metro and easy walking distance to all the tourist sites. The staff were very friendly and did their best to help us. However the non-smoking room we asked for smelt of stale tabacco. The rooms were very small but i think this is the norm in Paris. The mattress had sunk in the middle but this was repaired the following day. The bedding and towels were stained and on our last night / morning there was no hot water, so we couldnt have a shower !! It was ok for the 3 nights we were there but would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Customer Service in a Crisis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Du Cadran for three nights in total which were less than adequate! Our room was miniscule, customer service was inconsistent at best - but the icing on the cake was the morning of departure when our mini safe wouldn't open and eventually a 'handy man' came to our room with an angle grinder to retrieve our belongings. During the forty minutes of waiting for our passports and personal items to be rescued I had several extremely unsastisfactory encounters with frontdesk staff who blamed me for my inconvenience! Our belongings were significantly damaged by the workman's attempts to cut the minisafe open which the front desk staff refused to recognise and maintain was not their fault. The morning turned into a horrific fiasco during which not one of the hotel staff took responsibility for what transpired, when we asked to talk to someone in charge we were directed to contact the hotel manager who was conveniently unavailable and who the staff would not contact on our behalf. The whole situation denigrated into a very hostile situation which resulted in our nearly missing our plane. I will never return to this hotel and this experience has marred what should have been an otherwise enjoyable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in one of the worlds great cities.”
Reviews.Author: coverpoint
Reviews.Content: Paris is on most travelers agenda at some time. Most people know what they want to do when they get there, but where to stay? If, like me, you plan to spend most of your time out of your hotel, sampling the delights of the city, then you will probably want a good value hotel, offering clean and comfortable rooms, in a good location. Perhaps additionally, you would like to be in an area well served by restaurants, cafes and bars, with good transport links via the Metro? If so, the Hotel Du Cadran will serve you well. From the moment we called to tag an extra night onto our stay, to the time we reluctantly left to catch the Eurostar to London, the staff of the Hotel Du Cadran were unfailingly polite and pleasant, many of them demonstrating their excellent command of English and making a mockery of my feeble attempts at French. The Hotel is on a quiet street in the 7th arrondisement, though with the bustling Rue Cler around the corner. It is 2 to 3 minutes walk to the Ecole Militaire Metro station and only a minute or so more to see the Eiffel Tower, especially worthwhile at night to see the illuminated tower and it's light show! Perhaps you could do this before wandering into one of the many, many restaurants in this area. One reviewer below left an excellent list of restaurants to visit, of which Chez Pierrot and Le Petit Nicois on Rue Amelie we visited. I can confirm these are very nice places with quality food and wines at high though not ridiculous cost. Also to add to the list would be Le 7eme Sud restaurant, which serves Mediterranean cuisine. When you are on a budget, or just want something a bit more casual, Le CafÃ© Marche, on the corner of Rue Cler and Rue du Champs de Pars, literally 45 seconds from the hotel, is an excellent choice. So, if you are primarily heading to Paris for the city itself and not the luxuries of your hotel, check out the Du Cadran. You will be pleased you did.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Cadran is a small, affordable and very pleasant hotel situated 5 minutes from the Ecole Militiare Metro stop and is literally a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are clean and tidy with all the basic amenities. Ideal if you are staying for a fairly short period of time. But if you are looking for lots of closet space and fluffy bathrobes, you might want to look elsewhere. The staff are extremely helpful and warm (and they speak good English, if your Francais is a bit rusty). There is a pleasant breakfast room with vaulted ceilings in the basement for your early start of croissants and cafÃ©. (tip: we were on the fourth floor and the lift is painfully slow. You might find it quicker walking down the stairs!) The hotel is in a great location for local restaurants, shops and transport. I recommend exploring the restaurants of nearby Rue Amelie (e.g. Chez Pierrot for melt-in-the-mouth Boeuf Bourguignon or Petit Nicois for some excellent, piping hot mussels) and nearby supermarkets can help out with some early evening beers and snacks if you are in need of libation after a dayâ€™s hike round Paris and donâ€™t wish to raid the mini-bar. All in all a very decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed last week in this charming hotel centrally located in the 7th district the staff members were very friendly and the reception staff answered all our questions and came up with good suggestions of nice restaurants in the vicinities for instance : leo le lion in rue duvivier le maupertu in rue la tour maubourg le petit troquet on rue exposition la litote on rue bosquet chez pierrot on rue amelie The hotel is located meters away from rue cler and about 10 minutes away from Eiffel Tower The rooms are not huge but pridtine and very quiet

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but odd”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A nice place to stay. It was just me and my buddies out seeing Paris. It was good for that.

Reviews.Title: “are you sure this is P{aris ?”
Reviews.Author: peteralexander
Reviews.Content: This is truly a 'find', within sight of the Eiffel Tower, walking distance to the Quai D'Orsay, Grand Palais and long walk to the Pompidou Centre. A really warm reception on arrival, helpful in the extreme with taxis and information, clean (smallish) rooms, plenty of hot water and TV and coffee machine that all worked. The hotel was so quiet that we overslept every day ! Breakfast served in the basement was very good, with tasty coffee and well-baked croissants and crunchy bread All made for a perfect long-weekend break. We really couldn't believe that this was Paris - but it was !!! We shall be back.........

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: khkh
Reviews.Content: Years ago, right after the hotel opened, I became aware of it because my neighbor in Sydney, Australia was the owner's daughter. Because my husband travelled frequently to France on expense accounts for business meetings, we were always on the look-out for somewhere we would enjoy as we'd have to pay for it ourselves. This hotel did not disappoint. We were given a corner room on the top floor and I have recommended that room, or the one beneath it, to friends for years now. No one who has ever stayed here has come away disappointed. Near the hotel is a restaurant, Rex in its name I believe, which has big crocks of pate which diners pass from table to table. Be sure and see if it's still there. Madame Cadran and her staff are fabulous and understand and cater to American/Canadian/Australian tastes while providing utterly charming French hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having returned from a second year and second week's visit to Paris at the L'Hotel du Cadran, I suggest this small hotel of charming hospitality located near the Eiffel Tower should be a first choice for travellers who enjoy an ambiance of old world character combined with thoughtful, welcoming service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: racergirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel du Cadran for 4 nights in September and very much enjoyed it. We arrived weary from a long travel day (Canada to London to Paris) and were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel in the quaint rue Cler area. The hotel staff were efficient and helpful and our room on the fourth floor was lovely. With a window that opened wide onto a typical parisien side street. The rooms are small to be sure but not unmanageable. We had large backpacks with a lot of stuff and we managed to make it all work. As well, the bathroom was clean and the shower had good pressure. In my mind the location can't be beat! You are a 5-10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower or Invalides and even closer to the Ecole Militaire Metro station. The neighbourhood is relatively quiet and being so close to the market on rue Cler is a real bonus. The continental breakfast served daily at the hotel was adequate - the croissants were melt in your mouth good - but it could get monotonous over a long period of time. Don't fret though because there is a fabulous boulangerie just up the street. The Hotel du Cadran was the perfect choice for us and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable two night stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are over 60 years old and location and safety are important to us. This hotel met our needs. From Gare l'Est we took the metro, changing once at Opera, to Etole Millitair stop. Then walked for less than 10 minutes to the hotel with backpacks and rolling, carry-on type luggage. The desk was attended by an attractive, young lady who spoke excellent English. Room 307 was supposed to have a king sized bed but was two twin beds pushed together with king sized sheets and blankets. (I would speculate that if you wanted twin beds, the arrangement would be the same only with twin sized sheets and blankets). The two beds were of slightly different heights but this did not bother us. Located less than a 15 minute walk from the Seine river (the river boat tour was 1 1/2 hours long and cost seven Euros per person) and with about the same time/distance to the Eiffel tower, we found the Hotel to be convenient. The room and bath were very clean and a full range of toiletries were present. We paid a total of $409.48 including all taxes, Hotel service fee and a very basic continental breakfast. If breakfast had not been included we would have eaten elsewhere. Just around the corner from the Hotel is the Rue Clair which is a pedestrian only street with a multitude of shops with cheeses, meats, flowers, etc. and several inexpensive (by Paris standards) eating places. A small grocery store was also nearby. We had reserved a Segway tour starting at the Eiffel Tower. This was the highlight of Paris for us. The uniqueness of the Segway experience at the same time as viewing the beautiful monuments, museums, and other historical buildings will be something we will always remember. To get to the Charles De Gaul airport we simply took the number 8 metro to Opera and then the Roissy Bus from there. I would return to this hotel if we find ourselves in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Du Cadran is a wonderful place to stay. I took my wife to Paris for her birthday. We'd never been and have long wanted to visit. We travel quite a bit and expected a small room so were not surprised by its size. It was small and homey. We did however find the bathroom to be one of the cleanest in any hotel we have ever stayed in. And that is a priority for my wife. We chose to upgrade our room to a deluxe for the king size bed (actually 2 singles pushed together but was no problem), which gave us a few more square feet. Itâ€™s a nice quiet place with great cafes and fruit and bread shops right around the corner. Definitely stop in and buy your water before heading out as it will save you quite a bit of money. The hotel staff was delightful and made us feel immediately at home. They answered our many questions about the language (how to say certain phrases or ask for things), places to visit, and travel around the city, which we found very helpful. The continental breakfast was great and a good way to start off the day. As others have written the Metro day pass is the way to go. Everything, and I mean everything, in Paris is just steps away from a Metro stop. Maximize your time by using a Metro map when planning your sightseeing destinations. Hotel Du Cadran we will definitely stay with you again! P.S. For you Americans that think the French hate us, they most definitely do not. They may find some of us loud, pushy, and obnoxious because we think that we are better than everyone. As you travel to foreign destinations respect the differences in culture and learn from them. Americans don't do everything better and other countries shouldn't "do it the way that we do". A few phrases in the local language go a long way to making your travels much more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “A nice wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: smarti
Reviews.Content: If you read the reviews you'll expect that the rooms will be small and ours was. Apart from that though the room was great in a functional sense. The ensuite shower room was very clean and general housekeeping standard was high. Location was also excellent with good local brasseries, a little street market around the corner, and a little supermarket across the road. Oh, and the Metro 3 minutes walk away. We have no qualms in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Du Cadran 10 Rue Du Champs De Mars in Paris. I would like to comment on what a lovely hotel it was. The service was excellent, answered all our questions and gave a great recomendation for dinner. The room was clean. The location was great, 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Du Cadran on our next trip to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel du Cadran”
Reviews.Author: mayjog
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old daughter and I stayed at the Hotel du Cadran the first week in October for our first trip to Paris. The rooms were small but we expected that. It is a very clean hotel in a quiet neighborhood. It was perfect for us. There are lots of good places to eat close by. The Ecole Militaire metro stop is less than a 5 minute stroll from the hotel. The staff was very friendly & spoke perfect English. We loved this hotel & would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: dazsin
Reviews.Content: I travelled alone to Paris for 4 days, and I stopped here. The staff were absolutely magnificent, helping me out with the metro, pointing me in the direction of good resteraunts, and all spoke english superbly. The room was faultless, all in all one of my favourite hotels I have ever stopped in.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The size of the room is typically European, but the staff were courteous and extremely helpful. The hotel is located off the busy main streets and is located near many wonderful restaurants and cafes. It is a short walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Subway, which provides easy access to all the sites around Paris. Would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location and the courteous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the staff is courteous. Except the my room is near the elevator and on top of the kitchen. When someone use the elevator my bed move. When I open my room window I smell the food from the kitchen. Other than that the hotel locate in the excellent area close to the subway the Rue the cler Market. I have a great time I will choose this Hotel again when I return to Paris. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Brill hotel in a Brill location!”
Reviews.Author: marbelina
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Cadran lived up to all it's great reviews on Trip Advisor. It's the perfect place to stay for a citybreak to Paris. This hotel has it all ~ a short walk from the Eiffel Tower, the Metro, shops, bars, restaurants ~ the hotel is very clean and is airconditioned (very much appreciated when we were there!) ~ the staff are friendly and helpful ~ the breakfast although continental is more than adequate. Paris itself far exceeded our expectations. It is a beautiful city, very green, and the people are very friendly. The Metro is very easy to use and also very clean! Thank you to all past Trip Advisors members for their reviews on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Hotel du Cadran for our second anniversary. I did lots of research trying to find a hotel in Paris that would be both nice and not to crazily expensive, and picked the Cadran from its reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel was in a great location, just a 10-min walk from the Eiffel Tower and near a metro stop. We were able to stroll up to the Eiffel Tower a few times to see it by day and by night. Also, the immediate area had lots of nice cafes, as well as a supermarket and a nice bakery. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They all spoke excellent English and were great at recommending and booking a restaurant for us, and sorting out taxis and bus times that we needed. The reception area in the hotel was also a bonus. We were waiting there for a while after we checked out, before it was time to go to the airport. There are nice squashy couches and a variety of books to read (which you can also borrow for the duration of your stay). There is a room where the hotel will store your luggage for you after you check out. Our room was comfortable and the bathroom was sparklingly clean. Breakfast was fine - cereal, bread, croissants, juice and coffee. At least it was complimentary, which is not the case in all Paris hotels. Overall, I would say if you are looking for a nice hotel for less than â‚¬200 a night, the Hotel du Cadran is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay And A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending far too much money on an engagement ring, my surprise trip to Paris seemed to be in doubt. However I then managed to find Du Cadran on TripAdvisor! Not wanting to spend lots of money on hotel bills but at the same time wanting to be in the middle of paris as close to the Eiffel Tower as possible was going to be a tough one but the reviews on here seemed to speak for themselves. When Emailing the hotel to book, I requested a corner room with a view of the Eiffel Tower as advised but other users on here. They said they would try but couldn't promise. On arrival the room was waiting for us, and we were over the moon to see the view from the window! I would be lying if I was to say that the room was big, but for the two of us it was fine. Clean and tidy with a safe, tv, and mini bar. Breakfast was good, with a variety of food and drink on offer, and the staff were very plesant and friendly at all times. I will stay at Du Cadran again and would back up all the previous positive comments made on this site. ......oh and she said yes by the way!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel du Cadran”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Cadran was a great place to stay when we visited Paris. It is centrally located within walking distance form most of the major attractions in Paris and about 2 blocks from the Metro. The staff were friendly, the included continental breakfast was good and the rooms, though small by North American standards, were clean and comfortable. Good restaurants were also within a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not only is Hotel du Cadran very centrally located within minutes of the Eiffel Tower, Hotel des Invalides, Musee de Rodin, rue Cler, but also some of the best restaurants in town...even next door. The management/staff is extremely generous, thoughtful, helpful, friendly, multilingual. The lobby environment is that of a very comfortable and friendly environment... and definitely worth the money. The rooms are very clean, typical size for a Paris hotel, but definitely worthwhile. Mattresses could use an upgrade, and the breakfast is fine and included. Overall you will not be disappointed when you stay here. Great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Chloworm
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Hotel du Cadran. The reception staff were very friendly and it was nice to stay in a cosy, clean and pretty room. This hotel is in a perfect location - so close to the metro and the Eiffel Tower, but it's also peaceful. Can highly recommend the busy cafes nearby, head for where the locals seem to be for the best value and tastiest food. There is also a good bakery and pattiserie down the road. We would have liked fresh milk at breakfast though!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lupu21London
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from a short break to Paris; we stayed for three nights at Hotel Du Cadran and we can't recommend the hotel highly enough. Situated in an ideal spot, the Eiffel Tower is a 5 minute stroll away and the nearest Metro station, L'ecoile Militaire, is also within a short walk and has easy access to all the popular Parisian landmarks. There's a supermarket directly opposite and a few nice cafÃ©'s and restaurants nearby too. Despite this, the noise level doesn't keep you awake at night or wake you early in the morning. Our room wasn't as tiny as some of the above reviews would have you believe; it contains an enormous double bed and even with our large suitcases dumped on the floor we didn't have to squeeze past one another on the way to the (very clean) bathroom. Breakfast is a standard continental affair, croissants, cereal, bread etc and taken in a cozy cavern in the hotel's basement. The staff were very welcoming, fluent in English and always helpful with directions, advice etc. We had a few questions before arriving and they were happy to answer these on the phone. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: four of us traveled to paris and staying at the du cadran was an ideal location..within walking distance to all attractions..a market area is around the corner(rue cler)..cafes and shops everywhere...and the other end of the block is a pastry shop( don't pass it up)..enjoy the tarts..complimentary breakfast was very good..bagettes,croissants.coffe,juice.cereal and fruits..great way to start the day..rooms are typical,,small but very clean..we would stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: TallyCrew
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the du Cadran. My wife, two children and I had a marvelous time here. The location can't be beat! Who wouldn't like to take a ten minute walk down the beautiful tree-lined streets of Paris and be at the Eiffel Tower. The Ecole Militaire Metro Station is around the corner and there are also conveniences such as a pharmacy and laundromat within a block. Not to mention all the shops and cafes. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. The rooms were smallish, but clean, modern and more than adequate. The neighborhood is family friendly....quiet and quaint. We absolutely loved it, and, if we ever get over the trauma of flying out of Charles De Gaulle airport and decide to return to Paris, we would definitely stay at the du Cadran.

Reviews.Title: “So many good things to say”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am 26 year-old American woman who just returned from a 3 day trip to Paris with my mother. This hotel was adorable and exceeded all of our expectations. It is great for someone who is spending a few days in Paris and who wants to be in close walking distance to the eiffle tower and more in a neighborhood atmosphere. The hotel atmosphere is warm and quaint. Good points: 5 minute walk from subway station 10 minute walk to eiffle tower safe area that isn't too noisy at night staff very friendly and speak english and french very well rooms clean and bathrooms are modern bedding clean and in good condition pretty decor and windows that open with flowers hanging (decor very feminine) breakfast included (may have to book in advance) small hotel elevator you can leave you bags before check-in and after check-out in the baggage room (this is really important because you don't want to be dragging your bags around Paris) Great value for price! Negative Points: hotel rooms small (normal for Paris) bed is a little hard (normal for Paris) area is quiet at night if you are looking for a lot of action not extremely glamorous or fancy

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, perfect location. Eiffel Tower only a 10 minute walk through the beutiful streets in Paris. Metro station only 3 minute walk, so you can go almost anywhere, and still be close to your hotel by metro. The area is extremely safe, and clean. Yes, there was a bit of construction, but nothing bothersome (they were finished by the time we left). The room was small, but to be expected... but who stays in the room anyway? You have all of Paris to explore (bring good walking shoes!). Also recommed the l'open tour bus, takes you all around major tourist sites in Paris, get on and off as you like. They make stops frequently. Breafast was good, croissants, cereal, ham, cheese, coffee, juice. Great Hotel, would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses And Minuses”
Reviews.Author: adzonni
Reviews.Content: ok- staff very helpful, air cond. works off and on, breakfast nice, location very fine, rooms are Tiny, beds hard. Neighborhood street being worked on a lot. not their fault. good middle class digs.

Reviews.Title: “Made a great trip even better....”
Reviews.Author: Beans2007
Reviews.Content: It being my first trip to Europe, I was pretty nervous about the accomodations, especially since all of the big name hotels were ridiculously expensive. We booked a room for a week at du Cadran because of the great reviews here, and they were all correct. The rooms are small...but get over it, you'll be sleeping there and that's it! The bathrooms are very nice, showers work well, clean and recently re-done. The Hotel is right off of Rue Cler, a market street that is filled with great bakeries and restaurants, and a great wine shop with two very friendly english-speaking gentlemen who go out of their way to help you pick out some great wines to take home! The breakfast in the morning is fine, but I would suggest going to Rue Cler and getting it at any of the little cafes, it is better and less expensive. The hotel is also a short walking distance from the Eiffel tower, Les Invalides, and a Metro stop. It is in a safe and quiet neighborhood, but a little removed from everything else. If you're up for drinking and partying, head to the Latin Quarter, this is not the neighborhood! The nearby metro stop is perfect though, as you'll get anywhere in the city in no time at all - with a little practice, of course! You can count on the friendly staff who are more than willing to get you anywhere you want to go. Do not hesitate to ask for recommendations on restaurants, activities, tours, etc., they are very helpful and will get you right there. Also, contact the hotel after booking the rooms and they'll arrange airport transportation. It's reasonably priced and it's nice not have to worry about it when you get off the long flight. Overall, a great place to stay that left a very good impression on my first trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautifully clean. Excellent location. Friendly, happy and helpful staff. We stayed 3 nights and enjoyed every second. A few steps away from the Rue Cler with its antiques market, cheese and wine shops, cafes and pattiseries. Easy walking distance from Ecole Militaire Metro and a five minute stroll to the Eiffel Tower. We had a standard room which was pefectly adequate but when we return we will definitely upgrade to a superior room. Would not hesitate to recommend the Cadran to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael_D78
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a weekend spent staying at this hotel and I cannot praise it enough. The staff are warm and friendly, the hotel is clean and the location is excellent. The hotel is very near the Ecole Militaire Metro stop and within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. The area is quiet and safe at night and the nearby Rue Cler market is delightful. The room was small as has been highlighted before but it was comfortable and clean - and you spend little time in it anyway with such a great city to explore. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay again if (when!) I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: linnie
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many European hotels I can say the room we had was the smallest I have ever seen. My husband took the chairs from the room and put them in the hall. The bed was not comfortable nor were the pillows. On the plus side the free breakfast offered in the morning gave us a nice start. It was served by a very nice gentleman. The mini bar in the room was handy to keep our cheese, soda and yogurt chilled. The bathroom was quite nice. We overlooked the street (only one floor up) so it was noisy at times. For as much time as we spent in the room the size did not really matter. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful....they had all the answers for our many questions. The computer in the lobby was available for a few euros. The location was the BEST. We walked over to the Eiffel Tower many evenings after dinner and strolled around the Seine. I found all of Paris to be safe and clean...which is more than I can say for American big cities. The people (on the streets) were very friendly to us...we had taken French lessons prior to our trip so we could say a few phrases..It was well worth it. For Paris I think the price was very reasonable and would not hesitate to book this hotel again. Paris is my favorite city in the world so I know I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Delightful”
Reviews.Author: mybichons
Reviews.Content: What a delightful little hotel. The entire staff was so very friendly. Excellent location. Really liked the mix of residential, restaurants, shopping and the metro stop was just a few blocks. Very quiet neighborhood. The rooms are small but most European hotels have smaller rooms than Americans are used to. Felt very safe in this neighborhood. Would stay at this hotel again and have already recommended it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Should be a 5 Star hotel for for price, location, and quality!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: (February 4th -8th, 2005) Wow, what , more can I say, I must be honest going on my Paris trip to a new hotel I had never been to before in a country 5,000 miles away from home, I didn't know quite what to expect, and had heavy reservations about what type of hotel I would be staying in! I must say I planned a trip for me and my girlffriend and could not be any more happier with this hotel! The thing that makes this hotel so pleasant is its friendly staff, they had helped me make shuttle reservations, and helped me out with all the crucial things I needed, even before I arrived to Paris! They even helped me out with directions all throughout my trip in February to Paris! I just want to say this, for those of you, who are contemplating this hotel, I had the same issue and wasn't for sure but I can honestly say this is the BEST hotel for the price and the location sits right near the Eiffel Tower, in fact I requested a room on the top floor with it right outside my window!
