Just a special thanks to Sonja, Natalia, Emilie for making us feel not as vistiors but right at home! I recoommend this hotel so much that I decided to not only write a good review but include pictures to help make people that are quite for sure more at ease with the quality and cleaniness of their decision! Rooms are not real big, but bathrooms are nice and for the price and the location, the Hilton could not even compare! The location is even right down the street from a small place that will surpringly convert your moeny for free, which me and my girlfriend were amazed at, and right near a post office and many shops and cafes! I will not book at any other hotel after going to this one because it gave me a small sense of home away from home! They even arranged excellent shuttle arrangements with Golden Air, one of France's most reliable shuttle services in Paris, highly recoommend for all thos ewho need ride from airport to hotel! Take my word you can't go wrong with the Hotel Du Cadran, for the price, friendliness, LOCATION, and hospitality, no hotel compares, bar none!

Reviews.Title: “Way Way Over-Rated”
Reviews.Author: alexqueso
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8-night stay at this property. I'm not sure what most people who have posted comments are looking for, but our experiences were quite different. In summary: Pluses: Hotel is situated in a neighborhood area adjacent to the Eiffel Tower, and very close to the L'ecole Militaire metro stop. Bathroom was pretty decent. In-room safe. Quaint cobblestone street right next to the property which contains a variety of market items including flowers, fruits & vegetables etc. Negatives: Bed was very hard, pillow were paper thin, walls in the hotel have virtually no soundproofing (people just opening a door sounded very loud), furniture is very old and tattered, electrical outets did not work with adapter, breakfast was mediocre, staff was not rude but also not overly friendly, one "community iron" which was filled with gunk on soleplate. Area is too far away from the better dinner/night spots. Net-Net: This is 2-star star hotel max. Don't let anyone tell you otherwise. If you want a nice place to stay, but not something outrageous -look elsewhere. I have a bunch of recommendations for other places to stay. My wife and I (late 30's) loved Paris and are planning a return trip, but definitely NOT at this place. We have a couple other spots in the Latin Quarter/St. Germain already picked out.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Cadran is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: BPSRCalais
Reviews.Content: This little hotel has a wonderful staff, a fantastic location, and modern amenities. The rooms are absurdly tiny - but they come with a refrigerator, a desk, two chairs and room to turn around - if no one else is in the room at the same time.Bathroom was spacious and the entire place was squeeky clean and well maintained. Desk staff all speak excellent English and are very helpful and welcoming. There is probably no better location in all of Paris if you are looking for a great neighborhood with super affordable restaurants and wonderful shops.

Reviews.Title: “Loved L'hotel du Cadran”
Reviews.Author: ddonaghe
Reviews.Content: The location alone would be enough to give this place a five star review. It is in a charming little neighborhood complete with a very smelly (but splendid!) cheese shop and, of course, a cafe. We also frequented a fabulous pastry shop nearby and found our room accomodations extremely pleasant. I have traveled through Greece and England and I found this room to be above the standards of Greek accomodations and on par with those of England. The room was comfortable and very clean-- with a bathroom that was superior by European standards. The only reason I knocked one star off this review is that the desk staff was a bit cold (only at the desk though, perhaps because we were Americans?-- the staff at breakfast were very, very polite). It's a wonderful little hotel in an ideal location and I would certainly stay there again. In fact, I have to say Paris itself was spectacular and well beyond what I expected. We stayed here in June of 2004.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel! Definately recommend!”
Reviews.Author: mculle12
Reviews.Content: Hotel Du Cadran is a brilliant hotel in the perfect location. Great prices for a perfect weekend in Paris. It is in a quiet street just blocks away from the Eiffel Tower and great for French restaurants that are unknown to most tourists! The staff were very polite and accomodating and made great restaurant recommendations! Rooms were clean and bed very comfy! If i returned to Paris I would definately stay again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel that is wonderfully located! The Eiffel Tower is only a few blocks away, as is Hotel des Invalides. There is a Metro stop just around the corner, and a bus line just down the street. Around the corner is the very Parisian Rue Cler - be sure to pick up fresh fruit and bagettes for your lunch! The hotel room is very small, but you don't have much time to spend in the hotel when there is such a marvelous city to explore. The amenities are very modern. It is tricky to work around suitcases, but certainly is no hardship. The breakfast is ample, although a bit monotonous. We discovered that we could purchase a croissant and coffee around the corner for much more money! If you really need a serving of eggs and bacon, there is a restaurant on Rue Cler. The hotel staff could not have been friendlier. Everyone speaks English and is most accommodating. We had a wonderful stay (Jan. 12 - 18), and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, but a good base for a stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Du Cadran for 4 nights 18-21 Jan in one of their 'superior' rooms. I did not feel a sense of 'charm' about this hotel and would compare it more to a upmarket hostel. The rooms are small and not at all what i would consider 'superior.' In saying that though, the hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff are more than helpful. I would avoid including breakfast when staying here. 1 croissant and a cup of coffee is not exactly the breakfast i had hoped for at 10euros each morning. The hotel is a good base located 2 minutes walk from the nearest metro.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel and its recently been refurbished”
Reviews.Author: dcdogmom
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. We just retruned from a 4 day stay over New Years. As always, the staff helped us with dinner reservations and sent us to great places to eat. In my opinion, the rooms are above average for this neighborhood and Paris in general. They do have some larger rooms with 2 twins set up as a King sized bed. We always ask for one of those. We noticed that the rooms had recently been repainted and they put new bedspreads on during our stay. Rooms have a minibar and bathrooms are big. The staff at du Cadran is wonderful. We always rely on them to help us with restaurants and they have sent us to some really good ones. If you are looking for an American style hotel go someplace else and pay alot more. But if you want a nice clean, pleasant place to stay in a lovely neighborhood this is your place. We have sent at least 5 other couples here and they were all very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel in Dec 04. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean but very tiny (bathroom was nice). We liked the location of the hotel. The breakfast was simple but good. Not a bad hotel for a couple but would not recommend it for a family due to the extremely small room size. Overall....not bad. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights in this hotel. Was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews. We stayed in room 202. The room was very small but everything was spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was a bit disappointing as the choice was very limited but we didn't go hungry and the staff were very polite and friendly. Don't bother looking for the Papa Bistro as it has closed down but I can recommend the Cafe de Felice - just 2 minutes from the hotel. The waiter speaks perfect English and was incredibly nice & helpful. Everything everyone has already said about the location we found to be true.

Reviews.Title: “The Paris you imagine.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This quaint hotel is close to the Eiffel Tower. Rooms are small but cute and clean. It provides what I expected as a first time visitor to Paris. The staff was nice and helpful. Smoking is a problem but no more than in most European hotels. I would visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: George88
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days in France, and spent two nights at this hotel. We were in Paris for four days (stayed at the Observatoire-Luxembourg), took the train to Lyon, and returned to Paris for two days before flying home. These last two nights were spent at the Hotel du Cadran based on Trip Advisor reviews. We opted to stay at two different hotels on this "split trip" to Paris to experience different neighborhoods and to compare. The Hotel: we were VERY disappointed with the condition of this hotel, especially after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. While the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the hotel itself is run down and tired. We were traveling with another couple, so we had the advantage of comparing two rooms (207 and 407). Both rooms were depressing, had stained carpeting and chairs with ripped/frayed upholstery. The closet was so small that it was basically unusable. The beds were miserably uncomfortable--the mattresses were so hard that it was like sleeping on the floor. The bathroom was clean, but the towels were shabby and worn thin, and the shower curtain was dingy. There was nothing charming about this hotel except the lobby and the staff. The Location: we found the neighborhood to be delightful. The location is near Rue de Cler with numerous markets--several small bistros and pastry shops, cheese shops, and wine shops. A metro station is close-by, and the Eiffel Tower is within walking distance. We would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fit the bill perfectly”
Reviews.Author: lawoffice
Reviews.Content: My wife and I selected the Du Cadran because of location and other posts which were very complimentary. All of it is true. We were there 9-10-04 to 9-14-04. While the rooms are small, the staff is great, going out of their way to answer questions and provide services. It is literally down the street from the Rue Cler, the unique cobblestoned street of a variety of small shops. There were apparantly many Rick Steves readers around, as we heard his name mentioned by others, several times. The neighborhood is indeed fabulous and the village-type pace presents an inviting atmosphere. The lobby offers many different newspapers, tea, other drinks, and a nice offering of books. We were able to walk to the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, the D'Orsay, and other venues. A great choice.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointing ...”
Reviews.Author: CACTeam
Reviews.Content: After reviewing your site for this hotel, I duly booked for my husband, myself and four friends to stay here for a four-night break. Our flight from the UK was 5 hours late so we didn't arrive at the hotel until 12.30am. The staff were very friendly and helpful but the hotel itself had obviously seen better days! Our friends were placed on the first floor whereas my husband and myself were on the fourth floor {why do hotels put people travelling together at opposite ends of the hotel??}. Our room was very small and cramped [as expected from information given here] but the carpet was stained and dirty and the bedspread was made of a nylon material - also with dirty marks and stains. The wardrobe had 5 hangers and enough space to hang a few items of clothes. So we did not unpack our cases for the duration of our stay as we had nowhere to hang them. Breakfast was typically French and adequate but the limited choices offered made each successive day less appealing. We have become accustomed in Spain, Germany and the UK to a large selection of cheeses, meats, yoghurts, fruit, bacon etc. and the lack of this choice made breakfast very predictable and - for me - unappetising! I loved the area. Shops, restaurants and cafes abound. I think though next time, we'd look for a slightly better hotel in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RKMLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and loved the location. So close to the Eiffel Tower, tons of cafes and restaurants around, the fabulous Rue Cler market just outside, and just a few minutes walk to the Metro station. The room was pretty spacious by European standards with a big bed. The bathroom was very clean. The staff was pretty helpful, though they failed to fix our room phone, which was out the whole time we were there. Also, the breakfast is pretty skimpy -- a bowl of cereal and a measly croissant, but there must be a dozen boulangeries within a block of the hotel, so you can always find a better selection. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bertina
Reviews.Content: My wife and our two children (ages 8 and 6) just returned from a wonderful time in Paris. We spent our first four nights in Paris at this Hotel. It was perfect for our family as we had two adjoining rooms which had separate bathrooms. I was concerned reading other posts about the small rooms, but we though they were charming. The bathrooms were very very nice. We had breakfast included which was a great way to start each morning. We read about this area being the ideal location (next to the Rue Claire) in Rick Steves book. He did mention this hotel, but did not give it a good value rating. I would disagree. The staff was very nice and very helpful. If we ever go back to Paris, we would stay here again without hesitation. Now that we know our kids can handle forgeign travel (and we can handle our kids handleing foreign travel) we can't wait to return to Europe. Hopefully the dollar will strengthen as France is expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, but hotel has deteriorated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, the employees at this hotel were outstanding, everyone went out of their way to help make our stay pleasant. Very helpful and understanding people. However, the building has deteriorated since I first visited this hotel 4 years ago. The two rooms I stayed in were extremely small, even for Paris' standard. The first one was even smaller and they moved me to a new one, with a bit larger bathroom. The matresses were VERY hard; the towels were old and stained; leaky windows (rain); and dirty shower curtains. 4 hangers in the room and no space to put clothes, that was tough. The A/c worked o.k. (Tip: keep curtains closed). The elavator was small with no ventilation and was always smelly. Of course, no A/C in elevator, which was VERY slow. Location: My wife loved the location; quiet neighborhood close to several good small bistros and many pastry shops, cheese shops and wine shops. A metro station is close-by, but be advised that this metro line goes to only a few places, so you always need to connect with other lines to get to most places. The Bus (69) stops very close to the hotel so this was good and the RER is also close-by the Eifell tower. All in all- we had a wonderful stay in paris, but I think there are better hotels within this price range. The people made the difference!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Cadran Tour Eiffel
HotelInfo.Address: 10, rue du Champs de Mars, 75007 Paris, France
